story:
'Nordic Noir', or Scandinavian crime fiction, has become one of the most popular literary genres in the United Kingdom, the United States, and around the rest of the world over the last decade. In these books, we travel to the Nordic countries Denmark, Finland, Iceland, Norway and Sweden to immerse ourselves in gritty crimes, deeply humanistic tales of personal struggle, and the melancholic landscape. 

Literary reviewer & Freelance writer Sarah Surgey and Nordic film critic & Film Magazine editor Emma Vestrheim discovered a hole in the genre, and set out to combine BritCrime and Nordic Noir in the new 'Odense Series'. With this series, we want to combine these two worlds and place a British detective in surrounds of the central Danish city, Odense, where he is faced with some of the toughest crimes the country has seen. But, these are not just crime novels, they deal with issues that we as readers deal with in every day life, from grief, to family feuds and from cultural differences to combating our demons.

With your help, we can print The Odense Series and enhance Nordic Noir crime fiction with a British twist!

A Presence of Absence is the first book in The Odense Series. Although this is a solid crime novel, it also begins and ends with grief for many of the characters, personal demons and life decisions (which readers will most probably identify with).

A gritty murder case gets in the way of the characters everyday lives and sends the birthplace of Hans Christian Andersen, the Danish city of Odense, into a panic.

British detective Simon Weller escapes the fallout from the recent suicide of his Danish wife, Vibeke and heads out to her home city of Odense. But once there he is paired up with a local detective, Jonas, who is also about to hit rock bottom in his home life and they must overcome their differences and personal problems to try and catch one of the worst serial killers Odense has seen in many years.

The case takes them back into past decades as history starts catching up with some of the local inhabitants.

When Simon realises that his wife's suicide may not be all it seems and her name appears in the case, his integrity within the case is compromised, how far will he go to find out the truth of Vibeke's past and hide it from his already troubled police partner?

Back home in London Simon's family are struggling with their own web of lies and deceit and the family is falling apart.

With one family hiding a dark secret, the whole case is just about to reach breaking point.

 

A Presence of Absence is due for release on the 15th of April 2017. Those who participate via Indiegogo will receive it before the 1st of April 2017. The book cover has been designed by the talented artist Mike Godwin, head over to our website TheOdenseSeries.com to view more of his work.

We have an incredible story and series that will add to the genre and appeal to fans around the world, but what we don't have is a marketing and distribution budget. With your help, we'll be able to print, market and distribute the first novel of the series, A Presence of Absence, and the sequel, The Enlightened. 

Why not reach out to publishers?

Like every novel finding its feet, we have found self-publishing to be the best option for our new series. We are hoping with a strong audience we can pursue and succeed in exploring opportunities that come our way. Our main goal is to have the novel in your hands, and Indiegogo is the best place for this!

40% of all contributions raised will go to fulfilling perks and printing the novel in mass for a wider audience. Another 40% will go to marketing, blog tours, and advertising. 20% will be moved forward for the second novel in the series. 

We appreciate every donation big and small, and we want to give everyone who contributes something in return. See the full list of perks on the right and below. 

Sarah Surgey

Sarah Surgey is a 36 year old British feature writer for various magazines. She lives in the UK with her husband and 4 daughters. 

She has had an interest in all things Nordic for many years and has written about many genres within this subject for publication. Although British, she has Danish family and enjoys exploring Denmark and its culture whenever the opportunity arrives.

Sarah was brought up with crime books and inevitably has always had crime story scenarios going around inside her head. After interviewing many famous authors for different magazines within the Nordic literary circle and always knowing the answer to her question of "why did you start writing?" she felt now was her time to get her stories out there, for people to read!

Emma Vestrheim

Emma Vestrheim is the owner and editor-in-chief of Cinema Scandinavia, a Nordic film and television journal that analyses popular Nordic titles. Part of her work includes working with directors, actors and film-makers, and her numerous interviews with the biggest names in Nordic film and television have given her a privileged access to what makes Nordic narratives so successful. Cinema Scandinavia publishes bimonthly and is available in major Nordic film libraries.

Emma grew up in country Australia, and completed her degree in film and television in Melbourne. After finishing her studies she moved to Norway to pursue her interest in all things Nordic; not just film – Emma has fallen in love with the Scandinavian way of living (‘hygge’), modern Nordic cuisine, and the beautiful mountains and fjords of Western Norway, where she currently resides.

 

Thank you so much for supporting our series!

 

Other ways you can help

LIKE us on Facebook

FOLLOW us on Twitter 

Watch our personal progress of this campaign on Instagram @the_wormcatcher @emmavestrheim

Head on over to our website and sign up to our newsletter 

SHARE our campaign using the Indiegogo tools or the following link:

FAQ's

 

When will my perks be delivered?

All perks are going to be shipped at the end of March 2017.

story:
The North Valley Grimoire is an all new magic spy thriller, and I want to bring it directly to YOU, unfiltered, with all the bells and whistles that are only available through a crowdfunding campaign.
 

Read the sample chapter here!

I was offered different opportunities to have the book published traditionally, but I opted to publish it myself, starting with Kickstarter. It became the Most Funded & Most Backed Fiction Book of 2018 with nearly $75K Canadian and 1,000+ Backers! 

Now I'm bringing it to Indiegogo for a final few days before the print run!
 

All the bonuses included with your order

The book is 100% finished, and completely funded, so bonuses are already included with each package:

  • The Prestige Format book includes 10 color pictures throughout
  • Each book is signed
  • Your name will appear in the back (any name, @ or URL of your choice!)
  • Each shipped package includes a custom bookmark
  • Each shipped package includes stickers
  • Everyone receives a digital wallpaper pack for desktops, phones, etc.
  • And each book has TWO covers, front and back, exclusive to this ONE PRINTING ONLY special. After this printing, the books are shipped in September, and there will never be a 2nd printing of this edition (no more artwork, no exclusive covers, no signed editions).
     

On time delivery

Since the book is finished, I'm having it printed and shipped out in September 2018 (along with the eBook), and the Audiobook will be complete and links will be sent out in October 2018. 

There will be a crowdfunding-exclusive cover that won't appear anywhere else! For THIS PRINTING ONLY, a David Nakayama special variant will be available.

D.NA is Marvel's hottest cover artist, with his work appearing on Ant-Man, Deadpool, Venom, X-Men and more.

Here are some portfolio samples:

There will be ten (10) full-page comic book illustrations added throughout the book, done by the award-winning artist of RAT QUEENS, Roc Upchurch!

Jackson crafting a spell before it's too late

Agent Malek with his Desert Eagle

Every shipped package will include a limited edition bookmark!

Reviews from some of the biggest names in comics and the publishing world are already coming in for THE NORTH VALLEY GRIMOIRE!

 

“I love this book. Blake Northcott has seamlessly shifted genres and proven she’s as masterful in magic and fantasy as she was in superheroes and science-fiction. Don’t pick this up unless you’re prepared to not put it down.” ​  

- Mark Millar (Writer of Kick-Ass, Kingsman: The Secret Service, Marvel's Civil War, Old Man Logan)


"There is world-building going on all throughout fiction these days -- and then there is Blake Northcott taking it to another level. Telling the story of a magical conspiracy through the lens of teen adventure, The North Valley Grimoire is what would happen if James Patterson and J.K. Rowling had a baby and it grew up to be a best-seller." ​  

- Scott Lobdell (Hollywood screenwriter of blockbuster Happy Death Day, Marvel Comics writer of Uncanny X-Men and X-Factor) ​ ​  


"From the first paragraph, The North Valley Grimoire grabs the reader. And once it takes hold, it refuses to let go. Successfully fusing a spy thriller and supernatural adventure is not easy, not without losing key elements that make both genres so entertaining, but Blake Northcott delivers in full, face-melting force, all while building an immersive world that you will not want to leave. She has a real winner on her hands here!" ​ 

- Cullen Bunn (New York Times bestselling author of The 6th Gun, X-Men Blue, and Deadpool Assassin) ​ ​ 

 
"A razor sharp page-turner that seamlessly blends two worlds--a late 90s teen horror film, and a cat-and-mouse spy thriller where magic is a weapon. It's electric, and I've never read anything like it."  

- Rees Jones (co-author of Royals, with the world's #1 selling author, James Patterson) ​  


"Engaging, relevant and poignant! A deft combination of ancient magic and modern mayhem!"  

- Dan Panosian (Spawn, Thor, Captain America) ​ ​  


“The North Valley Grimoire is like the tight flashlight beam preceding you into a basement where you’re sure you heard something loud and wrong but you can’t help but explore, no matter what awaits.”  

- Adam Hughes (Wonder Woman, Catwoman, Gen13) ​  


"Anyone that knows me knows I hate magic, but after The North Valley Grimoire I'm changing my opinion. I blame Blake Northcott." ​  

- Jimmy Palmiotti (Harley Quinn, Power Girl)  


"Blake Northcott is one of the bright and shining stars of comics and literature. Her stories are told in unique and interesting perceptive, and are wholly entertaining." ​  

- Frank Cho (Hulk, Black Panther, Guardians of the Galaxy) ​ ​


"Horror has a compelling, new protagonist in Calista Scott, and a powerful, new voice in author Blake Northcott. Read this book...but do it with the lights on."  

- Bryan Edward Hill (Writer at DC's Detective Comics, Hollywood scriptwriter of Ash vs. The Evil Dead)


"Blake Northcott's stories are pure adventure, pressure cooked in a cauldron of heroism, pragmatism, and suspense. No one blends realism and fantasy like Blake, for hers is a resounding voice in these brave new worlds of her own making!"

- Gary Makries, Geeks of Doom

 

Printing 

All of the books, bookmarks, stickers, and t-shirts are printed in the USA to ensure the highest possible quality and the fastest delivery.

The books are printed in Akron, Ohio by a local business. They've been providing me with amazing customer service for all my previous crowdfunding campaigns, and always ensure top-quality results, delivered on time.

story:
What is Berfrois?

Berfrois is a literary-intellectual online magazine featuring essays, poems and curiosities. It is published daily.

What We Need

We need $25,000 of funding to continue publication for another year. 

The Results

Berfrois will remain publicly funded and free of advertisements. We will also redesign the Berfrois website this year.

Other Ways You Can Help

Tell your friends, tell your family, tell your neighbours. Cheers.

story:
The Future of Masculinity 

The Future of Masculinity is a zine project led by Next Gen Men, a small but mighty non-profit leading the conversations men & boys need to have. We are champions of positive masculinities and culture change. We spread hope.

With this zine, Next Gen Men leads you on a journey of self-reflection, an exploration of each dimension that makes up our modern, gender-informed lives — self, health, peers, culture and relationships. It’s a story about how masculinity, in all its forms, impacts people of all genders, and how those people — you, me, all of us, together  —  can reshape masculinity in turn.

It’s the zine we all need, with news-you-can-use and fresh views on how reimagining a plural, positive, progressive vision for masculinity can help each of us where we need it most — at home, at work, in our relationships, in our heads, and in how we engage with the turbulent world around us.

And you’ll get it from the horse’s mouth: from Next Gen Men’s cross-continent community, from our network of expert thought leaders, from the next generation of men themselves, and from NGM’s own in-house expertise, built-on more than a half-decade leading the conversations men & boys need to have.

The Future of Masculinity is more than the sum of its pages. It is a combination of ink, art, ideas and inspiration for a future where men & boys experience less pain and cause less harm. It’s a community-built blueprint for a better, fairer future. For everyone.

 

Be Part of the Change 

We need the help of supporters like you to make the Future of Masculinity a reality.

Our objective, through the zine, is to create a bold, thoughtful experience capable of positively impacting every person who picks it up.

To make that happen, we need $5,000 to cover the printing costs of printing 1,000 issues for backers, partners, and to put out into the world! Next Gen Men will take care of the rest.

What’s in it for you? Good question.

There is something for everyone in our variety of perks: 

  • Receive the personal satisfaction of making an impact and the public gratitude of having your name published in our zine. 
  • Get the most out of the interactive activities included in the zine with our printed copy of The Future of Masculinity. 
  • Spark brave conversations with Next Gen Men’s Cards For Masculinity, a card deck for boys to lead their own exploration of their bodies, their hearts, and the cultural norms they experience every day. 
  • An invitation to join the NGM community with a free 4-month NEXT GEN MENbership to NGM Circle Online - a private (read: no trolls), supportive online community for discussion, learning, sharing, and growing (up to $80 value).
  • Explore the gender equity topics that matter the most to you with a Personal Panel. Discuss with Next Gen Men's Executive Director Jake Stika, Breaking the Boy Code podcast host and Program Manager Jonathon Reed, and Modern Manhood podcast host German Villegas. 

 

Perks will be sent to contributors in November, just in time for Christmas! 

 

The work to build Next Gen Men’s positive, progressive vision for an inclusive future has made a splash.

With the campaign to put it in ink and on paper, that splash becomes ripples, emanating one after the other out into the world. That’s how this zine starts to multiply Next Gen Men’s impact.

Once it’s made, every time we put The Future of Masculinity into a new set of hands, the impact grows. Exponentially. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

The future won’t happen without your buy-in (not just your money, but also your action). Be part of the culture change by: 

  • Sharing the word of the Future of Masculinity on your social media with the hashtag #OurFutureMasculinity and tagging us at @nextgenmen on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram. 
  • Get involved in the creation of the magazine by participating in our Masculinity Photovoice Project! 

 

 

 

About Next Gen Men

We create spaces to engage, educate, and empower men and boys around gender. We’ve lead the nationwide conversation men and boys need to have. From schools to boardrooms, pubs to conferences—we are there. For the past six years we’ve provided programming across multiple settings and adapted to meet people where they are.

story:
Thanks everyone for helping make this campaign and my novel launch a success!  You can buy your signed copy of Pledge at:

http://www.guildmemoirs.com


Books are also available on Amazon: 

http://www.amazon.com/Pledge-The-Guild-Memoirs-ebook/dp/B00AX1ZC04/ref=tmm_kin_title_0?ie=UTF8&qid=1357405586&sr=1-8

 

ABOUT ME, THE NOVEL AND THIS CAMPAIGN

My name is Kip Pettigrew, I've been writing for as long as I can remember. I've finally decided to take my passion to the next level and publish one of my books.  Pledge is the first in a three book series, The Guild Memoirs.  I'm finishing the preparations for a Dec publish date and I am raising money to fund the paperback printing of the book.  If funding and demand is high enough I will also print hard back copies. 

 

WHAT THE FUNDING IS FOR:

  • Printing and publishing of the first edition of Pledge
  • Manuscript preparation and formatting
  • Copy editing and proofreading
  • Interior design and cover design
  • Delivery of books
  • E-Conversion

 

ABOUT THE GUILD MEMOIRS:

Your thoughts and opinions are not your own. For millennia human civilization has been led and influenced by secret guilds made up of individuals who, at all times, transmit their feelings and personality to the unknowing masses. They control public opinion. They are why good men die for causes they don’t believe in. They are why you feel strongly about things that should not concern you. The Guild Memoirs is the life story of one such telepath and how his life has affected us all.

 

Pledge: Troy Williamson was a typical boy in a dysfunctional American family. That life ended the day he began telepathically influencing those around him. Unable to return home, Troy becomes a pledge of the Noreastern Guild, one of the secret societies that control regional identity and belief. As he struggles to master his abilities, Troy discovers he has gifts different even from his fellow telepaths and secrets he dare not share, even with his mentor. Troy hopes to become a guild brother and help mankind, but his power could be the biggest threat the guild has ever known.

 

WHAT YOU GET FOR CONTRIBUTING

-Electronic versions available for:

  • IPad reader

  • Kindle

  • Nook

  • Kobo

-Signed Paper back copies

If demand  is high enough, hard back copies

- I will help you with your resume or cover letter

- I will write you into the novel

For a higher contribution I will replace an existing character with you or someone you know.  These are minor roles and references but the more significant the contribution the more significant the role will be. 


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:

  • Check out the official webpage: www.guildmemoirs.com
  • Preorder your copies today and spread the word
  • Tell others about my novel and this campaign
  • Enjoy the book

story:
To my friends, family and friends of friends, I really need your help. Your donation whatever amount and your willingness to pass on my project site to others you know for their consideration is greatly appreciated. I can't spell S  CCESS without U!  Please paste this in your FB, send it via email and shout to all, T needs our help. Thank you!

 

Absolutely!

Are you a person of worth? My guess is that you are, but as we all know, life is about overcoming obstacles and challenges that continuously push us to be better than where and who we are in an effort to become the best we can be. The process can be overwhelming and exhausting at times, which is why having a coach, cheerleader, or mentor as a  support system makes a big difference. Through my book,  I want to be that person for YOU! 

I've spent my career as a life/fitness coach, and nutrition expert helping people just like you to improve in all areas of life. In my sessions with clients, we talk about the characteristics of a person of worth and what it means to have a purposeful belief system that includes boundaries and goals that will lead to living, intentionally.

Through the hard work and dedication that I've put into improving my clients' lives, I've cultivated a very successful 7 step process that digs much deeper than "think positive" or "count calories" or "get your aerobic workouts in." I uncover the deep, core belief system of my clients, and which we all inherit, and help them knock down the old and rebuild a new, purposeful belief system that serves them better at any stage of life.  

Through my life's experiences, I've determined that:

A woman of worth is a diamond.

A man of a worth is a gold nugget.

A teenager of worth is a diamond or a gold nugget in the making.

A person of worth awakes each day looking for the gifts  to open around them.

A person of worth takes full responsibility for their lives. 

A person of worth knows that they can only bring change to those things of which   they are aware.

A person of worth recognizes that their negative belief systems came from their childhood, circumstances and or others in their life.

A person of worth doesn't deny their inherited belief system, but reflects, evaluates, and acknowledges both the negative and positive belief systems.

The 7 steps process helps you be able to forgive and choose to let go so you can be free and open to create and build your own positive belief system that represents who YOU choose to be and where YOU desire to go.

The Table of Contents for my book outline the 7 steps:

1. Attributes of Being a Person of Worth

2. Uncovering Your Belief System - Tree and Roots

3. Building Your New Belief System - Starfish

4.  Importance of Boundaries and Goal Setting to create a No Fail                 Environment.

5. Fitness and Nutrition

6. Relationships - Personal and Professional - Done Right

7. Become the Diamond/Gold Nugget you are or one in the making

When you choose to back this project, you're choosing to help improve not only your own life, but those of potentially countless people.

Steps to a successful project ie publishing my book

I'm working with two very talented ghostwriters to complete this book project so it can be the best possible book available. It will contain information that you've never read in another self-help, inspirational book. Your donation helps to cover the ghostwriting fees as well as the cost of publishing, printing, and marketing.

My larger vision...

My book is the beginning of a bigger vision.  I have a desire to have a center where my book is lived out.  Eventually, centers in major cities across the USA.  The center will be a place to coach kids, teens and adults on personal development from the inside out.  We will provide mentorship in teaching them how to be leaders and live life with intention and purpose.

I appreciate each and every donation, and because helping people improve their lives is my #1 goal, I've committed gift awards for different contribution levels that are sure to help the many of you who donate.

Thank you!

If you haven't already, please take a moment to watch the video and watch my client's testimony on the next tab.

Tamara

Risks and challenges

Adversity and challenge are part of life. They bring a positive and compelling reason to take action. Believe & Be, my life's work in helping others, will become a book. I see it, I feel it, and I know it. I need your help and belief in my project to succeed. I am so excited!

With your support, I will achieve my funding goal of $10,000. With a successful campaign, my book will be completed and ready for publishing by October, 2013. The funds I am raising will go largely to the ghost writers I have hired ie interview me, write, edit, revise and finalize it for publishing. I plan to publish 300 copies, initially.

John Peragine and Heather Hummel , my professional ghost writers, have years of experience in professional writing. Heather's books have appeared in Publishers Weekly, USA Today, and the Washington Post. She's received many writing awards. John has written over a dozen books, has an advanced degree in Natural Health, and written for a number of magazines and newspapers. Together, John and Heather offer me the expertise to get my book written and published. In early June, I traveled form Sacramento to Charlottesville, VA. to meet with John and Heather for 4 days. We are off and running. I've drained my bank account for my initial deposit of $4,000 for their work. I have a publisher ready. The book will be softbound and ebook ready. I plan to publish, initially, 300 copies of my book to honor my awards outlined in this project site. Each copy is approximately, $5. So,$1,500 of my $10,000 will go to awards. The balance of the funds will go to my writing team, John and Heather.

Challenges are good. I've had many in my life as we all do. I will make it happen. However, I know this, I can't spell S CCESS with U. Your kind gift/donation will help make my dream come true. I am so excited.

Thank you!
Tamara
"T"

My BIO

I believe that in order to lead an intentional successful life it must start with a healthy belief system. Out on the street at ,15, I had to learn how to survive in a world filled with lures and temptations. My belief system, or lack thereof due to family dysfunctions, was challenged on a daily basis. Knowing that this was not the life I desired nor chose, I sought out people with wisdom, faith-based mentorship, and dedicated myself to discovering and building a stronger foundation or belief system. I met people along my journey that allowed me to better understand the power of a worthy and valued belief system. It was with this awareness, I could then begin to truly live, believe and be not held back by a destructive and/or dysfunctional belief system. I took personal responsibility for re-inventing my new, healthy belief system (mine, not others).

I have led a busy life as an entrepreneur, life coach, personal trainer, and struggling single mom, but made a commitment to raising my two daughters, ensuring they had a healthy belief system along with a strong faith-based foundation. I and my daughters wanted to share the work we did with our own belief systems. In 2006, we created “Faith Girls” to teach other young girls how to build a strong, belief system, and to walk confidently in just "being". My experiences since age 15, the wonderful people I met along the way, my motherhood, my faith, and my desire to learn more, gave me a knew sense of purpose and passion. I wanted to help other people grow in their own self-esteem, belief system and to help them gain their personal power back. In 2011, as a fitness and life coach, I created Intentional Living (iLiving), then Women of Intention in 2012. And, Women of Worth was born in March, 2013.

Women of Worth or “WOW” will help women discover their true inner strength and beauty by building a stronger, more vibrant belief system. The goal of WOW is to build a life of worth and value, from the inside out.

I need your belief in my passion and conviction to help bring my book, Believe & Be, to life and in the hands of many.

 

Thank you!!!

story:
Campaign Update #3

Covet Garden Home is officially a go! We have reached our Indiegogo Campaign goal. Thanks to all who have contributed to and shared news of our project!

There's still time to contribute to the campaign, and remember, kick in $30 or more and you'll also get a copy of our wonderful print magazine.

Campaign Update #2:

Illustrator Alanna Cavanagh has generously donated one more print to our crowd funding campaign. Which means that there is one more opportunity to choose our "Penthouse" perk

Campaign Update #1:

We've added two new perks to the Covet Garden Home Indiegogo campaign. If you live in Toronto, you and a friend can be our guests for a delightful afternoon of tea, treats and conversation. Or, take advantage of our special skills and let the Covet Garden team of Jessica, Lynda and Rhonda personally help you tell your own decor story.

 

"Covet Garden is one of the few magazines that I make time for the minute I see it's come live online. Covet Garden always succeeds in giving me more of exactly what I'm looking for—inspiring homes and the great stories behind their inhabitants."

I really am such a fan! Good luck!”

 —Victoria Smith, sfgirlbybay.com

We launched the online lifestyle magazine Covet Garden with a mission to give you a rare peek into the lives and homes of people with lots of imagination who have decorated their living spaces by themselves.

While people love the online magazine, the most frequent question we hear is, When will you have a print edition?

We want to make that happen.

Our plan is to produce what we are calling Covet Garden Home—a 100+ page half magazine/half book  will explore more about inventive spaces by revisiting your favourite homes from past issues of Covet Garden PLUS featuring brand-new environments, DIY projects and food and drink ideas. Our goal is to deliver printed and bound copies to our readers by Winter 2013.

Why are we asking for help? We haven’t charged anything to bring you Covet Garden magazine online, but a print version means additional production costs such as paper, printing and shipping from the printing press to our offices and then to our readers.

In short, we’d like to raise $18,000 to help cover these necessary expenses. This figure is not the full project cost; we hope to make money (and spread the word about Covet Garden) by selling the print edition in stores and through booksellers as well as online. 

Here's where the $18,000 that we’re trying to raise will go:

Creating New Content

We know you love our past features, but we also want to make the print version a new experience. Which is why we want to photograph new spaces, bring you updates on past homeowners and novel DIY projects and food and drink ideas for entertaining.

Production

We want to use the best possible paper and technology so that the special print edition of Covet Garden will be a resource you’ll want to keep forever. It’s also important to us to have it printed locally rather than overseas.

Thanks for visiting this campaign page.  We really appreciate all the support that we've gotten from you, our amazing readers!

We understand that times are tough, but if you can help spread the word through Facebook or Twitter, we would be eternally grateful. And if you can contribute, please use the IndieGoGo share tools to help pass the news along.

story:
Women Of The World Poetry Slam

Mary McDonough is a writer, teacher & community organizer based in Denver. For the past seven years she has taught over 1000 students in the mediums of poetry & performance. She has competed in two National Poetry Slams, finishing in the top 4 in 2014. She has coached five Denver Minor Disturbance youth slam teams, all of which appeared on final stage at the Brave New Voices poetry festival, two of which won international championship titles. Mary is looking forward to representing Denver Mercury Cafe at her second appearance at the Women of the World Poetry Slam in March.

The Women of the World Poetry Slam is the largest poetry gathering of its kind, bringing together over 70 woman identified poets from around the world. More than a competition, this event is a transformative space centering around the myriad intersections of women's experiences the world over through the art of spoken word. This year's festival will take place from March 18-22 in Albuquerque, New Mexico.

In order to participate & contribute to this event Mary is hoping to raise enough to cover the cost of travel.


Funding Breakdown

  • $200: Gas & rental car
  • $150: Lodging for the week of March 18-22
  • $150: Meals
  • $100: Merchandise materials
  • $100: Miscellaneous

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute monetarily please feel free to share this campaign, share my videos on YouTube, or send some kind thoughts as I embark on this journey. Thanks!

story:
Merci à tous d'avoir contribué à faire de cette campagne un succès !

Le vendeur de goyaves est dorénavant lancé et est disponible ICI :)


Le livre

Auteur d'une "oeuvre audacieuse et réussie" (Journal Voir pour Zhaole), et finaliste aux Grands prix littéraires Archambault, Ugo Monticone lance son troisième roman.

Inspiré d’un voyage de quatre mois en Inde, Le vendeur de goyaves nous plonge dans une Inde profonde, colorée et vibrante. Dans ce roman aux teintes philosophiques, on suit le jeune Hilmu qui sera, malgré lui, propulsé à la tête d'un nouveau temple.

Numérotés et dédicacés par l'auteur, 200 exemplaires du roman sont disponibles en prévente. C'est la vente de ces livres qui permettra la publication du roman à plus grande échelle et la concrétisation de ce projet.

« La vie a voulu que ce ne soit pas facile d’être un homme.
C’est pour ça qu’on se sent si bien lorsqu’on y parvient.»

Pour financer la publication

L'auto-édition de livres est garante de notre diversité littéraire. Mais les étapes sont nombreuses. De la correction à la mise en page, de l'impression à la mise en marché... Travailler sans le soutien d’une maison d’édition permet de garder le plein contrôle sur le contenu et l’identité graphique du livre. Évidemment, l'auteur devient aussi responsable de l’entièreté des coûts de production.


La vente de ces 200 exemplaires d'édition limitée permettra de couvrir les frais nécessaires à la mise en marché du roman Le vendeur de goyaves.

Il s’agira d’un livre différent de tout ce qu'Ugo a publié à ce jour, à la réalisation duquel vous pourrez être fier d’avoir contribué. Pour vous remercier de votre appui, vous obtiendrez jusqu'à 60% de rabais sur les autres livres d'Ugo Monticone avec les différents forfaits proposés.

Nous vous garantissons que, peu importe le résultat de cette campagne, vous recevrez les livres pour lesquels vous avez contribué. 

Les livres seront livrés en courrier accéléré à partir du 15 novembre, parfait pour vos cadeaux des fêtes (écrivez à ugo@ogu.ca si vous voulez qu'une dédicace soit adressée à un autre nom que le vôtre).


Votre impact

Votre appui est nécessaire pour la réussite de ce projet.

En vous procurant en prévente Le vendeur de goyaves, vous obtenez non seulement un exemplaire dédicacé et livré chez vous. Mais surtout, vous soutenez le projet d'un écrivain québécois qui souhaite auto-éditer le roman qui l'habite depuis son voyage en Inde.

N’hésitez pas à inviter vos cercles sociaux à venir prendre connaissance de ce projet et à participer à son financement. 


Merci !

plonge dans une Inde profonde, colorée et vibrante. « La vie a voulu que ce ne soit pas facile d’être un homme. C’est pour ça qu’on se sent si bien lorsqu’on y parvient.»

Évidemment, l'auteur devient aussi responsable de l’entièreté des coûts de production.
La vente de ces 200 exemplaires d'édition limitée permettra de couvrir les frais nécessaires à la mise en marché du roman Le vendeur de goyaves.

story:
Please Invest In AdPulp's Future

AdPulp.com launched in October 2004 and today reaches thousands of industry professionals, advertising professors and their students, and people with a keen interest in advertising and communications. To grow the site, we need more and better interactions with you, our most dedicated readers and loyal supporters. And what better way to create these bonds than through the exchange of money for something that you value?


Why Bust Out The Wallet For AdPulp Now?

1) An investment here is absolutely going to deliver precious ROI.

2) Paid content is the future and you don’t want to be caught dwelling in the past.

3) Writers are workers and we will use your contribution to pay writers.

5) Paying for content is the right thing to do and it feels good!

6) It will help connect you to the AdPulp team and make you forever a Friend of AdPulp (FoA).

7) There’s a place for free and there’s a place for paid. AdPulp offers a unique perspective on an important industry. Ergo, it’s a place for paid.

How Is AdPulp Unique?

The team at AdPulp is driven to improve the field, ever so slightly, by celebrating what’s good, questioning the things that don’t quite make sense and by criticizing the work and/or industry practices that are truly offensive. By conducting the site within this framework, we create value for readers who want to focus on the day’s most important ad-related stories (without having to visit the trades, other ad blogs and various newspaper and magazine sites themselves). The value we provide is directly and easily converted by readers into currency during brainstorms and meetings with bosses and clients. What’s an informed opinion on ad matters worth to a reader? That's the central question of this campaign, and one you can answer right now--just click the "Contribute Now" button to the right.

The Need Described

It’s hard to be brazen with a direct ask like this, but we don’t have an agent to do our bidding. We the people with thousands of hours of sweat equity on the line here have to do the hard stuff ourselves, and this is hard. It’s hard to describe the need, and hard to leave that work undone, as well. Making AdPulp every day is mostly a labor of love, but it is also a side-project that has to return a certain amount of income or it’s hard to justify. Those returns have been huge from the get go, when looking at attention and reputation earned. Now, we enter a new phase, where paid content is central to the project (to keep it interesting and profitable). This funding campaign is the beginning of the conversion to paid. So, your contribution means more to us than the money, it means you believe like we do that our media product is worthy of your financial support. You can say that with one dollar, or ten or a hundred. Please say it now, as the campaign ends soon.

story:
Nouveau Nostalgia is excited to present Saif Alsaegh's poetry collection, Iraqi Headaches.

After a youth spent in Baghdad listening to the words of great rock musicians, and an education spanning the world (Damascus, New York City, Montana) Saif is ready to release his first book of poetry. Written primarily in English, with some poems in both Arabic and English, Iraqi Headaches will explore his journey and place in the world

From Saif: "This book is not an attempt to change the world. In fact, it‟ll leave it empty … as it‟s always been."

Nouveau Nostalgia is a micro-publisher founded by Tyson and Sara Habein in Great Falls, Montana. The purpose of Nouveau Nostalgia is to put out limited edition (and often handmade) books that wouldn't have a home elsewhere. We like to say we make weird little art books.

We hope you'll help us to bring this particular book into being.

What We Need & What You Get

How Your Funds WIll Be Used:

First, and foremost, they help us cover printing costs. Any Nouveau Nostalgia release is a success if it breaks even. This is a labor of love, and your contribution will help keep us solvent on the front end.

Secondly, we would love to have Saif travel to several spots around the United States to present this poetry to a wider community. Saif's unique voice is powerful in its reach. We would like to share that power with people in all sorts of locations. A portion of the money from this campaign will be used to purchase train tickets and other necessities for a small book tour.

Beyond the pleasure of having helped create a wonderful piece of art, we have several perks for donors. 

The Impact

In donating to this campaign, you are supporting art at a grassroots level. This is where it all starts. This is where we put beauty and sadness and hope and terror and joy out into the world. This is where an idea becomes something you can hold in your hand. 

Other Ways You Can Help

First off, thank you so much for taking the time to look at this page. We know your moments are valuable and our appreciation can not be over-stated. 

If you are able, please take an extra few seconds and share this campaign with your friends on Facebook, Twitter, and anywhere else you can think of. Even if you are unable to donate at this time, your contacts may be able to. 

Feel free to use the share buttons right on this page.

Thank you so much for your support.


EDITED TO ADD: Pre-orders for Iraqi Headaches are for the special edition version with a handmade slipcover. We will only be making 100 slipcovers. Regular editions will just have the regular (to be determined) cover.

story:
About Me and My Campaign

        I am 25 years old, going on 26 here soon in March. I graduated from Loveland High School in 2006 and attended college at UC Raymond Walters College and Northern Kentucky University for Liberal and Fine Arts. Anything and everything artistic has always inspired me throughout my entire life and eventually gave me the idea to create this novel, Pink Spades. I combined my interest in Japanese culture, reincarnation, fantasy, the paranormal, the fashion world, and music into one story.

       The purpose of this campaign is to raise money in order to publish my novel with a self-publishing company that I want to partner with. Through self publishing, I can keep all the rights to my work and wont need to put myself through the long and  sometimes gruelling process of searching for an agent and/or publisher to take an interest in my hard work. There is so much I want to accomplish with this novel and it has been my dream to be a published author for a long time.

        Contributors to this project will help me achieve a great deal. Not only will I get this novel published, but I will have more opportunities available to me for advertising this story. I want to create a comic book series for it, have it become a motion picture, a videogame, and I want to compose music for the novel with the songs I have written as well.

Funding

         I will need about $1000 dollars to pay out to the publishing company, Author House. In return for your help, I will send out photo copies of, or the  original hand-drawn artwork based on the story. I will also send out copies of sample chapters for your reading pleasure. If I do not meet my goal, I will keep all donations in savings and build on it by my own means. All contributers will be mentioned in the acknowledgments segment of the novel.

The Impact

       I believe this novel will have a great impact in the sci-fi/fantasy world. There is a lack of diveristy in my opinion and have always longed for characters that I could actually relate to. My novel is packed with information on Japanese culture and ventures through other cultures around the globe as well. So far, this novel is going to be featured in a local online magazine (The Loveland Magazine)

Other ways you can help

      If you cannot contribute to this project financially, you can help spread the word for donations or about the novel in general. I have a facebook group and a page for the novel and plan on putting up a website in the near future. You can also use the indiegogo share tools. I will take any opportunity to build my fan base before the novel is published. Every little bit helps!

story:
¡Ayudame a publicar mi primera novela!

Soy María Pía, escribo desde que me conozco y siempre soñé con el día que publicaría mi primera novela. Desde chica participé en talleres literarios y pasaba días, tardes y veranos enteros escribiendo; mis preferidos siempre fueron los cuentos y novelas infantiles. Participé en cuanto concurso vi y llegué a tener cuentos cortos publicados. Es realmente maravilloso saber que mis palabras y mis historias están llegando a niños que se inspiran, crecen y divierten conmigo. El siguiente paso es publicar una novela; habiendo escrito varias, supe que “Enigmas en el cerro Pan de Azúcar” era la elegida - siempre tuvo un lugar especial en mi corazón. Me presenté a editorial tras editorial de mi pequeño país, Uruguay, pero el mercado infantil juvenil, especialmente para nuevos autores, es sumamente difícil. Aún las que me dieron buenas críticas, me cerraron por completo las puertas. 

¡Por eso me decidí a publicar por mi cuenta! El detalle es que también implica la distribución y promoción en cuenta propia, llegando a cifras desbordantes y haciendo el camino muy cuesta arriba. Por eso estoy pidiendo ayuda por este medio a todos mis amigos y todos los amantes de la lectura (y de promoverla en las nuevas generaciones), con este primer gran paso: PUBLICAR.

¡¡¡Por favor ayudame a publicar mi primera novela infantil-juvenil: “Enigmas en el cerro Pan de Azúcar”!!!


¿En qué se van a usar los fondos recaudados?

Publicar un libro tiene muchísimos costos. Lo más común es que el autor siempre termine con números en rojo y un stock de libros que le costó mucho publicar pero no puede ubicar. Edición, publicación, distribución y difusión son los pasos generales. Las editoriales que financian un proyecto es común que también se encarguen de la distribución y por eso, si uno está publicando por fuera (como sería este caso), cuesta muchísimo lograr que librerías y otros mercados acepten vender el libro y los esfuerzos sumado a los costos de promoción junto a la difusión también sufren (doblando el presupuesto de solo la publicación). 

En esta etapa, con la campaña aspiro a cubrir los costos de la publicación, para después asumir por cuenta propia el resto de los gastos. Los fondos que recaude la campaña serán destinados a la edición e imprenta del libro "Enigmas en el cerro Pan de Azúcar".


¿Cuáles son tus recompensas por colaborar?

Además de la satisfacción por formar parte de un proyecto editorial, de fomentar el interés por la lectura y de brindar apoyo a la literatura infantil juvenil podés obtener divertidas recompensas con tu colaboración.

Aquí va la lista de cosas lindas que recibes por colaborar – además de mi ¡¡más graaaande agradecimiento!! ¡¡Todo y cualquier cosa ayuda!!

1) Libro en PDF + dedicatoria por e-mail

2) Libro copia real + dedicatoria 

3) Libro copia real + dedicatoria + remera

4) Libro copia real x2 para regalar + dedicatorias

5) Libro copia real + dedicatoria  +  invitación al brindis

6) Libro copia real + dedicatoria + remera + invitación al brindis

Si no podes colaborar directamente, por favor ayudame dando a conocer la campaña a tus amigos y conocidos que podrían estar interesados :)


Unite a nuestra comunidad en FACEBOOK y TWITTER


Un poco sobre el libro...

Reseña

Durante estas vacaciones a Piriápolis Tamara y Emilia no dejarán pasar la oportunidad de subir a la cima del cerro. Hacía tiempo que querían hacerlo así que esta vez van, acompañadas de los padres de Emilia y de su hermano Matías. Es en esa escalada cuando se les cruzan en su camino enigmas del Pan de Azúcar, que paso a paso irán intentando resolver buscando desentrañar uno de los secretos mejores guardados del Uruguay y del mundo.

Lugares

El Cerro Pan de Azúcar es uno de los puntos de referencia del balneario de Piriápolis, Uruguay. Uno de los puntos más elevados del país, se distingue por la gran cruz en su cima. Por un lado es fácil de acceder siguiendo el camino turista; por otro, sumamente difícil por sus enormes y empinadas rocas. Encierra secretos muy bien guardados que la historia aún mantiene ocultos.

Piriápolis es uno de los balnearios, al menos en mi humilde opinión, más atractivos de Uruguay. Cerro y playa. Mística, aventura, cultura, entretenimiento. Misterio en todos sus rincones. Un lugar con historia impactante desde sus inicios, cuando Francisco Piria, su fundador, vio sus potencialidades. Me inspira verdadera energía positiva cada vez que lo visito.

Uno de los puntos clave del tour por el lugar es el Castillo de Piria, una edificación maravillosa que sirvió de residencia del fundador durante un corto lapso de tiempo. Se dice que fue parte de su recorrido en la búsqueda espiritual extremadamente vinculada a la alquimia, arte y ciencia que se cree que investigó. Actualmente es un museo.


Un poco sobre mí...

Mi nombre: María Pía Caputo

Mi edad: 25 años (al menos hasta el 3 de noviembre)

Mi país: Uruguay

Mi profesión: Maestra

Mi pasión: escribir (y enseñar, escribiendo también)


.............................................................................................

Help me publish my first novel

Help Me Publish My First Novel!

I am María Pía. I write since I can recall, and I dreamed of the day I could publish my first novel. Since I was little I attended literature workshops, and spent afternoons, days, even whole summers writing; I always preferred fairytales and children's novels. I participated on every competition I saw, and had some of my short stories publish. It's really amazing to know that my words and stories are reaching children that get inspired, grow and get joy with my work. The next step is to publish a novel; having some written down, I knew “Enigmas en el cerro Pan de Azúcar” (Enigmas at the Pan de Azucar hill) was the chosen one - It always had a special place in my heart. I went from one publishing house to another, within my small country, Uruguay, but the market directed to children, (especially for new authors) it's really difficult to access. Even those who gave me good critics and opinions of my work, had closed doors for it to be published.

That's why I decided to publish independently! The thing is, it also implies the distribution and advertising on my own, increasing the numbers overboard and making the path uphill. That's why I am asking for help by this campaign to all my friends, and those who love reading (And those who like to promote that love into new generations), with this big step: PUBLISH. 

Please, help me publish my first children's novel: “Enigmas en el cerro Pan de Azúcar”!!!

How are the funds going to be used?

Publishing a book means a lot of costs have to be covered. The common scenario is the author getting his/her budget into red numbers, and a huge stock of books he/she spent a lot into printing but cannot allocate on his/her own. Editing, publishing, distribution, and advertising are the general steps. The publishing houses that fund a project, commonly take care of distributing it, and because of that, if you are publishing on your own (as is, in this case) it cost a lot of effort to get bookshops and other sale places into accepting to offer your book; the efforts to distribute, and the costs of advertising suffer greatly of because of this (doubling the publishing budget).

At this phase, with the campaign, I aspire to cover the publishing costs, to then cover on my own the other expenses. In other words, the funds collected with your help will be used into the editing and printing of the book "Enigmas en el cerro Pan de Azúcar".

What are the perks for contributing?

Besides the satisfaction of being part on a publishing project, promoting interest in literature (new literature), and bring aid to children's literature, you would get some interesting rewards for your contribution. 

Here goes the list of pretty stuff you would received for contributing - not to mention my Greatest Gratitude!! Everything and anything helps!!.

1) PDF E-book + Personal message by E-mail.

2) Printed copy + Handwritten dedication and signature.

3) Printed copy + Handwritten dedication and signature + T-shirt.

4) Printed copy x 2 (to give as a gift) + Handwritten dedication and signature.

5) Printed copy + Handwritten dedication and signature (During the toast) +  Toast invitation.

6) Printed copy + Handwritten dedication and signature (During the toast) + T-shirt + Toast Invitation.

If you live aboard (outside Uruguay), please donate $25 USD extra to cover shipping costs.

If you can't contribute directly, please help me out by letting your friends and acquaintances who might be interested, know about this campaign.  :)

Join our communities in FACEBOOK y TWITTER

A little bit about the book…

Review

During this vacations to Piriápolis, Tamara and Emilia won't let the opportunity to climb to the top of the hill. It's been time since they wanted to do it, so this time they will, accompanied by Emilia's parents and brother Matías. It's at that climbing that they come across their path, the Enigmas of the Pan de Azúcar Hill, that step by step they will be trying to solve, looking to unveil one of the better guarded secrets of Uruguay and the world.

Places

The Pan de Azúcar hill it's a landmark of the Piriápolis resort, Uruguay. One of the highest places in the country, distinguished by the great Cross at it's top. From one side the tourist's path it's easy to access, and to walk, from the other it's a completely different story, it's huge builders and sharp edged rocks makes it too tough. It keeps secrets, that the story has yet to uncover, very well. 

Piriápolis it's a resort, at least on my humble opinion, the more attractive of Uruguay. with it's hill and beach (Mystery, adventure, culture, entertainment). Mystery in all it's corners. A place with an astonishing history since it's beginnings, when Francisco Piria, it's founder, saw it's potentials. It inspires me a truly positive energy whenever I visit it.

One of the key elements of the tour at the place is the Piria's castle, a marvelous building that serve as residence to its founder for a short amount of time. It is said that it was a part of his spiritual journey strongly linked to art, alchemy and science, which he was believed to had been researching. Nowadays it's a museum.

A little bit about myself...

Name: María Pía Caputo

Age: 25 Years old (at least until November the 3rd)

Country: Uruguay

Profession: Elementary school professor

Passion: Writing (and teach, by writing too)
story_txt:
¡Ayudame
a publicar mi primera novela!

Soy
María Pía, escribo desde que me conozco y siempre soñé con el día que
publicaría mi primera novela. Desde chica participé en talleres literarios y
pasaba días, tardes y veranos enteros escribiendo; mis preferidos siempre
fueron los cuentos y novelas infantiles. Participé en cuanto concurso vi y llegué
a tener cuentos cortos publicados. Es realmente maravilloso saber que mis
palabras y mis historias están llegando a niños que se inspiran, crecen y
divierten conmigo. El siguiente paso es publicar una novela; habiendo escrito
varias, supe que “Enigmas en el cerro Pan de Azúcar” era la elegida - siempre
tuvo un lugar especial en mi corazón. Me presenté a editorial tras editorial de
mi pequeño país, Uruguay, pero el mercado infantil juvenil, especialmente para nuevos
autores, es sumamente difícil. Aún las que me dieron buenas críticas, me
cerraron por completo las puertas.  
¡Por
eso me decidí a publicar por mi cuenta! El detalle es que también implica la
distribución y promoción en cuenta propia, llegando a cifras desbordantes y
haciendo el camino muy cuesta arriba. Por eso estoy pidiendo ayuda por este
medio a todos mis amigos y todos los amantes de la lectura (y de promoverla en
las nuevas generaciones), con este primer gran paso: PUBLICAR. 
¡¡¡Por favor ayudame a publicar mi primera novela infantil-juvenil: “Enigmas en
el cerro Pan de Azúcar”!!!¿En qué se van a usar los fondos recaudados?Publicar un libro tiene muchísimos costos. Lo más común es que el autor siempre termine con números en rojo y un stock de libros que le costó mucho publicar pero no puede ubicar. Edición, publicación, distribución y difusión son los pasos generales. Las editoriales que financian un proyecto es común que también se encarguen de la distribución y por eso, si uno está publicando por fuera (como sería este caso), cuesta muchísimo lograr que librerías y otros mercados acepten vender el libro y los esfuerzos sumado a los costos de promoción junto a la difusión también sufren (doblando el presupuesto de solo la publicación). En esta etapa, con la campaña aspiro a cubrir los costos de la publicación, para después asumir por cuenta propia el resto de los gastos. Los fondos que recaude la campaña serán destinados a la edición e imprenta del libro "Enigmas en el cerro Pan de Azúcar".¿Cuáles son tus recompensas por colaborar?Además de la satisfacción por formar parte de un proyecto editorial, de fomentar el interés por la lectura y de brindar apoyo a la literatura infantil juvenil podés obtener divertidas recompensas con tu colaboración.Aquí va la lista de cosas lindas que recibes
por colaborar – además de mi ¡¡más graaaande agradecimiento!! ¡¡Todo y cualquier
cosa ayuda!!1) Libro en PDF + dedicatoria por e-mail2) Libro copia real + dedicatoria 3) Libro copia real + dedicatoria + remera4) Libro copia real x2 para regalar + dedicatorias5) Libro copia real + dedicatoria  +  invitación al brindis6) Libro copia real + dedicatoria + remera + invitación al brindisSi
no podes colaborar directamente, por favor ayudame dando a conocer la campaña a
tus amigos y conocidos que podrían estar interesados :)Unite a nuestra comunidad en FACEBOOK y TWITTERUn poco sobre el libro...Reseña
Durante estas
vacaciones a Piriápolis Tamara y Emilia no dejarán pasar la oportunidad de
subir a la cima del cerro. Hacía tiempo que querían hacerlo así que esta vez
van, acompañadas de los padres de Emilia y de su hermano Matías. Es en esa
escalada cuando se les cruzan en su camino enigmas del Pan de Azúcar, que paso
a paso irán intentando resolver buscando desentrañar uno de los secretos
mejores guardados del Uruguay y del mundo.LugaresEl Cerro Pan de Azúcar es uno de
los puntos de referencia del balneario de Piriápolis, Uruguay. Uno de los puntos más elevados del país, se distingue por la gran cruz en su cima. Por
un lado es fácil de acceder siguiendo el camino
turista; por otro, sumamente difícil por sus enormes y empinadas rocas. Encierra secretos muy bien guardados que la
historia aún mantiene ocultos.

Piriápolis
es uno de los balnearios, al menos en mi humilde opinión,
más atractivos de Uruguay. Cerro y playa.
Mística, aventura, cultura, entretenimiento.
Misterio en todos sus rincones. Un lugar con historia impactante desde sus inicios, cuando Francisco Piria, su fundador, vio sus potencialidades. Me inspira
verdadera energía positiva cada vez que
lo visito.Uno de los
puntos clave del tour por el lugar es el Castillo de Piria, una edificación maravillosa que sirvió de residencia del fundador durante un corto lapso de tiempo. Se dice que fue
parte de su recorrido en la búsqueda espiritual
extremadamente vinculada a la alquimia, arte y ciencia que se cree que investigó. Actualmente es un museo.Un poco sobre mí...Mi nombre: María Pía CaputoMi edad: 25 años (al menos hasta el 3 de noviembre)Mi país: UruguayMi profesión: MaestraMi pasión: escribir (y enseñar, escribiendo también).............................................................................................
Help me publish my first novel
Help Me Publish My First Novel!
I am María Pía. I write since I can recall, and I dreamed of the day I could publish my first novel. Since I was little I attended literature workshops, and spent afternoons, days, even whole summers writing; I always preferred fairytales and children's novels. I participated on every competition I saw, and had some of my short stories publish. It's really amazing to know that my words and stories are reaching children that get inspired, grow and get joy with my work. The next step is to publish a novel; having some written down, I knew “Enigmas en el cerro Pan de Azúcar” (Enigmas at the Pan de Azucar hill) was the chosen one - It always had a special place in my heart. I went from one publishing house to another, within my small country, Uruguay, but the market directed to children, (especially for new authors) it's really difficult to access. Even those who gave me good critics and opinions of my work, had closed doors for it to be published.
That's why I decided to publish independently! The thing is, it also implies the distribution and advertising on my own, increasing the numbers overboard and making the path uphill. That's why I am asking for help by this campaign to all my friends, and those who love reading (And those who like to promote that love into new generations), with this big step: PUBLISH. 
Please, help me publish my first children's novel: “Enigmas en el cerro Pan de Azúcar”!!!
How are the funds going to be used?
Publishing a book means a lot of costs have to be covered. The common scenario is the author getting his/her budget into red numbers, and a huge stock of books he/she spent a lot into printing but cannot allocate on his/her own. Editing, publishing, distribution, and advertising are the general steps. The publishing houses that fund a project, commonly take care of distributing it, and because of that, if you are publishing on your own (as is, in this case) it cost a lot of effort to get bookshops and other sale places into accepting to offer your book; the efforts to distribute, and the costs of advertising suffer greatly of because of this (doubling the publishing budget).
At this phase, with the campaign, I aspire to cover the publishing costs, to then cover on my own the other expenses. In other words, the funds collected with your help will be used into the editing and printing of the book "Enigmas en el cerro Pan de Azúcar".
What are the perks for contributing?
Besides the satisfaction of being part on a publishing project, promoting interest in literature (new literature), and bring aid to children's literature, you would get some interesting rewards for your contribution. 
Here goes the list of pretty stuff you would received for contributing - not to mention my Greatest Gratitude!! Everything and anything helps!!.
1) PDF E-book + Personal message by E-mail.
2) Printed copy + Handwritten dedication and signature.
3) Printed copy + Handwritten dedication and signature + T-shirt.
4) Printed copy x 2 (to give as a gift) + Handwritten dedication and signature.
5) Printed copy + Handwritten dedication and signature (During the toast) +  Toast invitation.
6) Printed copy + Handwritten dedication and signature (During the toast) + T-shirt + Toast Invitation.
If you live aboard (outside Uruguay), please donate $25 USD extra to cover shipping costs.
If you can't contribute directly, please help me out by letting your friends and acquaintances who might be interested, know about this campaign.  :)
Join our communities in FACEBOOK y TWITTER
A little bit about the book…
Review
During this vacations to Piriápolis, Tamara and Emilia won't let the opportunity to climb to the top of the hill. It's been time since they wanted to do it, so this time they will, accompanied by Emilia's parents and brother Matías. It's at that climbing that they come across their path, the Enigmas of the Pan de Azúcar Hill, that step by step they will be trying to solve, looking to unveil one of the better guarded secrets of Uruguay and the world.
Places
The Pan de Azúcar hill it's a landmark of the Piriápolis resort, Uruguay. One of the highest places in the country, distinguished by the great Cross at it's top. From one side the tourist's path it's easy to access, and to walk, from the other it's a completely different story, it's huge builders and sharp edged rocks makes it too tough. It keeps secrets, that the story has yet to uncover, very well. 
Piriápolis it's a resort, at least on my humble opinion, the more attractive of Uruguay. with it's hill and beach (Mystery, adventure, culture, entertainment). Mystery in all it's corners. A place with an astonishing history since it's beginnings, when Francisco Piria, it's founder, saw it's potentials. It inspires me a truly positive energy whenever I visit it.
One of the key elements of the tour at the place is the Piria's castle, a marvelous building that serve as residence to its founder for a short amount of time. It is said that it was a part of his spiritual journey strongly linked to art, alchemy and science, which he was believed to had been researching. Nowadays it's a museum.
A little bit about myself...
Name: María Pía Caputo
Age: 25 Years old (at least until November the 3rd)
Country: Uruguay
Profession: Elementary school professor
Passion: Writing (and teach, by writing too)

story:
We are a ramshackle group of poets, bound for the national college poetry slam.

This year's Grand Slam at Columbia University appeared out of nowhere, thanks to its revival by a few Columbia students, who somehow managed to cobble together a slam. Between the time the slam was announced in January and the night before the slam, nineteen poets had signed up, and fourteen competitors slammed. Every poet showed unforseen talent, bringing poetry that was inquisitive, sincere and emotionally demanding, and an audience of over two hundred proved how badly Columbia wants more of it!

Now, the top five poets from the slam have formed a team, and are headed to Virginia Commonwealth University for the 2015 National College Poetry Slam, CUPSI! Hailing from all across the country and all different writing backgrounds, these five poets managed to convince the judges that their poetry was worthy to go national. They are no joke:

  • Alyssa Paul 
    A sophomore at Columbia University, Alyssa is a film studies major and aspiring actress. Growing up in Los Angeles, she began doing spoken word poetry in high school and can't wait to start up again in college. 
  • Chloé "Kidd" Matthews
    A native of Clinton, LA, Chloe is a student at Columbia studying English and African American Studies. She began writing in middle school and co-founded her high school's slam team in tenth grade. The following year she attended Brave New Voices as a member of Team Baton Rouge. She likes short walks in grain pastures and rugby balls. 
  • Ficara McDoom
    Ficara is from Connecticut and is a student at Barnard College. She intends to double major in English and Film Studies. She writes to be understood and to understand herself. The most telling and only relevant things to note are that she likes old things and the smell of wood. Nothing further. 
  • Gabrielle Smith
    Writing slam poetry has shown Gabrielle Smith—a product, of the Philly Youth Poetry Movement—that the world is filled with challenges that demand attention. During her writing process, she confronts multiple perspectives on womanhood, love, and God. “When I first started, it seemed very simple; you just put your emotions on the page,” she says. “But the art of performance poetry is so intricate and intertwined. I love how hard it is to make a picture on the stage and on the page. I love how hard it is to do a beautiful job.”
  • Max Binder
    Raised in Providence, Rhode Island, Max got into spoken word his junior year of high school and also went to Brave New Voices in 2013 (and never ran into Kidd!) After a year of staffing at Providence Poetry Slam, Max is a first year at Columbia College helping to organize the start-up Barnumbia Slam!

We've got poems. You've got Money. Let's make a deal.

We'll break this down rules-of-poetry-slam style.

Rule #1: Slams cost money.

National poetry events are an amazing experience: they're like an athletic conference for poets. They bring out teams from all across the country for a few nights, and usually have special events, super-famous featured poets hanging around, and require a whole lot of organization and event space. CUPSI is no exception; between March 25th and 28th, some sixty teams/three hundred-odd poets will be going at it for the glory. As a result, slams like CUPSI cost a lot to attend, and we're sending five poets and two coaches. The team will have to pay:

  • $800 for registration
  • $800 for transporting 7 member between Virginia and New York
  • $1,700 for four days food and lodging
  • $200 Misc expenses (because things go wrong when people travel)

For a grand total of $3,500! We know that's no small sum, and we can't pay it by ourselves because:

Rule #2: (Student) Poets are broke.

These poets are paying for school, books, and living expenses, while making next to no money. And right now, getting money from Columbia is difficult. The Barnard Writers Collective (host group of the CU CUPSI Team) doesn't have a budget! We're doing what we can to collect donations at slams, but to get most of the money, we need you!

Rule #3: People love poetry!

Nuts to "a dying art form," we're cultivating a community of writers that thrives on free speech! Where poets put their stories forward in ways that enlighten all of our lives! Where free expression is transformed into freedom from oppression! Where hard truths are spoken loudly for the world to hear!! The world needs more poetry, and this cannot happen without you!!!

But if that's not enough incentive, we have some fantastic rewards for your donations:

  • Team chapbook! Once CUPSI is through, the best work from the team's poems (!!including group pieces!!) will be anthologized in a limited edition chapbook, one of the owners of which will be you!
  • Poem postcards! Get a gorgeous postcard featuring some of the work the team produces on the road to CUPSI; some poignant lines to make your heart swell or break that you can keep on your refrigerator forever!
  • Custom gifts from the team! On top of a chapbook and postcard, five especially generous donors will receive a special gift, hand-picked/crafted by the team when all the poetry is done!
  • Our undying love! Seriously this can't happen without you and every donation counts! We won't forget how much your love of poetry helped bring this team national!

The Oomph

Sending this team to CUPSI is a part of the larger goal of building up the Barnard/CU Writers Collective & Slam so that the students of Columbia University and New York can have a stage to speak their truths, and to learn to engage with their lives and the world in new ways by speaking to one another. Our immediate goals for this team include: 

  • Building these poets. Being on a poetry slam team is a chance for a few lucky poets to hone their skills and to grow and develop as writers. It's a chance for them to be challenged to experiment with new language and to learn to say things no one has ever said before! We want to invest in sending this amazing work, but also:
  • Bringing the poetry back home. Once these poets have had a chance to develop their work, they can come home and put their energy and their fire back into the community, and inspire the next wave of writers through writing together and sharing their skills!
  • Starting strong and aiming high. This team is going to be the first of what we hope will be many generations of Columbia slam teams that aim to show the world the creativity and insight that being a student at Columbia University truly means. We want to start the fire that re-energizes the creative writing of a school that has hosted poets like Federico Garcia Lorca and Allen Ginsberg, and will rise to fame again!

Risks? Challenges? Pff.

This is not a question. This team IS going to CUPSI this year. The poets have the dedication. The coaches have the fire. There will be so many hours of work put into poetry over the next seven weeks, and the team WILL crush it at the competition.

The only real obstacle is money, and that really depends on you! Please, please help us reach our goal!!!

Community means pitching in, whatever way you can!

We know not everyone can give money. We're college students too (though we hope you can at least chip in a buck or two!) But if you can't, here are some ways that you can help and get involved:

  • Please spread the word! We need as many people to see this as possible to meet our goal, so please share this with everyone you know!! Heck, even email it to your parents: "hey, can we help send my friends to a poetry slam?" *bambi eyes*  Check out the indiegogo share tools!
  • Graphic design for us? We're actually looking for someone to help us make amazing logos for things like: this indiegogo page! The Columbia Poetry Slam! The Writing Collective! We may also need some help designing chapbooks and postcards when all is said and done! Are you skilled in this art? If you want to chip in with art along with or instead of money, contact Max at max.binder@columbia.edu!
  • Help us book space! Yes, you, member of a recognized Columbia group with access to a UEM account, those of us in the writing collective need some help in the immediate future with booking spaces for poetry slams and writing workshops. Your help with that through the rest of the semester would be absolutely invaluable! Email 
  • Other ideas? If you have some other skill you'd like to contribute to the team, run it by us! We'd love whatever help you can offer! 
HELP US GET TO CUPSI!!! DONATE AND SHARE!!! WE LOVE YOU!!!

story:
Short Summary

Hi! I'm G.L. Morrison. I'm a disabled poet. (I'm a bunch of other adjectives and nouns: fat, queer, communist, activist, teacher, feminist, grandmother. But writers get wordy. I have to narrow it down and get to the point.) I've been publishing 30 years in anthologies (Ghost Town Poetry) and magazines (Sinister Wisdom, The Advocate) and a staggering number of zines, newsletters, newspapers and blogs. I've been delighted to be involved in so many indie projects, reading series, small presses and writing conferences. Sadly the reality is that many of them cannot afford to pay writers or presenters or staff. Such is the case of NW Poets Concord --a wonderful small annual poetry conference in Newport, Oregon-- where I will be presenting a workshop entitled "Dissecting the Sacred: making new poems from old". I'll also be part of their New Books reading series and reading from mine: "Chiaroscuro Kisses" (Headmistress Press).

I'm going to tell you two things you already knew: 

  • Being poor is costly.
  • Being disabled complicates everything.

Gone for me are the days of hitchhiking and sofa surfing. Traveling (with a power wheelchair and a PCA) is exhausting, expensive and requires extensive planning. 

Here's how you can help.  Donate if you can. Pass this on (sensibly please -no crazy spamming) to friends or groups you belong to.

What We Need 


  • conference registration $75 (a delightful bargain)
  • workshop materials $20
  • $350-450 Food/Lodging at the Hallmark Inn
  • rental of wheelchair van is $110/day 
  • If we do not raise enough to rent a van (or a car/SUV that can accommodate the wheelchair) and we have to take the Amtrak or Greyhound bus (tickets for self and attendant $130-$180) it will be necessary to stay an additional day in the hotel because the bus only leaves Newport at 5 am.

& What You Get (The Perks)

I want to thank Judith Witherow for donating her book "Strong Enough to Bend" to give contributors. I'm including my own "Chiaroscuro Kisses" as well. I've also asked a number of amazing writers to donate books and autographed broadsides (poem-posters). I'm offering a manuscript critique and an online version of the workshop. Heartfelt gratitude goes out to anyone who contributes (and I'll put that in writing with a e-card from the conference thanking you for making it possible). Also a custom poem written on a theme of your choice --a terrific gift or to commemorate an important event! 

Watch this space. I'll update as more perks become available.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Spread the word.
  • Share on facebook and twitter.
  • Share this link with friends, writers, artists, poetry fans or groups that you think would be interested.

It takes a village... thanks for being a part of mine!
