Traveling (with a power wheelchair and a PCA) is exhausting, expensive and requires extensive planning. Here's how you can help.  Donate if you can. Pass this on (sensibly please -no crazy spamming) to friends or groups you belong to.What We Need 
conference registration $75 (a delightful bargain)
workshop materials $20
$350-450 Food/Lodging at the Hallmark Inn
rental of wheelchair van is $110/day 
If we do not raise enough to rent a van (or a car/SUV that can accommodate the wheelchair) and we have to take the Amtrak or Greyhound bus (tickets for self and attendant $130-$180) it will be necessary to stay an additional day in the hotel because the bus only leaves Newport at 5 am.
& What You Get (The Perks)
I want to thank Judith Witherow for donating her book "Strong Enough to Bend" to give contributors. I'm including my own "Chiaroscuro Kisses" as well. I've also asked a number of amazing writers to donate books and autographed broadsides (poem-posters). I'm offering a manuscript critique and an online version of the workshop. Heartfelt gratitude goes out to anyone who contributes (and I'll put that in writing with a e-card from the conference thanking you for making it possible). Also a custom poem written on a theme of your choice --a terrific gift or to commemorate an important event! Watch this space. I'll update as more perks become available.Other Ways You Can Help
Spread the word.
Share on facebook and twitter.
Share this link with friends, writers, artists, poetry fans or groups that you think would be interested.
It takes a village... thanks for being a part of mine!

story:
Our funding goal has been reached! Thank you.

We'll be able to realize the full scope of the project, thanks to the generosity of some serious poetry lovers. Still, the gates will be open until the end of the month, and any additional money raised will go toward:

  • Increased honorariums for all the artists participating in the series. It's the wish of any literary magazine to be able to pay its artists, even when it's often difficult for a small organization supported by grants and manned by a volunteer staff to do so. We'll be glad to increase the amount of money these artists receive.

  • Enhanced audio post production. These podcasts were always going to happen. With additional funds, we'll have a high caliber of talent more involved in post production for the life of the project.

  • Planning for a second series of interviews. With the purchase of additional equipment and seed money, we'll be on firm footing for another round of conversations with poets.

About This Project

In February and March of 2014, the annual Association of Writers and Poets (AWP) conference will bring poets, writers and educators to Seattle from all over the country and the world. The editors of Poetry Northwest will produce six audio interviews with poets visiting Seattle during the conference. What we have in mind is fun: we’ll be escorting these poets out into the city--in cars, on walkabouts, on ferries and Ferris wheels!  En route and in some of these unusual places, we’ll record conversations with the writers, and release them as a limited series of audio podcasts. We'll be talking with writers we're excited about, and who we know you’ll be excited to hear from as well.

We're looking to connect readers and writers of poetry with poets at various places in their careers, and who are an important part of tradition and innovation in the art of poetry. Some of the poets you’ll find at the conference include featured presenters Dean Young, Mary Ruefle, Robert Hass and Chris Abani, as well as panel participants Heidi Lynn Staples, Peter Gizzi, Dorothea Lasky, Matthew Zapruder, Dan Beachy-Quick, Ilya Kaminsky, Forrest Gander, Robert Pinsky and Harryette Mullen. And that’s only the beginning.

After some shuffling around, the final list of interviewees is: Dan Beachy-Quick, Olena Kalytiak Davis, Timothy Donnelly, Robert Hass, Richie Hofmann, Dorothea Lasky and Dean Young. Yeah, we're excited too.

How You Can Help Us

The all-volunteer staff of the magazine is seeking funds to assist in:

  • paying honorariums to participating writers.

  • hiring audio production and post-production services.

  • securing locations, providing amenities and transportation around Seattle for interviewees.

  • hosting and distributing six interview podcasts for one full year.

Some of the perks of donation include

  • Interview “B-Sides” and Outtakes!

  • A subscription to Poetry Northwest!

  • Phone calls from poets!

  • Poetry Northwest collectibles: Bookmarks, broadsides, T-shirts!

  • An AWP survival kit!

  • Scroll down for more good stuff!


About Poetry Northwest

Poetry Northwest is one of the country’s oldest literary journals--and the oldest in the Pacific Northwest. Based in Everett, Washington, the magazine was founded in 1959 by Errol Pritchard, Carolyn Kizer, Richard Hugo and Nelson Bentley. Early contributors included W.S. Merwin, Charles Wright, William Stafford, Anne Sexton, and David Wagoner. Recent contributors have included Michael Collier, J.W. Marshall, Colleen McElroy, Hannah Sanghee Park, Oliver de la Paz, Emilia Phillips, Cody Walker, Emily Warn and Stanley Plumly.

We remain as committed as we were in 1959 to publishing the best poetry we can find, and to expanding the role and scope of poetry in ways both public and private, innovative and traditional, as an art and as a clear and necessary dialogue in a world overrun with noise.

The editors, staff, and volunteers of Poetry Northwest have years of experience bringing writers and audiences together, publishing poetry, planning events, and putting poetic values at the center of public discourse. We’re looking forward to bringing our experience to bear on this new project.

Why We Think This Project is Important

  • AWP is a rare gathering of writers of all experiences and ages, and a perfect occasion to bring them into conversation with one another, on the record.

  • An important part of the mission of Poetry Northwest is to be a locus for bringing folks from the artistic and literary communities together, both in the Pacific Northwest and nationally.

  • This is an opportunity to begin to build an archive of voices that readers and lovers of poetry will want to hear from, for years to come.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can’t contribute, you can help us get the word out! Tweet up a storm. Post on walls. Talk to your friends in person! Use Indiegogo's sharing tools!

Thank you:
  • You, for reading all the way to the end, and for sharing and contributing to this project!
  • Andrew at Preservation records for his generous donation of albums!
  • Alexis Vergella, for donating prints! (Get a peek at what they look like here.)
  • Our poet phone bank, currently manned by John Wesley Horton, for reading poems to willing strangers!
  • The folks at graypants, for donating one of their beautiful handcrafted scraplights. (Seriously, you should take a look!)

story:
Ready To Go

I started writing this book 8 years ago after a neighbor of a different faith than my own lost her husband. I struggled for hours before I hit the internet to learn more about what I should know before visiting her or taking food to her home. We live in a diverse world and many of us have friends, co-workers and neighbors of a different faith, culture and traditions than our own, but knowing what to say or what bring to their home following a death can be frustrating and I decided to help make it a little easier when I wrote this book. The book is almost complete and I plan to go to print soon after the New Year. 

With Just A Little Push

All of the funds raised will go toward getting professional photographs of foods, a copy editor, purchasing an ISBN, production, distribution, website and PR. 

Anything over my fundraising will goal will initially help me expand my promotional strategy, but if I manage to raise $1000 or more over our goal I will be able to donate copies to churches, synagogues, mosques, temples and other places of worship.

Other Ways You Can Support 

If you'd like to support this project but can't donate to the cause, you can help me a ton by simply sharing this campaign using the Indiegogo share tools above.

What You Will Get Out of This

Some of the available perks for your donation include:

  • Acknowledgement of your support my website, FB page and Twitter
  • Free copies of Condolences and Casseroles when it’s released
  • Beautiful bookmarks by artist Roxanne Musick
  • and more

Your Contribution Will Make This a Reality... Finally

Because of your support you will help take my book to its final detestation into the hands of readers like yourself. This has been a long time process, mostly because I have been working in another field. But today I'm taking the leap and asking for your help. 

Thank you.

story:
What is The Psychedelic Anthology?

The Psychedelic Anthology is a book series consisting of profound psychedelic experiences submitted by the user. This book series will consist of seven volumes that will be released on the same date each year, for seven consecutive years. 



The Purpose

Although psychedelics have been an integral part of the evolution of our civilization for thousands of years, since the freethinker has become a threat to the establishment, Western culture has demonized them, leaving a negative stigma surrounding these substances. In recent years, the scientific community has rallied behind the understanding and belief that substances such as ayahuasca and psilocybin have the potential to cure psychological disorders plaguing today's society like addiction and PTSD. To play our part in eradicating this grand misunderstanding of the importance of these psychedelics and their greater purpose in the evolution of the human race, this anthology is the first book series of its kind to unveil the power of the psychedelic experience to the general public from cover to cover. This collection of seven volumes could potentially become a critical reference for fields of study such as psychology, anthropology, and even theology.


The Impact

This is where you come in. The success of Volume I will provide the funding to self-publish and promote this publication on a greater scale. The goal of successful self-publishing is to open the door to a relationship with a well-known publisher in the psychedelic field, like Park Street Press, to help get these stories in book stores around the world and in every possible outlet. At the affordable price of $11.11, our hope is that this book will reach as many hands as possible, inspiring others to look inward and strengthening a positive public awareness. 


The Perks

*FREE US Shipping. $10 USD International Shipping.*


The Funding

To understand how your donation will help to achieve these goals, here is a breakdown of where the funding will go if we meet our goal:

  • To printing copies of The Psychedelic Anthology: Volume I - some of which will be donated to different psychedelic, cultural, and educational institutions.
  • To publish an e-Book to sell on outlets like Amazon and Apple.
  • To marketing and advertising (i.e. website, Google AdWords, etc).
  • To cover ALL shipping costs (e.g. packaging and postage) & to allow us to offer FREE shipping for all future self-published purchases of Volume I (U.S. only).
  • A portion of the proceeds for this campaign will go to the following psychedelic institutions: The Ayahuasca Foundation, MAPS, and Shroomery.org.
  • A portion of the proceeds will go toward the purchase of 50+ acres in New York to create a sanctuary for both animals and people to create an off-grid community where people can build, learn, and grow together by reconnecting with nature and our true selves.

The negative stigma surrounding these entheogenic substances is the single greatest misunderstanding of our time and it is up to us to break it. Donate today and be a part of the change.  

Thank you infinitely for your support <3

story:
Short Summary

In 1932, Herbert J. Taylor believed his employees needed an "ethical yardstick" by which to do business. The four questions he penned became the Rotary Four-Way Test--the pledge that echoes thousands of times each week across the globe in hundreds of languages. 

The 24 words of the pledge might seem small, but they are significant.  They encapsulate powerful guidelines for how to treat everyone with respect. As our Rotarian population ages, we need to promote the Four-Way Test to a new and younger generation, many of whom already have too little experience with positive character models. This book shows inspirational examples of how the Test works in action, and it is designed to serve as a useful tool in education and outreach for years to come.

About Me

  • A Rotarian, formerly of Woodinville and Redmond Clubs, now with East Jefferson Rotary Club, Chimacum, WA
  • Founder of Social Smarts, a program to build optimal learning skills through social and character education

 

  • Nationally recognized speaker and expert on social skills and character
  • Author of  the acclaimed book "It's Not Who You Know, It's How You Treat Them"
  • Passionate about helping others achieve greater personal and professional success by being "socially smart"
  • A mother of three, with concerns about the lack of civility and character in young people and its effect on Rotary’s legacy of service to others

Along with my work on the books mentioned above, I'm also the co-author of "The Big Book of Benefit Auctions," published by John Wiley & Sons, and have varying roles on nearly 100 other non-fiction and educational titles.

 

What I'm Looking For & What You Get

  • Initially, I was looking for $7400 to cover costs involved in editing, publishing, marketing and distributing Character Counts; first printing will be 1000 copies
  • Depending on your contributions there are eBadges you can post on your social media to show your support, autographed copies of my book, private consulting and speaking gigs...I'll even fly to your town for a full day of consulting and buy you dinner and let you pick my brain!
  • Since your generosity has exceeds the initial goal, I will now use any extra contributions to print more copies of the book as well as fund a speaking tour to promote Rotary Character Counts!

The Impact

YOU can be part of a movement -- Rotary is Character and Character COUNTS!

  • The book will help educate new members about the message and practice of Rotary
  • This message resonates with Rotarians globally: Rotary Clubs have gone so far as to underwrite the cost of SocialSmarts in US schools because they recognize the need to improve social skills and character education in our students and appreciate the results
  • As a token of gratitude for what Rotary has done for me, I will donate a minimum of 10% of the net proceeds of book sales back to Rotary International. By helping fund this book project, you are not only helping me, but you are helping invest further in Rotary International!

Risks & Challenges

The risks to a successful book program are very small.  I'm a multi-published author and my previous books (like "It's Not Who You Know, It's How You Treat Them") have been well-received. Rotarians are famous for helping deserving groups; I hope this project is considered "deserving" enough that it will compel folks to keep helping so we can help more people! 

This campaign is the first step of a two-step plan. The next step, broader outreach, will involve speaking, media appearances, and interviews to further promote the message that "Rotary is Character."

Other Ways You Can Help

I know not everyone can help at the highest levels, but I've designed this fundraiser so there's something for everyone!  No contribution is too small, and I appreciate whatever you can do to help.

Even if you can't contribute personally, please consider sharing this campaign with others who believe positive character and kindness are important. Thank you!

story:
Long Story Short

Are you having trouble deciding who to vote for in Bruce-Grey-Owen Sound? Yet refuse to support another four years with Harper's Conservatives? We are in the same boat! 

Looking at Harper's track record over the past 9 years, we know that another four would be detrimental to Canadians. Here in Bruce-Grey-Owen Sound, unless we vote together, we are likely to face another Conservative victory locally, thus giving one more seat. A recent poll suggests that it is within the realm of the possible to defeat our Conservative candidate locally and give Harper one less seat federally. But the question remains...which non-Conservative local candidate has the best chance at victory? While the previous poll was informative, it was conducted too early to be truly convince many voters. We need more information!

Contribute to our campaign to help raise funds to commission another objective poll in Bruce-Grey-Owen Sound to inform voters on which non-Conservative candidate to endorse in order to defeat Conservatives. 

For this reason, we're on a tight deadline! The deadline for this crowdfunding campaign is Friday, October 9 in order to have enough time to conduct the poll and publicize the results, all before election day. 


What We Need

We need more information in Bruce-Grey-Owen Sound! We need more local polling in order to determine which local candidate has the best chance at defeating the Conservatives, so we can rally together behind this candidate and achieve a non-Conservative victory. 
We need to raise $2500 by Friday, October 9 in order to to commission an unbiased poll in our riding. In order to do this, we will be working with Lead Now, an independent advocacy organization, who commissioned the last round of polls across the country, and Environics, the consulting firm that conducted the previous poll. We have chosen to work with Lead Now and Environics because they can provide credible research practices and they are able to do the poll within the given timeline. 
If we raise the funds by October 9, the poll will take place from October 10 - 12 and the findings will be released October 14. 
If we do not reach our goal of $2500, we will not be able to conduct the poll and your contribution will be returned to you. 

The Impact

As we discovered in the 2011 election, the majority of Canadians wanted change. However, due to our present voting system, Harper and the Conservatives gained a majority government with just 39% of the vote. As we've seen in the last four years, the results have been detrimental to Canadians. In short, our government fails to represent Canadian values. 
But we have an alternative! If we vote together, we can defeat the local Conservative candidate and give Harper one less seat!

Other Ways You Can Help

But wait...there's more!

  • Share this campaign with family, friends and your social network to help us reach our funding goal. Spread the word through social media and word of mouth.  
  • Make a pledge to vote for the best local candidate to defeat Harper and the Conservatives.
  • Join a Vote Together phone bank team to call voters to determine the best non-Conservative candidate to support. 
  • Keep up with the latest election news, polls and debates to further inform your decision and to make your vote count.

We need more information in Bruce-Grey-Owen Sound! We need more local polling in order to determine which local candidate has the best chance at defeating the Conservatives, so we can rally together behind this candidate and achieve a non-Conservative victory. 

We need to raise $2500 by Friday, October 9 in order to to commission an unbiased poll in our riding. In order to do this, we will be working with Lead Now, an independent advocacy organization, who commissioned the last round of polls across the country, and Environics, the consulting firm that conducted the previous poll. We have chosen to work with Lead Now and Environics because they can provide credible research practices and they are able to do the poll within the given timeline. 

If we raise the funds by October 9, the poll will take place from October 10 - 12 and the findings will be released October 14. 

If we do not reach our goal of $2500, we will not be able to conduct the poll and your contribution will be returned to you.     The Impact


As we discovered in the 2011 election, the majority of Canadians wanted change. However, due to our present voting system, Harper and the Conservatives gained a majority government with just 39% of the vote. As we've seen in the last four years, the results have been detrimental to Canadians. In short, our government fails to represent Canadian values.   But we have an alternative! If we vote together, we can defeat the local Conservative candidate and give Harper one less seat!


    Other Ways You Can Help But wait...there's more!

Share this campaign with family, friends and your social network to help us reach our funding goal. Spread the word through social media and word of mouth.  
Make a pledge to vote for the best local candidate to defeat Harper and the Conservatives.
Join a Vote Together phone bank team to call voters to determine the best non-Conservative candidate to support. 

Keep up with the latest election news, polls and debates to further inform your decision and to make your vote count.

WHAT IS GARY & A BOX OF SALT?

More and more children are becoming self-centered, an attitude diametrically opposing team spirit. To help combat that disjointing attitude, this book is a must read for today's youth! Gary & a Box of Salt is an autobiographical narrative of an event based on a young boy, with a loving heart, that gave a box of salt to help feed the poor within his community. This book brings to life the subject of altruism coupled with the compassion to give. 

  Can you remember back in the day when life was much simpler than it is now? Eating home-grown fruits and vegetables, playing out-of-doors, and working and teaming up together in the community to help meet each others daily needs ‒‒that was what we did, and it was common practice! Today, the word “team” is a

When I walked into the pantry the shelves would have been completely bare, if not for a lonely box of salt, that's all that was there!

highly effective business term used by major companies; but now, unfortunately, used less by families. In publishing Gary & a Box of Salt, I’m going old school! Through my warm and insightful book, I’m attempting to bring back the functionality of teamwork in families and community and to reveal the necessity and importance of reestablishing it in the lives of today’s children.   Often, the first step toward self-help begins by helping someone else, an insight and behavior that should start at home. Children will discover within this deligtful picture book just how Gary and his entire family benefited from his enthusiastic act of kindness

They gave the box to my mother. "Is that a poor family's box of food," I wondered? I did not think that my family was looked upon as being poor...

when he donated a box of salt to help feed the poor! Within this book, children will find various life scenarios showing them realistic and attainable outcomes from positive goal setting. Adults will appreciate it as a transitional ice-breaking tool, making it easier to engage youngsters in constructive dialog about the benefits of making good life choices based on topics found within it---And that one point alone substantiates why every parent needs to own at least two copies of this book…Your friends will want to take a copy home with them.

My brother's, sister's, and I often worked in the garden by digging, planting seeds, watering, and pulling weed.

WHO IS GARY V. LETT?

Hello, I am Gary V. Lett. I am currently a working ceramic artist and sculpture. I teach at the American Museum of Ceramic Art (AMOCA) located in Pomona, and at Foothill Country Day School in Claremont, California.  I reside in Pomona with Lisha, my wife of 36 years. We have two adult sons and six grandchildren. I spent over 25 years working in the graphic art field and as the principal of Lett’s Do Art, a graphic art firm; directed and taught art for various children art programs in San Antonio, Texas, and I am a licensed minister. And now I am embarking on my very first published children’s book.

THE CAMPAIGN: It has taken me decades to get where I am today with this project, writing and illustrating a little here and there. This book promotes compassion, healthy eating, exercise, family, and community. The publishing of this book is a grand milestone for my family and me! Over the course of my wonderful marriage, career, and other endeavors, this one experience, in comparison, pales many of the others. For me to finally hold and smell a freshly printed copy of Gary & a Box of Salt will be like holding my first-born all over again.

YOUR GIVING KEEPS ON GIVING: Charity starts at home. Lisha and I have cared and extend ourselves to others even in our youth, and we probably will always continue to do so on into our golden age! Therefore, in traditional form, we want to help others as we help ourselves. Here are two wonderful charities that will benefit from the sale of this book:Justin Carr Wants World Peace Memorial Fund &The Friends of Pomona Public Library. For every book sold, $1 will go to each organization.

Justin Carr Wants World Peace Memorial Fund: The fund is committed to the promotion of world peace through advocacy, art, education, mentoring, and scholarships. The Friends of Pomona Public Library. The Friends of Pomona Public Library was founded in 1955 in order to promote the continuation of the library as endowed by Andrew Carnegie. He saw that libraries are an integral part of a community’s growth and well-being.

The Friends of Pomona Public Library contributes yearly to library programs and services not budgeted by city funds. Every area of the library has benefited from numerous Friends’ donations, which:

·2,500 11"x 8.5"thirty-six-page hardcover book with thirty four full-color pages.

·  Sales promotion expenses (projected book-signing trips, advertisements, etc.)

·  International shipping cost

·  ISBN numbers

OUR FUNDING NEEDS AND WHAT YOU GET

Funding goal: $10.000

Perks/gifts: Four levels of “Gifts” for your generous contribution:

Level I  For your support of $70 you will receive: (1) autographed copy of the book Gary & a Box of Salt  and (1) autographed T-shirt that features the book cover and the slogan: "I Helped CrowdFund: Gary & a Box of Salt 2015"

Level II  For your support of $125 you will receive: In addition to Level I: (1) 18”x 24” signed special edition original graphite lithograph, To Positive Roots (unframed), andGary’s first ever reproduced art work,

Level IIIFor your support of $250 you will receive: In addition to Levels I & II: (1) box of 24 special-edition writing cards and envelopes that features the Positive Roots lithograph and the slogan on the back that reads: "I Helped CrowdFund Gary & a Box of Salt 2015. 

Level IV  For your support of $500 you will receive All Levels Doubled

YOUR DOLLARS WILL BE INFLUENTIAL TO CHANGE 2,500 YOUNG LIVES Plus

All funds raised will go toward printing cost, shipping, and Indiegogo fees associated with this campaign, along with the costs of your perks. The majority of the funding will go directly to producing a high-quality book and the remainder used for perks, marketing, and promotion.

Risks & Challenges

The book is ready to go to the printer; all we need are your funds to make that happen. I can send the order right after being funded. Production of the book will take 4-8 weeks but as with any publishing project there can be unforeseen delays or setbacks. We will work our hardest to get this book and perks into your hands on time and keep everyone updated if there are any setbacks to our estimated schedule. 

What else can you do to help?

The best thing you can do to help us out is to share our campaign! Tell your friends and neighbors and share the campaign through your social media platforms. We appreciate every single share and tweet from the top to the bottom of our hearts! 

My dream for this project may have been deferred, but it has never dried up!

When I was in the sixth grade I won a writing contest. If that win was just based on my illustrations alone, my accomplishment would not have been a big deal. But it truly was! That win came from a kid whose English skills were in the lowest percentile of his sixth-grade class. Creativity has never been an issue for me. But I thank God for a good teacher who used her personal treasure of time and worked with me long hours after school until my sentence structure matched my illustration ability, and it paid off!

Lisha’s and my dream of seeing this book materialize have been ours for years, decades even! I know that deep down inside, ever since that food give-away—the main plot of the book, I’ve wanted to share this story, but because of the lack of finance along with publishers not wanting to pay for 34 color illustrations, those things have kept this book from happening until now! As reality unfolds, and more often than not, achieving success requires the following: great leaps of faith, initiative exercised, and tenacity. These coupled with the right opportunity leads to destiny realized, but let me not leave out the power and benefit of prayer!

The establishing of this printing campaign simulates the scenario of my six-grade book contest and smacks me right back to it. The writing, editing, and illustrations for this book ‒I have done‒ but what I lack right now is money! Today, you sit where that beloved teacher once sat: in the seat of power and where you, too, can make a difference in my life; that of a 59-year-old man whose dream has been deferred, but not dried up! With your dollars, I am closer to living out that dream of seeing Gary & a Box of Salt  in print form and in stores within a matter of months.

The printing of this book will be a great accomplishment for us all. Won’t you please help by sending in your money today? Thank you! If you like my story and would help but are lacking in finance, rest assured, you can still help and be on our team! Just use your influence with your social media network partners and let people know about my Indiegogo page and ask them to support for my campaign. Remember, no gift is too small; every dollar given gets us closer to our maximum goal, and together, we can do this!

story:
Lazarus Risen

A Bundoran Press Science Fiction Anthology

Dreams of immortality and eternal youth are almost as old as human culture itself. But what would the world look like if everyone could live and be young forever? What would it look like if only some of us had that privilege? “Lazarus Risen” will seek short stories that explore the economic, political, social and psychological consequences of life extension, human cloning, the hard upload and other forms of the biological singularity.

An all original anthology, which, if we meet our goal will pay at least 5 cents (Canadian) a word, Lazarus Risen will follow on the heels of our previous three successful anthologies:

  • Blood and Water (2012) – an anthology of near future resource conflicts, Winner of the Aurora Award
  • Strange Bedfellows (2014) – an anthology of political science fiction, Aurora Award nominee, and
  • Second Contacts (2015) – stories set 50 years after First Contact

Like Second Contacts, this anthology will be edited by Hayden Trenholm and Michael Rimar, Aurora Award winning and nominated short fiction writers and editors. We expect the anthology will be 80-85000 words of original fiction. We will be open to submissions to writers from around the world. Expected publication: October 2016

The Impact

You'll be helping us pay writers to create stories that might otherwise never have been written and how cool is that?
Lazarus Risen will feature stories on the cutting edge of new science fiction where biology, medicine, and cybernetics meet. Like all great science fiction we'll be exploring the problems and possibilities of the future -- and how society can deal with them -- before it happens.

Our Perks

Contributors will get our thanks and recognition in the Acknowledgements as well as e-books, books (lots of books), Bundoran Press souvenirs, writing advice and critiquing from our editors, signed posters of cover art,  

What Happens If We Don't Reach Our Goal?

This is a flexible campaign and if we don't make our goal, the book will still appear with all funds raised going to paying writers. But, without our target amount, the pay rate will be lower. Help writers get paid a decent wage! 

Last year, we ran a campaign for Second Contacts. We didn't reach our fixed goal (and so none of the money) but we published the anthology anyway. Because that's what we've been doing at Bundoran Press  for the last seven years -- making good books.

And, if we raise more than our goal?

Stretch Goals

The first $1000 raised beyond our goal will be used to further increase pay rates in ¼ cent increments to a maximum of 6 cents a word.

Additional funds will further increase the pay rates UNLESS…

Super Stretch Goal

If we raise another $2000 – that is, $6400 total – we will publish a second anthology – starting at three cents a word and rising from there.

LIBERTY HALL

“This is Liberty Hall. You can spit on the mat and call the cat a bastard.” – A. Bertram Chandler

An anthology of Space Opera where anything goes – as long as the story is entertaining and thought-provoking. Want a story with a white male engineer as the hero? Go right ahead. Prefer gender-bending aliens in a communist space station? Sounds perfect. Left wing, right wing, no wings at all? Love it. Libertarian, authoritarian, democratic or group mind – if you can do it, we might publish it. Provided it’s a great story. Politics in service of a story – we don’t mind. Stories in service to your politics – keep them to yourself. Expected publication: Spring 2017

If we are able to publish a second anthology from this campaign, all those eligible to receive an e-book or print book will get a copy of the second anthology as well.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, you can still help by sharing this campaign on Facebook, Twitter and other social media. Don't forget, Indiegogo has some simple sharing tools for you to use.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Jabali Smith, and my memoir is the true story of my life as a child slave, and my life-long journey of recovery. From a place of fear, shame and loneliness I learned not only how to survive, but how to thrive, through the art of Inner Strength, Love, Compassion and Forgiveness.

I was 6 years old when my mother gave me to a messianic doomsday sex cult. I was forced to survive as a child slave on the streets of a foreign country, isolated by language and culture for over 5 years.

This is my story. But maybe you or someone you know and love has a similar story? Did you know that a child abuse report is made every 10 seconds?

I believe it’s important for me to share my experience because I know there are so many people who have suffered and who are still suffering from child abuse and molestation.

But child abuse doesn’t have to destroy someone’s life. A kind word, loving gesture or a symbol of concern, given at the right time, can make a dramatic shift in how that young person sees the world. And that can help change the course of their life for the better. I know because it happened to me.

 

I’m writing Slave: A Human trafficking Survivor Finds Life, and sharing my story, as the first step in my larger vision of opening a child wellness center. The center will offer martial arts, music, dance, theater and yoga combined with a curriculum of art therapy, music therapy, psychology and interpersonal self-development. The program is specifically designed for foster children and inner city youth, but open to all.

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • Your specific pledge will fund the editing, publishing and distribution of my memoir - thank you for helping raise awareness around this very important issue!

  • Depending on your contribution level, you will get the eBook, a paperback, a signed copy, or a dedication.

  • If you live in the San Francisco Bay Area, you can also get me to come teach dance, music or martial arts to you or a group!

  • Once my memoir is available I will begin to pilot my long-term vision: a wellness center for abused youth.

  • I sincerely thank you for helping to make my vision possible, and helping others to heal by learning the art of Love, Compassion and Forgiveness.

The Impact

  • To assist people who live with PTSD in their journey of healing, cognitive growth and emancipation from pain. 

  • To tear down the world wide wall of silence around child abuse, molestation and human trafficking.

  • To use my personal experience to inspire others and remind them that they can access their own inner strength. 

  • To open a wellness center and help children of abuse in the process of healing  and growth. 

  • To teach children about the power of self love, inner strength, discipline and determination.

  • The potential to foster communities of strong-minded, well-adjusted emotionally intelligent members of humanity that are inspired to break the chain of molestation and abuse.

Risks & Challenges

  • My memoir is finished. The next step is to get a high-quality editor, distributor and marketing expert.

  • Facing the fear of rejection and the possibility of failing without being stopped.

  • Barring a cataclysmic event this book is coming to a mailbox near you!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Want to support my cause? Share this campaign on Indiegogo, Facebook and beyond!

  • Interested in supporting my wellness center? Do you have connections with media, non-profits, businesses or the arts that might benefit the center?

The Impact
To assist people who live with PTSD in their journey of healing, cognitive growth and emancipation from pain. 
To tear down the world wide wall of silence around child abuse, molestation and human trafficking.
To use my personal experience to inspire others and remind them that they can access their own inner strength. 
To open a wellness center and help children of abuse in the process of healing  and growth. 
To teach children about the power of self love, inner strength, discipline and determination.
The potential to foster communities of strong-minded, well-adjusted emotionally intelligent members of humanity that are inspired to break the chain of molestation and abuse.
Risks & Challenges
My memoir is finished. The next step is to get a high-quality editor, distributor and marketing expert.
Facing the fear of rejection and the possibility of failing without being stopped.
Barring a cataclysmic event this book is coming to a mailbox near you!
Other Ways You Can Help
Want to support my cause? Share this campaign on Indiegogo, Facebook and beyond!
Interested in supporting my wellness center? Do you have connections with media, non-profits, businesses or the arts that might benefit the center?

story:
See. Food. Write. is the new food exploration project by me, science writer and creative designer Ben Young Landis. You might know me as the creator of the educational website Better Know a Fish, or from Twitter as @younglandis.

Food is what binds us humans together. The act of preparing and sharing food with friends and guests is a most sacred gesture. Every time we take in a touch of food or drink, we make some holy communion with the organisms and natural elements which served as the vessels of our nourishment.

Food inspires and fuels me, and now, as I make my own journey through life, I want to share my passion and exploration with everyone.

I want to find the stories behind the food and people I encounter day-to-day, and help reconnect all of us to the intimacy of food and eating. I also want to share my philosophy of shopping simply while eating beautifully — creating easy, nourishing recipes we can all make, in spite of our busy, crazy lives. And here and there, we'll take a peek at the natural history behind the flora and fauna we eat.

As we embark on this journey, I would deeply appreciate your help.

As an independent writer, my craft is my life, and my time and creativity is my offering to our community and to the world. This campaign will support See. Food. Write. throughout the Autumn 2015 writing season, enabling me to create even more stories, photos, and recipes for everyone's enjoyment and use — free of subscription fees and paywalls. 

So join me. Life is an adventure, and it's no fun eating, learning, and exploring alone. Come with me as I find these stories behind the food and people. We'll cook a little, laugh a lot — and see, food, and write!


The first stories are now online. Read them now at www.seefoodwrite.com! 

Please enjoy my stories. I am confident that they'll be worth your time and support, and enrich your heart and soul. 

Then contact me at seefoodwrite@gmail.com — I would love to hear from you.

story:
Our Story

Jordan's healing is a miracle and still continues to unfold and inspire. We both have come a long way and in our book we share our journey from the very beginning. Our prayer is that it will give people hope and a a hunger to know God more.

I have been writing this all out for nearly 4.5 years now and Its finally finished! I am getting ready to do all the things I need to do to get it ready for self publishing. But I need some help!

What We Need & What You Get

Here the hard part for me!! I don't like asking for help but to get this last part done I need to get practical side of self publishing done which means all the layouts and computer nerdy stuff. So I am asking for help. If you want to help me get this last leg accomplished please pray for me!! and if you want to help financially, that would be awesome :)

Thanks guys!

story:
Short Summary

The Lightning Farmer is a young adult fantasy novel about a young girl who is thrust into war, wielding the worlds dying energy source: lightning.

The book is full of adventure, drama, original creatures, heroic and evil characters. There are elements of sc-fi along with fantasy.

The rough draft of The Lightning Farmer is finished, now I am looking for finishing funds to polish it and create an Ebook.

What We Need & What You Get

What I am going to do with the funding is: hire and editor to edit the book, use the time to polish it and promotion.

The Impact

If this campaign is a success and people dig the world I've created I really hope to write the sequel and eventually make it a trilogy. But for now, book one.

story:
English Summary

I have already startet to write a book about my life with ALS and ask you for support. If you want to know more about my story, please see my PowerPointPresentation in English: http://open-forum.de/events/ANGELA-Turin.pdf

Ich bin nicht krank, ich kann mich nur nicht bewegen!

 Seit 1994 lebe ich mit der Diagnose ALS – Amyotrophe Lateralsklerose. ALS ist eine Erkrankung des Motorischen Nervensystems, die innerhalb weniger Jahre zu einer fortschreitenden Lähmung der Extremitäten sowie einer Störung bis hin zur Lähmung des Sprechens, Schluckens und der Atmung führt. Erste Symptome der Krankheit zeigten sich 1994 – da war ich 39 Jahre alt, allein erziehende Mutter von zwei Kindern und wollte gerade in eine neue Berufskarriere durchstarten, als unerklärliche Lähmungserscheinungen mich aus meinem bisherigen Leben herauskatapultieren. Es begann eine Odyssee zu den verschiedensten Ärzten – am Ende stand die Diagnose ALS. Seit 1998 bin ich fast vollständig gelähmt und werde über eine Magensonde natürlich ernährt und künstlich beatmet.

 Sechs Jahre lang war ich im dritten Stock meiner Berliner Altbauwohnung ans Bett gefesselt. Lange Zeit auch ohne das Kommunikationshilfsmittel „EyeGaze“, ein Sprachcomputer, der es mir ermöglicht, meine Gedanken und Gefühle mitzuteilen: Ich bediene quasi mit meinen Augen eine Tastatur, eine Laserkamera zeichnet meine Augenbewegungen auf und auf einem Bildschirm erscheinen Worte und Sätze, die auch über einen Lautsprecher hörbar gemacht werden können.

 Davor musste ich mich nur mit einer Buchstabentafel verständigen, wo ich einzelne Buchstaben oder Silben nach deren Häufigkeit so zusammen gestellt hatte, dass eine helfende Person, diese antippen und ich mit einem zustimmenden Augenblinzeln bestätigen konnte, dass ich diesen Buchstaben meinte.

Premiere im Theater

Am 17. November 2004 wurde in der Volksbühne am Rosa Luxemburg Platz in Berlin die Premiere von Christoph Schlingensiefs Stück „A. Hipler, Kunst & Gemüse“ gefeiert. Als Mitautorin des Theaterstückes lenkte und kommentierte ich die Ereignisse auf der Bühne mit Hilfe einer Laserkamera, die einen Computer animierte. Kein Außenstehender hätte es mir zugetraut mit ALS im finalen Stadium, sabbernd, unfähig Arme, Beine oder den Kopf zu bewegen, mit PEG (Magensonde) und beatmet, ich würde an Christophs Schlingensiefs Seite Theater spielen. Niemand hat es geglaubt, dass ich auch noch alles daran setzen würde, zusammen mit der Volksbühnen Crew 'unser Stück' in Paris aufzuführen. Und nachdem mein Flug dorthin der deutschen Bürokratie zum Opfer fiel, nahm ich halt den Nachtzug. Auf dieser Reise wurden wir von einem Kamerateam begleitet und Björn Thönicke hat aus dem Material einen Film geschnitten, der mit dem Titel „Mit den Augen tanzen“ erstmals 2006 einem breiten Fernsehpublikum vorgestellt wurde.

 Ich möchte Menschen begreiflich machen, dass ein Leben mit ALS möglich ist. Ein Leben – nicht nur ein Überleben - ist möglich, wenn eine 24 Stundenpflege im eigenen Zuhause garantiert werden kann und sich die Gesellschaft für den Gedanken öffnet, dass auch schwer behinderte Menschen ihr Leben selbst gestalten wollen und können.

 Die fortgeschrittene Technik in der Medizin erlaubt es heutzutage auch Menschen, deren physische Körper fast vollständig gelähmt sind, ein selbstbestimmtes Leben zu führen. Denn ihr Gehirn und ihr Geist sind völlig funktionsfähig und die ausgereifte medizinische Technik ermöglicht ihnen das auch zu kommunizieren. Ein Beispiel dafür ist der weltbekannte Physiker Steven Hawking, der seit seiner Studienzeit an der progressiv fortschreitenden Krankheit ALS leidet und bis heute an Universitäten lehrt und viel beachtete Fachbücher über die Funktionsweise des Universums geschrieben hat. Forschungen haben auch gezeigt, dass Patienten, die an ALS oder einem Locked-In-Syndrom leiden, durchaus ein positives Lebensgefühl haben, das oft sogar größer ist als das von gesunden Menschen.

 Das große Problem ist aber, dass unsere Gesellschaft, deren Pflegeeinrichtungen und damit auch das Pflegepersonal auf Menschen, die ihr Leben trotz vollständiger Lähmung und künstlicher Beatmung selbst bestimmen wollen, nicht eingestellt sind. Die bisherige Erfahrung war eben, dass Patienten in diesem Zustand nicht kommunizieren und folglich auch nicht an einem „normalen“ Leben teilnehmen könnten. Auch wenn einige von ihnen, nicht stationär untergebracht sind, sondern wie ich mit einer 24 Stunden Pflege in ihrem häuslichen Umfeld betreut werden, ist die vorherrschende Einstellung doch, dass ein solches Leben nicht lebenswert sei, eine Zumutung für die betroffene Person und eine Belastung für ihre Familie.

 Niemand ist darauf eingestellt, am wenigsten das betreuende Personal, dass schwer behinderte Personen das Haus verlassen, Ausflüge machen oder sogar an einen exotischen Ort verreisen wollen. Ich will Menschen durch mein Beispiel ermutigen und zeigen, was alles möglich ist, wenn man wirklich will und von der Gesellschaft die Unterstützung erhält, die dafür notwendig ist.

http://www.oya-online.de/article/read/263-ich_bin_nicht_krank_ich_kann_mich_nur_nicht_bewegen.html

 

 Der Verein ALS-Mobil e.V. 

http://www.als-mobil.de/

 Deshalb habe ich zusammen mit anderen Betroffenen und Freunden den Berliner Verein „ALS-Mobil“ gegründet, um uns gegenseitig zu stützen. Dabei geht es uns vor allem um die psychosoziale Beratung und die Unterstützung der Mobilität von ALS Betroffenen. Reisen ist schwierig, aber möglich, wie ich mit meiner Reise im Nachtzug nach Paris gezeigt habe. Ich fahre auch in öffentlichen Bussen zur langen Nacht der Wissenschaften in Berlin, wo ich regelmäßig Vorträge halte und fuhr im überfüllten ICE nach Bonn zu Theaterproben der von Christoph Schlingensief inszenierten Oper „Freax“. Ich stand auch schon mit meinem Rolli neben den Fahrrädern im Regionalexpress nach Rostock, wo ich dieses Jahr mehrere Wochen in einem Wohncontainer vor der Kunsthalle Rostock mein Domizil aufgeschlagen hatte. Dort zeigte ich, dass es sogar möglich ist, „mit Gedanken“ Bilder zu malen. Die Ausstellung „Pingo Ergo Sum“ von Adi Hösle zeigte, wie mit der Entwicklung von Brain Computer Interfaces ganz neue Wege der Bildgestaltung möglich sind.

http://www.oya-online.de/article/read/633-ich_male_also_bin_ich.html

 

 

 „Pingo Ergo Sum“ von Adi Hoesle in der Rostocker Kunsthalle

 http://www.tagesschau.de/multimedia/video/video1083090.html

 

 Es gibt mittlerweile einige von ALS Betroffene, die in Büchern ihr Schicksal beschrieben haben. Viele erinnern sicherlich den Film „Schmetterling und Taucherglocke“, in dem das Schicksal von Jean-Dominique Bauby beschrieben wird. Der Chefredakteur der französischen Ausgabe der Zeitschrift „ELLE“ war nach einem Schlaganfall in ein Koma gefallen und nach seinem Erwachen befand er sich in einem so genannten „Locked-In-Syndrom“, dessen Symptome der ALS ähneln, auch wenn sie andere Ursachen haben. Er schrieb ein anrührendes Buch mit seinem linken Augenlid, indem seine Logopädin ihm die Buchstaben vorlas und er mit dem Auge zwinkerte, sobald der richtige Buchstabe genannt wurde.

 Bücher und Filme von Menschen, die wie ich körperlich schwerst eingeschränkt sind, kann es gar nicht genug geben. Im Moment reden alle Politiker von Inklusion, doch die wenigsten Menschen wissen, was das für den konkreten Alltag für die in ihren Aktivitäten eingeschränkten Menschen wirklich bedeutet. Das möchte ich in meinem Buch beschreiben.

 Mir ist es wichtig, dass Menschen verstehen, das wir in unseren körperlichen Möglichkeiten eingeschränkten die gleichen Menschenrechte zustehen wie allen anderen. Leider erlebe ich es in meinem Alltag ganz anders. Mördern und Vergewaltigern steht unter anderen Vergünstigungen der Hofgang zweimal täglich zu, während mir dieser gleich ganz verwehrt wird. Ich werde mutwillig in Isolationshaft gezwungen und sehe für meinen Fall den Tatbestand der Freiheitsberaubung als erfüllt an. Keinen schert das wirklich, ob und wie sehr ich darunter leide, nicht in die Sonne schauen zu können. Alle um mich herum riechen den Frühling, gehen grillen, spüren Regen im Gesicht oder bestaunen das erste Schneekristall auf dem Ärmel. Keinen kümmert es, wie meine Psyche die jahrelange Isolationshaft verkraftet. Ich hatte das Glück, dass Christoph Schlingensief mich und die Krankheit ALS mit seinem Theaterstück ins Licht der Öffentlichkeit und damit für mich eine Menge Dinge ins Rollen brachte. Für meinen Alltag mit den ewig gleichen Einschränkungen durch die katastrophale Pflegesituation in Deutschland hat sich dadurch leider nichts verändert.

 Ich soll schicklich im Bett liegen, keine Arbeit verursachen. Noch erlaubt man mir zu atmen, zu verdauen und fernzusehen. Von mir wird erwartet, stillschweigend hinzunehmen, wenn wegen Weihnacht meine Eingaben nicht bearbeitet werden, dann ist Ostern, dann Sommerferien, Urlaub, jemand erkrankt und –hups– schon wieder ist Weihnachten, Ostern ist auch wieder vorbei …

 Ich habe jedoch immer noch Träume. Auf meiner To-Do-Liste sind: Heli fliegen, mit Delfinen schwimmen, wieder die Bewegung eines Pferdes spüren, mir Wien, Zürich, Australien,Amerika und Rügen anschauen, nicht abgehakt.

 

Ich freue mich über Eure Unterstützung!

 Mein Anliegen war von dem Moment an, als ich selbst aus meinem ´Loch´ herauskam, anderen mitzuteilen, dass man auch mit ALS leben (LEBEN!) kann. Vorausgesetzt man will.Ich  jedenfalls will. Ich habe die Gabe (dank an wen auch immer) recht amüsant schreiben zu können. Ich möchte mit meinem Buch Angst nehmen – Spitzen abrunden – den Blick trotz ALS nach vorn zu richten – einfach sagen: wer vorher lebensfroh war, kann's auch mit ALS, wer vorher leben wollte kann's auch mit. Und wenn Stephen Hawking unterrichten kann, muss niemand mit ALS dahinsiechen! Also den faulen Popo geschwungen! Ich finde ALS ist keine Ausrede für Faulheit. Klar- jedem seinen Depri. Aber jeden Morgen geht die Sonne auf!

Mit Eurer Spende möchte ich das Lektorat und den Druck meines Buches ermöglichen. Ihr unterstützt mich auch, wenn Ihr meine Geschichte, die exemplarisch für viele andere steht, anderen zugänglich macht. Vielen Dank!!

Bei Problemen mit PayPal, hier das direkte Spendenkonto des gemeinnützigen Vereins: ALS-Mobil e.V / Deutsche Bank Berlin / BLZ: 10070024 / Kto: 0298018 / Betr.: Phoenix aus der Asche (Bitte für Spendenquittungen auch Ihre Email-Adresse im Betreff vermerken).

Keinen schert das wirklich, ob und wie sehr ich darunter leide, nicht in die Sonne schauen zu können. Alle um mich herum riechen den Frühling, gehen grillen, spüren Regen im Gesicht oder bestaunen das erste Schneekristall auf dem Ärmel. Keinen kümmert es, wie meine Psyche die jahrelange Isolationshaft verkraftet. Ich hatte das Glück, dass Christoph Schlingensief mich und die Krankheit ALS mit seinem Theaterstück ins Licht der Öffentlichkeit und damit für mich eine Menge Dinge ins Rollen brachte. Für meinen Alltag mit den ewig gleichen Einschränkungen durch die katastrophale Pflegesituation in Deutschland hat sich dadurch leider nichts verändert.
 Ich soll schicklich im Bett liegen, keine Arbeit verursachen. Noch erlaubt man mir zu atmen, zu verdauen und fernzusehen. Von mir wird erwartet, stillschweigend hinzunehmen, wenn wegen Weihnacht meine Eingaben nicht bearbeitet werden, dann ist Ostern, dann Sommerferien, Urlaub, jemand erkrankt und –hups– schon wieder ist Weihnachten, Ostern ist auch wieder vorbei …
 Ich habe jedoch immer noch Träume. Auf meiner To-Do-Liste sind: Heli fliegen, mit Delfinen schwimmen, wieder die Bewegung eines Pferdes spüren, mir Wien, Zürich, Australien,Amerika und Rügen anschauen, nicht abgehakt.
 
Ich freue mich über Eure Unterstützung!
 Mein Anliegen war von dem Moment an, als ich selbst aus meinem ´Loch´ herauskam, anderen mitzuteilen, dass man auch mit ALS leben (LEBEN!) kann. Vorausgesetzt man will.Ich  jedenfalls will. Ich habe die Gabe (dank an wen auch immer) recht amüsant schreiben zu können. Ich möchte mit meinem Buch Angst nehmen – Spitzen abrunden – den Blick trotz ALS nach vorn zu richten – einfach sagen: wer vorher lebensfroh war, kann's auch mit ALS, wer vorher leben wollte kann's auch mit. Und wenn Stephen Hawking unterrichten kann, muss niemand mit ALS dahinsiechen! Also den faulen Popo geschwungen! Ich finde ALS ist keine Ausrede für Faulheit. Klar- jedem seinen Depri. Aber jeden Morgen geht die Sonne auf!
Mit Eurer Spende möchte ich das Lektorat und den Druck meines Buches ermöglichen. Ihr unterstützt mich auch, wenn Ihr meine Geschichte, die exemplarisch für viele andere steht, anderen zugänglich macht. Vielen Dank!!
Bei Problemen mit PayPal, hier das direkte Spendenkonto des gemeinnützigen Vereins: ALS-Mobil e.V / Deutsche Bank Berlin / BLZ: 10070024 / Kto: 0298018 / Betr.: Phoenix aus der Asche (Bitte für Spendenquittungen auch Ihre Email-Adresse im Betreff vermerken).

story:
Armed Magazine - "Spiritually Equipping You for VICTORY in Battle!"

Our Story

Hello & Thank you for taking the time to visit this campaign! I know your time is precious so I promise that this will be valuable time spent.  My name is Tanika Jones & I have been called to Equip God's people for Victory through the development of an online Christian Magazine - Armed Magazine. Writing has always been my passion and now I am creating an avenue that will allow others to share their ministry of writing with the world! 


Armed Magazine is a multi-ethnic Online Christian Magazine created to promote spiritual growth for Christians who are committed in their walk with Christ and have a strong desire to go deeper in their faith.  Armed is also created to win lost souls for Christ! 


Our editorial mission is to create a community that provides inspiration, motivation, support and knowledge that will equip our readers to be victorious in every area of Christian living.  Armed Magazine will be a destination for our readers to gain spiritual knowledge and encouragement, interact with other Christians, uplift one another, obtain Godly wisdom that will help them to reach victory and develop strategies for applying The Word of God to every area of life. We want our readers to be Spiritually Armed for Battle!

Here is what Tanika says about the creation of Armed Magazine:

"This Magazine was a vision that God placed in my heart a few years ago.  I procrastinated answering the call but it always tugged at my heart.  As I have grown spiritually, I had no other choice but to obey God.  A hope or dream with no action will always remain just a hope or dream.  My prayer is that Armed Magazine will inspire and equip Christians to effectively live a Christ-Centered life.  I've asked God to send His chosen people to this chosen place at His chosen time to build the dream that He has placed in my heart - Armed Magazine."

 

The Impact

Armed Magazine is scheduled to launch June 2012 & we need your help!! The creation for this magazine developed from a true lacking in the online and digital magazine space for a Christian based publication that is not afraid to tackle the difficult conversations related to Christian living. We have a committed team of 20+ anointed writers and editors that are passionate about using their gifts to build God's Kingdom and to help others grow in their spiritual lives. 


We are asking for your support through financial funding and prayer.  Your donations will help us to build an interactive website for our readers.  The website will feature Biblical & Inspirational content, main features from powerful leaders in the Christian community, a bookstore, discussion forums and more!


What We Need & What You Get

Our financial goal for this campaign is to raise $6000.  This will cover the cost of website development and initial advertising that will raise awareness of Armed Magazine prior to and following our June 2012 launch.

 

 

If this project doesn’t get fully funded, the wonderful features that we would like to have on our website will be limited.  We want to give our readers the best!  We are faithful that we will have more than enough supporters align with our vision to get Armed Magazine into the hands of our future readers!  The website is the first tangible step towards making this a reality!  The online content will be free, accessible across the world and allow many Christian writers a place to share their stories to spiritually inspire, edify and equip others!



As a supporter, we’ll post a Contributor's Page on our website that honors those who’ve donated to make this dream a reality.  


Be sure to check out the additional perks and rewards to the right!  Your support will be beneficial to you and others!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone that views this page will be able to donate.  We thank you so much for your desire to give.  Please help us by SPREADING THE WORD about this Campaign.  Share it with everyone you know!  Post it on your Facebook page, Tweet it and email it to your family and friends!  Every kind of support is helpful and a blessing to our team.


We pray that God will bless you abundantly - Thank you for your financial support, Spreading the news and most importantly, Thank You for your prayers!!!!! God Bless You! 


Stay Connected to Us!

Facebook: www.facebook.com/ArmedMagazine

Twitter: https://twitter.com/#!/armedmagazine

Pre-Launch Site: www.armedmagazine.com

story:
Before You read below Please watch this Link And read the comments of David Bailey about the story 

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MOhnjtwhUUU

Short Summary

My name is Bernie Zeitler. I represent a group of authors who have lost a great deal of money pursuing long held dreams of sharing stories that we feel will benefit others. We come from all walks of life and live in various states throughout the United States. We came together when the publishing company, 2 Moon Press, folded on us leaving each of us without books that had been paid for in advance. We spent many years pouring our hearts into writing and producing our work and saving monies in order to publish, but all we have been left with is debt and lost dreams.

We find ourselves now trying to recover our resources through civil action. We are finding the cost prohibitive but want to hold the company responsible for making good on its contract and many promises. We also want to stop this company from doing this again. Since we started fighting back the local Newspaper picked up the story and came to authors for their stories. Below are links to our story in the Battle Creek Enquirer.

http://www.battlecreekenquirer.com/article/20130525/NEWS01/305250034/2-Moon-Press-abrupt-closure-sparks-probe

http://www.battlecreekenquirer.com/article/20130620/NEWS01/306200005/Author-sues-2-Moon-Press

What We Need & What You Get

The legal costs are growing and we are also looking to move forward. We can expect legal costs of as much as $15,000. We need your help with this. We are determined to see it through but need your help.

We need people to help us prevent this company or its former owners from doing this to anyone else. They have affected people from other countries by the improper use of their artwork and we as authors are represented in about 10 states.

We believe that with your help we can prevail. You will get the satisfaction of knowing you helped us do that.

The Impact

We believe we will prevail and our story will serve to be a warning to others who would do this that not everyone will just let them go unpunished.  When we do prevail we Pledge to share our experience with anyone who will listen. We further pledge, because many of us are telling our personal stories that we will continue to encourage people who have been through similar experiences.

Some examples of the things we talk about in our individual books are:

1.  Surviving Child Abuse

2.  Compulsive Gambling Recovery

3.  Cancer Survival

4.  Dealing with rare Medical conditions

5.  Dealing with the loss of a Child

We were not trying to be famous or rich but rather trying to share our pains to help others get through things that are traumatic. We are committed to continue to reach out to our fellow man.

Other Ways You Can Help

We also need your Prayers and encouragement.  Please share this with your friends and coworkers.

 Note to Donors.... If the total is not reached all funds will be used to pay for legal action. We will also work with you if a refund is requested at the end of the campaign on a case by case basis. 

The Links below relate to news reports, Author Pages, and information on the history of our situation.

All Perks that require delivery will be provided at the conclusion of the Campaign and we will make direct arrangements with the Donor to complete the transaction.

story:
Hello Everybody,

We want to raise money for the children's hospitals.

Because of the desease of Yannis we have seen many sick children in different hospitals.

We'd like to do something about it.

Check out our website at : WWW.TOMANDYANNIS.COM or email us at : TOMANDYANNIS@OUTLOOK.COM 

On our website you will find more information about our funding, please support us.

We will use the funds to make children happy with their 'last' wish and we also support the studies of children's diseases!

This is very important!

Buy a PERK and we will reward you!

Many greetings from the T&Y FOUNDATION team.

_____________________________________________________________________

Hallo iedereen,

Wij willen graag geld inzamelen voor de kinderziekenhuizen.

Door de ziekte van Yannis hebben we veel zieke kinderen gezien en ontmoet in verschillende (kinder)ziekenhuizen.

Daar willen we graag iets aan doen.

Veel kinderen hebben nog een 'laatste' wens en vaak kan die wegens omstandigheden niet doorgaan...

Wij willen deze kinderen helpen met het ingezamelde geld, we zullen ook geld gebruiken om de onderzoeken naar kinderziekten te versnellen zodat bijvoorbeeld hartziekten/kwalen sneller kunnen worden gevonden!

Tegenwoordig treffen hartziekten meer en meer mensen dus jullie steun is uiterst belangrijk!

Steun en help ons en we zullen je belonen, je hoeft het dus niet voor niets te doen!

We hebben een systeem ontworpen met lidmaatschappen waar je ons steunt maar zelf ook kan profiteren en genieten van tal van unieke actie's en promoties.

Meer informatie vind je op onze website : WWW.TOMANDYANNIS.COM of mail ons op : TOMANDYANNIS@OUTLOOK.COM

Veel groeten van het T&Y FOUNDATION team.

_____________________________________________________________________

Story

Tom & Yannis (father and son) have a very hard life. 

Yannis is Hart patient and underwent a necessary heart transplant at the age of 7. 

The transplant has saved his life and this was followed by a heavy rehabilitation. 

His life will forever be 'different' than other children.

For example, during his life he will always have to take medication and pay attention for his general health. 

After his transplant he also had tumor moisture in the brains and a immune disease. 

Yannis his cousin died of a heart disease at age 5.

The MOM of Yannis has also experienced a lot, she got a heart and kidney transplant and also a pacemaker and several stents to keep the strictures to the heart arteries open. 

In addition, she also have a muscle disease.

Life for this family is very affected by all these conditions. 

Tom (Dad of Yannis) is known for his work in the Tour Management of various national and international artists, bands, ... 

Sometimes he appears with a guest appearance in a play, TV show or movie.

His contacts in the entertainment and the disappointments in life brought him the idea to establish this foundation along with his son and the collaboration of many others. 

After all, there are still too many sick children who have to spend their days in the hospital.

Some of them never leave the hospital...

And we want to do something about it! 

Our T & Y Foundation supports the sick children and helps to the study of certain (heart) diseases.

There will also be entertainment for these children in the hospital to make their stay a 'little bit' better, trying to give them a smile on their face. 

Let us (all together) have a heart for these kids and ensure that we will support them worldwide. 

- WE CAN'T CHANGE THE PAST,

BUT WE CAN CHANGE THE FUTURE -

Anyone who supports and purchase a membership will be rewarded!

We reward you with fantastic prizes on a regular basis. 

And there are also wonderful discounts on events, amusement parks, concerts, etc...

There are also vip packages with luxury tickets & meet and greets with familiar faces.

So please spread the word around, if you do something good, you will be rewarded. 

We guarantee only the best for everyone. 

With the memberships we support and help children in different ways.

Your contribution supports different beautiful projects in children's hospitals, charity 's, etc...

Do you want to know exactly where you contribution is going?

Mail us for more information. 

- KEEP YOUR DREAMS ALIVE - 

Many greetings from the entire

T & Y Foundation team

_____________________________________________________________________

Het Verhaal

Tom & Yannis (vader en zoon) hebben al een heel bewogen leven achter de rug. 

Yannis is hartpatient en onderging een noodzakelijke harttransplantatie op slechts 7-jarige leeftijd.

De transplantatie heeft zijn leven gered en daarna volgde een zware revalidatie.

Zijn leven zal voor altijd 'anders' zijn dan andere kinderen. 

Tijdens zijn levensloop zal hij bijvoorbeeld altijd medicatie moeten nemen en goed opletten voor zijn algemene gezondheid.

Zo kreeg Yannis na zijn transplantatie nog af te rekenen met tumorvocht in de hersenen en een immuunziekte. 

Het neefje van Yannis stierf op 5 jarige leeftijd.

Ook de mama van Yannis heeft al heel wat meegemaakt, zij kreeg buiten een hart en niertransplantatie ook een pacemaker en verschillende stents om de vernauwingen aan de hartaders open te houden.

Bovendien heeft ze ook nog eens af te rekenen met een spierziekte.

Het leven voor dit gezin is dan ook enorm aangetast door al deze omstandigheden.

Tom (papa van Yannis) is vooral bekend van zijn werk in het Tour Management van verschillende nationale en internationale artiesten, bands, ...

Soms duikt hij ook eens op met een gastrol in een theaterstuk, televisieserie of film.

Zijn contacten in de entertainment en de tegenslag in het leven brachten hem op het idee om deze foundation op te richten samen met zijn zoon en de medewerking van vele anderen.

Er zijn immers nog te veel zieke kinderen die hun dagen moeten doorbrengen in het hospitaal.

Sommige onder hen verlaten het hospitaal zelfs nooit meer...

En daar willen we iets aan doen! 

Onze T & Y Foundation steunt de zieke kinderen en helpt naar het onderzoek van bepaalde (hart)ziektes.

Er zal ook worden gezorgd voor entertainment om deze kinderen het zo aangenaam mogelijk te maken 'in de mate van het mogelijke'.

Laat ons samen een hart hebben voor deze kinderen en er voor zorgen dat we als 1 man wereldwijd achter hen staan.

- WE CAN'T CHANGE THE PAST,

BUT WE CAN CHANGE THE FUTURE -

Iedereen die steunt en een lidmaatschap aanschaft zal worden beloond!

Zo geven wij op regelmatige basis, grote maar vooral fantastische prijzen weg.

En er zijn ook schitterende kortingen op evenementen, pretparken, concerten, enz...

Er zijn ook vip arrangementen te winnen met luxe tickets & meet and greets met bekende gezichten.

U hoort het, wie goed doet word beloond!

Wij garanderen enkel het beste voor iedereen.​Met de lidmaatschappen steunen en helpen wij kinderen met alle mogelijke middelen.

Jullie bijdrage steunt verschillende mooie projecten in kinderziekenhuizen, charity's, enz...

Wil je precies weten waar jou bijdrage naar toe gaat?

Mail ons dan zeker voor meer informatie.

- KEEP YOUR DREAMS ALIVE -

Vele groeten van het voltallige

T & Y Foundation team

aangetast door al deze omstandigheden.Tom (papa van Yannis) is vooral bekend van zijn werk in het Tour Management van verschillende nationale en internationale artiesten, bands, ...Soms duikt hij ook eens op met een gastrol in een theaterstuk, televisieserie of film.Zijn contacten in de entertainment en de tegenslag in het leven brachten hem op het idee om deze foundation op te richten samen met zijn zoon en de medewerking van vele anderen.Er zijn immers nog te veel zieke kinderen die hun dagen moeten doorbrengen in het hospitaal.Sommige onder hen verlaten het hospitaal zelfs nooit meer...En daar willen we iets aan doen! Onze T & Y Foundation steunt de zieke kinderen en helpt naar het onderzoek van bepaalde (hart)ziektes.Er zal ook worden gezorgd voor entertainment om deze kinderen het zo aangenaam mogelijk te maken 'in de mate van het mogelijke'.Laat ons samen een hart hebben voor deze kinderen en er voor zorgen dat we als 1 man wereldwijd achter hen staan.- WE CAN'T CHANGE THE PAST,BUT WE CAN CHANGE THE FUTURE -Iedereen die steunt en een lidmaatschap aanschaft zal worden beloond!Zo geven wij op regelmatige basis, grote maar vooral fantastische prijzen weg.En er zijn ook schitterende kortingen op evenementen, pretparken, concerten, enz...Er zijn ook vip arrangementen te winnen met luxe tickets & meet and greets met bekende gezichten.U hoort het, wie goed doet word beloond!Wij garanderen enkel het beste voor iedereen.​Met de lidmaatschappen steunen en helpen wij kinderen met alle mogelijke middelen.Jullie bijdrage steunt verschillende mooie projecten in kinderziekenhuizen, charity's, enz...Wil je precies weten waar jou bijdrage naar toe gaat?Mail ons dan zeker voor meer informatie.- KEEP YOUR DREAMS ALIVE -Vele groeten van het voltalligeT & Y Foundation team

story:
Summary

Hello my name is Sherry O’Brian & I’m a psychotherapist who has assisted thousands of individuals through my workshops, groups, and private practice, to transform their pain into possibility. The inspiration behind Peaks and Valleys: Integrative Approaches for Recovering From Loss is my passion to provide a larger audience with these transformational tools. I am certified in Comprehensive Energy Psychology, Emotional Freedom Technique, Advanced Clinical Hypnotherapy, Psych-K™, Subtle Energy Therapy, Bereavement Counseling, Integrated Energy Therapy, and Guided Imagery. I am also a Reiki Master and an ordained minister.

As a psychotherapist, I often notice my clients experiencing unresolved grief and loss associated with several psychological issues. However, it was when tragedy struck my family that I began the journey of deepening my understanding of loss and assisting myself and others, using the various techniques I outline in this book.

 

Endorsements

This beautiful book weaves together Sherry O’Brian’s clinical wisdom and personal experience with grief. With insight and compassion, she helps the reader deal with pockets of unresolved emotions using powerful energy therapies so a person can move through loss into reorganization and recovery.  

--Barbara Stone, author of Invisible Roots: How Healing Past Life Trauma Can Liberate Your Present and Transforming Fear into Gold.

 

 Sherry O’Brian's 'Peaks and Valleys' book is a well-constructed, clear work on how to deal with grief and loss. Rather than a rehash of traditional methodologies, O’Brian takes a cutting-edge approach, based in science, and offers plenty of excellent exercises, examples and stories to help the reader make practical use of the material. There is no doubt this excellent book will help many sufferers of grief and loss to find their way back to a more balanced, enjoyable life.

 --Pamela Bruner, Business Coach, EFT Expert & co- author with Jack Canfield of Tapping Into Ultimate Success: How to Overcome Any Obstacle and Skyrocket Your Results.

 

 Sherry truly is a transformational author. Her ‘Peaks and Valleys’ book provides the reader with powerful tools to transform and recover from any kind of loss.  These tools go beyond traditional methods of recovery to help readers move through their pain and discover a life of love and joy on the other side.  

 --Christine Kloser, "The Transformation Catalyst," Three-Time Award Winning Author, Creator Transformational Author Experience.

 

 

What I Need & What You Get

My goal is to purchase a Balboa Master Package. Balboa is a divison of Hay House, therefore if my book does well, I could become a Hay House author:-) Below are just a few of the services that are included in this Master Package.

  • Cover design - Back & Front
  • Interior book design
  • E-book formatting
  • 10 hard cover copies
  • 50 paperback
  • Retail distribution
  • ISBN assignment
  • Balboa bookstore inclusion
  • Promo Material
  • Press release
  • Sold on Amazon
  • US copyright registration
  • ETC.

 

Additional Needs

  • Extra paperback copies
  • MP3 production
  • Marketing

 

All your donations will go to the publication and marketing of this book. However, if I am unable to reach my entire goal the funds will be distributed to a lesser package with Balboa Press. If on the other hand I surpass my goal, I would like to create a journal as an additional companion to the book. I have invited readers to use their own journal in lieu of having a companion one at this time.  

 

What you Get

Please review the various Perks I have listed for more information, however, just a few of the Perks I am offering are listed below:

  • For a contribution of $10 you will receive a digital PDF of the entire manuscript.
  • For a contribution of $20 you will be among the first to receive the e-book.
  • For a contribution of $35 you will receive an autographed copy of the paperback book shipped to you (U.S. shipping included, please add $10 for international shipping.)
  • For a contribution of $$50 you will receive an autographed copy of the paperback book shipped to you (U.S. shipping included, please add $15 for international shipping.) Plus a copy of the CD “Release & Transform Burden: a meditation to awaken the healing light within” this is just one of the tools shared in the book.
  • For a contribution of $100 you will receive an autographed copy of the paperback book shipped to you (U.S. shipping included, please add $15 for international shipping.) and an acknowledgement for your support in the book.  Plus a copy of the CD “Release & Transform Burden: a meditation to awaken the healing light within” this is just one of the tools shared in the book.
  • With any & all contributions you will get my sincere gratitude and appreciation.

 

 

The Impact

Loss is unique, in that all individuals will eventually experience it in some form or other. Whenever there is any kind of attachment, if the bond or connection is broken, a loss cannot be avoided. Even when this disconnect is beneficial, such as recovery from addiction, a loss can occur. The loss of friends, family, activities, and coping behaviors that were once acceptable are now severed.

In Part 1 of this book, I discuss various types of losses and perhaps shine some light on those losses that often go unrecognized. A brief overview of the different theoretical perspectives on grief and loss is shared, as well as some of the myths associated with these perspectives.

 In Part 2, I provide the reader with an overview of the mind/body/spirit connection among those suffering from grief and loss. This is designed to deepen the reader’s understanding of this connection and provide a framework for addressing this distress, using the various techniques presented in Part 3 of this book.

 In Part 3, the reader will be taken on a journey of transformation, using the integrative tools of Energy Psychology, Energy Medicine, rituals for healing, guided imagery, and meditation. I have successfully used these tools in various forms with my clients, workshop/retreat participants, and on myself to transcend the energy of grief and loss.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot donate please share this with someone you think may benefit from this book and/or may be able to assist me with a contribution. You can also use the Indiegogo share tools to get the word out. Again, I truly  appreciate any and all contributions that you can make.

Namaste

 

 

 

.
