story:
What Reviews.lu will be

Reviews.lu is a new upcoming online multilingual media/entertainment review and reference network. It's aim is to be transparent, to cover a broad spectrum of categories and to encourage user feedback.

With categories, such as music, film, games, literature, places and events, not only do we have something for everyone's interest, we also build a large knowledge base that serves as a reference.

We allow everyone to contribute to our website, just as we allow any creative minds, having released at least one serious product, to promote themselves. The quality of the website is being secured by our team.

Our team consists of journalists, critics, developers and motivated moderators that are selected on language and knowledge. Our reviews and articles will be corrected by our editor and translated to all other available languages.

 

In short

What Reviews.lu will be in short.

  • High quality reviews
  • Knowledge base and reference
  • User feedback
  • Multilingual
  • Transparent in use
  • Open to anyone
  • Motivated team

 

Why we need your help

Our team is a group of hard working people that give their everything to make this project a success. Our motivation is rising every day we dedicate to  Reviews.lu. To be able to continue working on this project, we need funding to pay for additional costs.

In order to launch the project we need a good webserver to host our website on. To work on the website and to post reviews on the road we need the required hardware and software. Other necessities are a camera, peripheral and office materials.
 
To get the latest news, make face-to-face contact with companies and possible partners and to extend our audience, we will need to travel. To get people to notice us, we need a moderate promotion campaign.
 
This is why your donation is crucial to our success.
 

Other ways you can help

You can help us get noticed by promoting our website or send this page to your friends, family and colleagues. Post a link to our website on your social profile or like us on Facebook. You can find our social profiles below.

Thank you for reading and we hope we can welcome you to our website soon!

- The Reviews.lu team

story:
For the English version of the campagne please scroll downwards. 

Kontakt/ Contact: indiegogo@medicalethics.eu

Mein Name ist Roland Holtz. Wie schon im Film beschreiben, bin ich ehemalisger Mitarbeiter der Pharmaindustrie. Ich habe die Pharmaindustrie im Jahr 2004 aus ethischen Gründen verlassen. Der immer stärker werdende Wettbewerb innerhalb der Pharmaindustrie und dessen Auswirkungen auf Patienten, haben mich zum Pharmakritiker werden lassen.

Menschen die fehlgeleitetem Pharmamarketing zum Opfer fallen haben sehr oft nicht die Kenntnisse, um mit den Konsequenzen, die daraus für sie erwachsen, umzugehen. Ich habe mich entschlossen, ihnen zu helfen. Ich habe in Presse und Fernsehen bereits dazu Stellung genommen. Der folgende Filmbeitrag ist ein Bespiel dafür.



Weiter Beispiele finden Sie hier
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=W6WLVLCQYpQ
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uOjLluYcH3Q
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BuvBSEJkOHQ

Pharmakrieg ein dokumentarischer Roman
Um mein Vorhaben weiter zu entwickeln habe ich mich entschlossen, ein Buch zu schreiben. Es enthält eine spannende, kriminalistische Geschichte über pharmazeutische Vermarktungsmethoden, die Menschen helfen soll, die möglichen Konsequenzen für sich einzuschätzen. In einem weiteren Teil erhalten sie Informationen, die ihnen helfen, mit Nebenwirkungen umzugehen, die oft genug das Leben der Betroffenen dramatisch verändern können.

Das Buch ist fertig geschrieben und inhaltlich geprüft. Zwei Verlage haben sich bereit erklärt, es zu veröffentlichen . Es wird auch als eBook für alle Plattformen verfügbar sein.

Ab dem Jahr 2014 wird das Buch ins Englische übersetzt, sodass es auch im englischsprachigen Raum verlegt werden kann. Bleiben sie also bei uns, dieses Projekt wird weiter entwickelt.

Welche Bedeutung "Pharmakrieg" für mich hat.
Das Projekt ist für mich deshalb besonders wichtig, weil ich der Überzeugung bin, dass Medizin mit Ethik und nichts mit Kommerz zu tun hat. Medizin zu kommerzialisieren hilft Menschen nicht, es schadet ihnen. Ich möchte dazu beitragen, das Menschen lernen mit solchen Situationen in der Behandlung  umzugehen, die Gefahren zu erkennen und zu meiden. Ich bin zu der Überzeugung gelangt, dass es besser ist, den Menschen die Augen zu öffnen, als Änderungen über juristischen Schritte oder die Politik herbeizuführen. Das habe ich jahrelang vergeblich versucht.

Was Sie erreichen, wenn die diese Kampagne unterstützen.
Indem Sie diese Kampagne unterstützen helfen Sie Menschen diese Gefahren besser zu erkennen und meiner Überzeugung nach, mehr auf ihre Gesundheit zu achten. Es ist immer besser, gesund zu bleiben, als Krankheiten zu behandeln.

Was wir benötigen und wofür es aufgewendet werden wird.
Bitte beachten Sie, dass die Kosten in US Dollar angegeben werden. Ich kann in indiegogo nur eine Währung für die Kampagne angeben. Nur in dieser Währung kann eine Zuwendung erfolgen.

1. Druckkosten                                                    11.500, - $
2. Kosten für Marketing *                                       2.700, - $
2. Reisekosten (zum Verlag)                                 1 .500, - $ primäres Ziel
3. Übersetzung ins Englische                                  9.800, - $
______________________________________________________
Gesamt                                                                25.500,-$

* Die Vermarktung wird primär durch den  Verlag erfolgen. Dies umfasst den Vertrieb an Wiederverkäufer, Veröffentlichung als eBook, Messen, Ausstellungen usw. Zusätzlich habe ich vor eine Facebook-, Twitter- und Linkedin Kampagne zu erstellen. Mit den angegebenen Kosten für das Marketing sind die Kosten für diese Kampagne gemeint.

Lektorat und Druck wird ca. 2 Monate nachdem die Indiegogo Kampagne beendet ist, abgeschlossen sein. Das Buch wird also im Januar / Februar 2014 in Deutschland veröffentlicht werden.

Die Übersetzung von "PharmaKrieg" wird im  Januar 2014 beginnen. Nachdem dies geschehen ist, wird das eBook in Englisch unmittelbar zur Verfügung gestellt werden. Anschließend muss ein Verleger in den USA identifiziert werden.




Pharmawars English Version:

Contact: indiegogo@medicalethics.eu

Pharmawars Summary

My name is Roland Holtz from Hannover in Germany. As said in the movies I am a former pharmaceutical professional. I left the industry in 2004 for ethical reasons. Unless the pharmaceutical competition became ever fierce over the last decades, even up to now, I started to criticise this industry publicly and do so already for many years.

Poeple who become victims of pharmaceutical fraud not having the proper knowledge, often times have difficulties to deal with these situations. I decided to assist them. Please view this little film, where You can see me doing this on TV in Germany.

Pharmawars a documentary novel

To go even further, I decided to write a book named "Pharmawars". It is a novel, that contains a compelling story about pharma fraud, helping people to understand the possible consequences for them and also containing a second part, with information helping them to cope with side effects, that in the end can change their life dramatically.

The book is ready to be published and 2 publishers are willing to print and sell it. Of course, "pharmawars" will be available as eBook of any kind.

Starting with 2014 "Pharmawars" will be translated into English, so it can be published in English speaking countries as well. So please do stay with us, this project will go on. Publishing it in Germany will only be the first step.

Why is "Pharmawars" so important to me?
I feel ethics is the one and only fundament of medicine. Commercializing medicine does not help people, it harms them. Reality however is, that medicine has been commercialized in many ways. This results in painful situations for many.

I am concerned about is the individual. Compensation, after side effects have occurred, never compensate health or life. The key issue is to prevent harm. We can only do so by knowing, what is potentially harmful. If new drugs are potentially harmful, what do I have to do, after it has been suggested for therapy or prescribed? "Pharmawars" is designed, to answer these questions.

I want to help people to be prepared to sense the danger, before it becomes one. If you know the system, you can find ways to protect yourself and your loved ones. Interestingly enough, the system of pharmaceutical marketing is very similar worldwide.

Your achievement, while supporting "Pharmawars"
Your contribution will help people to understand these dangers more fully and help them to care about there bodies, more than they may do today. It is always better to stay healthy, rather then to treat diseases.

What we need and what it will be used for
1. Printing costs                                                  11.500,-$
2. Costs of marketing*                                         2.700,-$
2. Traveling expenses (to publischer)                     1.500,-$ primary goal
3. Translation in English                                         9.800,-$
__________________________________________________
Total                                                                  25.500,-$

* Primarily the marketing will be done by the publisher. This includes sales to resellers, publication as eBook, fairies etc. Additionally I will create a Facebook-, Twitter- and Linkedin campaign. The cost for marketing are meant for this campaign.

Proofreading and printing will take about 2 months after the indiegogo campaign is finished. The book will therefore be published in Jan/ Feb 2014.

The translation of "Pharmawars" will start in Jan. 2014. After this is done, the eBook will be made available in English immediately. Following this a publisher needs to be identified in the US.

Deutschland veröffentlicht werden.
Die Übersetzung 
von "PharmaKrieg" wird im  Januar 2014 beginnen. Nachdem dies geschehen 
ist, wird das eBook in Englisch unmittelbar zur Verfügung gestellt 
werden. Anschließend muss ein Verleger in den USA identifiziert werden.Pharmawars English Version:


Contact: indiegogo@medicalethics.eu
Pharmawars Summary
My name is Roland Holtz from Hannover in Germany. As said in the movies
I am a former pharmaceutical professional. I left the industry in 2004 for
ethical reasons. Unless the pharmaceutical competition became ever fierce over
the last decades, even up to now, I started to criticise this industry publicly
and do so already for many years.Poeple who become victims of pharmaceutical fraud not
having the proper knowledge, often times have difficulties to deal with these
situations. I decided to assist them. Please view this little film, where You
can see me doing this on TV in Germany.
Pharmawars a documentary novel

To go even further, I decided to write a book named
"Pharmawars". It is a novel, that contains a compelling story about
pharma fraud, helping people to understand the possible consequences for them
and also containing a second part, with information helping them to cope with
side effects, that in the end can change their life dramatically.
The book is ready to be published and 2 publishers are
willing to print and sell it. Of course, "pharmawars" will be
available as eBook of any kind.
Starting with 2014 "Pharmawars" will be
translated into English, so it can be published in English speaking countries
as well. So please do stay with us, this project will go on. Publishing it in
Germany will only be the first step.Why is "Pharmawars" so important to me?
I feel ethics is the one and only fundament of
medicine. Commercializing medicine does not help people, it harms them. Reality
however is, that medicine has been commercialized in many ways. This results in
painful situations for many.
I am concerned about is the individual. Compensation,
after side effects have occurred, never compensate health or life. The key
issue is to prevent harm. We can only do so by knowing, what is potentially
harmful. If new drugs are potentially harmful, what do I have to do, after it
has been suggested for therapy or prescribed? "Pharmawars" is
designed, to answer these questions.
I want to help people to be prepared to sense the
danger, before it becomes one. If you know the system, you can find ways to
protect yourself and your loved ones. Interestingly enough, the system of
pharmaceutical marketing is very similar worldwide.Your achievement, while supporting "Pharmawars"
Your contribution will help people to understand these
dangers more fully and help them to care about there bodies, more than they may
do today. It is always better to stay healthy, rather then to treat diseases.What we need and what it will be used for
1. Printing
costs                                                 
11.500,-$
2. Costs of
marketing* 
                                       2.700,-$
2. Traveling expenses (to
publischer)   
                 1.500,-$ primary goal
3. Translation in
English 
                                       9.800,-$
__________________________________________________
Total                                                                 
25.500,-$
* Primarily the marketing will be done by the
publisher. This includes sales to resellers, publication as eBook, fairies etc.
Additionally I will create a Facebook-, Twitter- and Linkedin campaign. The
cost for marketing are meant for this campaign.
Proofreading and printing will take about 2 months
after the indiegogo campaign is finished. The book will therefore be published
in Jan/ Feb 2014.
The translation of "Pharmawars" will start in
Jan. 2014. After this is done, the eBook will be made available in English
immediately. Following this a publisher needs to be identified in the US.

story: My name is Mason.  I have been working for a small local tree removal service for 3 years. I made the mistake of wasting 3 years working an under the table job. I had to pretend to share my boss' political and religious beliefs just to keep my job. There were days that i didn't get any lunch break working 12 hours in the broad sunlight. One day my boss was using a 2-man bucket truck (alone) and cut a limb (four inches in diameter) and it struck me in the center of my back knocking me to the ground.  My boss never offered any workers compensation  or help with medical bills. In fact he called me everyday I was off trying to get me back to work. When he asked me to dress as uncle sam, play mormon music, and support the impeachment of obama, I quit.  Now i have no job, a broken vehicle, bad health, and the urge to get into school. Mississippi did not expand the Medicaid reform and just signed a law allowing  employers to have religious bias. So legally i have no grounds to stand.

story:
ABOUT THE STORY

THE PITS –You Can Run

This book-in-production is the sequel to THE PITS and takes up the story after Captain Kramer, USMC and Sergeant Shadow, USMC have almost died while assisting the FBI in Operation Slam-Dunk to bring down Valdiron, a major crime boss.

Kramer must decide whether or not to re-enlist in the Corps now that he has put in his 20 years of service. It’s a major crossroad in his life, and his decision cannot be rushed in to. Suddenly his services are requested once again by the FBI. They are hell-bent to bring Valdiron to justice and crush his empire founded on blood money from dogfighting, drugs, and gun trafficking.

What begins as a ‘normal’ FBI investigation to track down the crime boss turns into a frantic bid to rescue young children from the horrific exploitation as victims of an extensive human trafficking ring – the latest and most profitable venture undertaken by Valdiron.

This is one battle that Captain Kramer and Sergeant Shadow feel they must tackle. Do they have a choice? Will this operation prove more successful than the last?

WHAT MAKES THIS STORY UNIQUE?

The U.S. Marine Corps is not in the habit of ‘loaning’ its people out. But a precedent was established in THE PITS, the first book of this series. How often have you read of a U.S. Marine and his buddy, a dog (and a Sergeant, USMC, to boot!) becoming involved in major crime-busting escapades?

I have done/and still doing extensive research into the modes of human trafficking specific to this plot, specifically to educate the reader on the multi-faceted nature of this insidious worldwide criminal activity.

I hope that readers of THE PITS – You Can Run will be inflamed to act. When you reach the last page it need not be the end of the story. There is more to the book – a list of practical suggestions that YOU can use to assist those who battle, on a daily basis, against this criminal activity. YOU can play your part in helping to rescue children today!

I PLEDGE to donate 50% of all profits from his book to a major organization actively engaged in the fight against human trafficking.

WHY IS YOUR DONATION NEEDED?

THE PITS was originally written to educate people about the horrific blood sport of dogfighting and I chose to do this through the fictional characters of Captain Kramer, USMC and (then) Corporal Shadow, USMC. But woven into the fictional story was historical and statistical fact gleaned from extensive research that has surprised and astounded readers.

I self-published THE PITS through CreateSpace. It was released in Oct, 2013 and is available on Amazon.com as a paperback and in Kindle version. As much as I would prefer to have my books published conventionally by a brick-and-mortar publishing house, self-publishing is free, the quality is good, and more importantly, I can get my work into the marketplace faster.

I plan to do the same with THE PITS – You Can Run. Writing is far more than putting mere words to paper. To create a story that will help educate and inspire people, and hopefully change the world, it has to involve passion, diligence, strategy, and planning. I really want this book to surpass the immediate boundaries of my neighborhood and extend into cities, other communities, libraries, and every other possible market around this nation – even overseas. All this requires resources presently unavailable to me – BUT YOU CAN BE A FORERUNNER IN THIS CAMPAIGN BY DONATING. If you take advantage of the opportunity to donate and pre-order your copy/copies of the book NOW, you will be helping in a HUGE way.

The book is planned to release in the latter half of 2014.

WHAT YOUR DONATION SUPPORTS

I want to do develop a viable series of books based on the characters of Captain Kramer, USMC and Sergeant Shadow, USMC and to work towards establishing a decent fan base, I want to do more with this second book THE PITS – You Can Run.

This is a rough breakdown of projected costs —

$4000 for professional publicist services for the book.

$1000 for additional marketing, e.g. free promotional copies of the book, professional book trailer, etc.

Stretch Goal

If I surpass my initial goal, I may even be able to afford to do the same for future books in the series. 

YOU CAN HELP MAKE IT HAPPEN

YOUR donation to fund this project can make a difference. YOUR support will help to deliver the book into the hands of adults, children, and families at a time that could MAKE A DIFFERENCE. Just think, YOU could be a part of saving a child from falling victim to the crime of human trafficking.

Your funding will help make this project a success. Pledge $1, $5, $25, $50, or $100. Your pledge is important and you'll have my sincere thanks. In order to make this project a success, there's something else you can do and it's easy. 

Tweet the link to this project. 

Share it on Facebook.

Tell your friends. 

Tell your friends to tell their friends.

By supporting this project YOU are joining those others who are making a stand against this criminal activity. YOU are helping those who care about this issue to make a statement — EVERYONE IS SPECIAL. NO ONE SHOULD EVER FEEL ALONE – TO FIGHT ALONE.

THANK YOU FOR YOUR INTEREST AND SUPPORT!

Breaking News!

STRETCH GOAL #1: You are amazing! Thanks to you, we've reached our first goal — we are extremely grateful. And we're excited now to turn to our first stretch goal, which will enable us to turn our popular live workshops into dynamic virtual workshops. We often receive requests for our workshops in remote regions or in digital format. With your help and the latest in educational technology, we will be able to provide Indian poetic inspiration everywhere.

BOOK BUNDLE GIVEAWAYS: At midnight this Tuesday and Thursday, we'll be giving away books generously donated by our friends & advisors! See the UPDATE tab or our Facebook page for information on the books and how to enter. Book lovers won't want to miss these amazing freebies!

*

The Story of The (Great) Indian Poetry Collective

(from left to right) Minal Hajratwala, Shikha Malaviya and Ellen Kombiyil at the book launch for Geography of Tongues

What Is a Poetry Collective?

We are a mentorship model literary press, bringing new poetic voices from India to the world. The (Great) Indian Poetry Collective is a not-for-profit, shared work literary press publishing and promoting poets with a connection to India/Indian diaspora.

The (Great) Indian Poetry Collective has been powered by community from the beginning.  We're honored to have amazing poets on our advisory board:

Meena Alexander
Sampurna Chattarji
Eunice de Souza
Carolyn Forché
Ranjit Hoskote
Jerry Pinto
Sudeep Sen
Ravi Shankar
Prageeta Sharma
Arundhathi Subramaniam


How We Nurture Poets and Grow Poetry 

Under our peer mentorship model, new poets are paired with published poets to hone and fine-tune their manuscripts through a rigorous editorial process, leading to publication. Once a manuscript is ready, the poet is involved in all aspects of layout and design, working with talented graphic designers and artists. Poets who join the collective are never asked to fund the printing of their books. They give back what they have received in terms of time – one year of mentorship to a new collective member. We will publish approximately three books per year – that’s three new poetic voices from India that we can introduce to the world!

In addition, our workshops, talks and readings reach hundreds of aspiring poets as well as poetry lovers. We've held wildly popular workshops at literary festivals, colleges, and bookstores in India as well as in the United States. Our app, inPoetry, will launch next month, bringing contemporary Indian poets directly to smartphone readers everywhere.  Poets emerge from working with us — whether in a one-day workshop or during a two-year commitment as a collective member — more confident and empowered to bring their skills to the wider poetry world. 

Participants in our poetry workshop THE NAMES WE CARRY at Kearny Street Workshop, Oakland, November 2014

How You Can Help

Please join us in raising $10,000, which will pay for:

• Three upcoming books by new poets ($2,000 each = $6,000).

By publishing our first two books with our own seed money, we’ve learnt how to be a lean, efficient operation that produces each book at maximum quality and minimum cost. We print in India, where costs are lower; collaborate with artists who create gorgeous covers for us at reduced rates; and distribute globally to reader-subscribers. $2,000 covers full production costs of one book, plus an honorarium for the author and necessary marketing costs.

• Infrastructure ($4000)

In order to scale up, we'll develop our website for easy direct sales and submissions of new manuscripts by emerging poets. We have an aggressive plan for reaching a new generation of readers through our poetry app, inPoetry, which is currently in beta testing on Android; with your help, we’ll develop it for the iPhone, too. Finally, we’ll fund infrastructure for boring but necessary expenses such as legal contracts, registration of official non-profit status, building our subscriber base, and expanding our distribution network.

In short: Your donation will help our press take flight.

First book, launched December 2013
Cover art by Kalyani Ganapathy

Second book, launched November 2014
Cover art by Ang Tsherin Sherpa / Design by Tejal Shah

An Exciting Time to Help Indian Poetry

India is experiencing a burst of incredible new poetry in English. Yet poets have few opportunities to share, improve, and publish their work, and readers have few opportunities to discover them. There are no MFA programs, very few workshops, and very little mentorship opportunity to help poets hone their craft in India.

As poets with roots in both India and the United States, we have turned into social entrepreneurs and are dedicating our labor freely to make this vision a reality. 

Creativity + collaboration + community = The Collective!

FAQs

How exciting! What can I do to help or get more involved?

The best way to join us right now is to give generously! 

Here are some more ways to share the love for Indian poetry: 

  1. Tell all of your family members and friends about this page. Share this link with a personal message describing why this matters to you!

  2.  SHARE about our campaign on social media. Copy and paste one of our samples below.

  3. Follow us on Twitter and Facebook.

Please SPREAD THE WORD by sharing on social media or with like-minded people who may be interested! We welcome your questions and comments. Thank you so much! We truly appreciate your trust in us and in the vision of poetry from India reaching out to the world. 

Sample Facebook status updates (please share!):

I’ve just donated to The (Great) Indian Poetry Collective to support diverse, independent literature. Please join me: http://igg.me/at/gr8indianpoetry

We need more poetry from diverse authors! Join me in supporting The (Great) Indian Poetry Collective http://igg.me/at/gr8indianpoetry

The (Great) Indian Poetry Collective gives workshops by, for, and featuring Indian poets. Sponsor a workshop for aspiring writers in India: http://igg.me/at/gr8indianpoetry

Want a poetry app showcasing Indian poets? Join me in supporting The (Great) Indian Poetry Collective: http://igg.me/at/gr8indianpoetry

Support independent presses and the unique and vibrant voices they publish! This holiday season, give a BOOK to the lit lover in your life:  http://igg.me/at/gr8indianpoetry

Sample tweets (please share!):

I’ve just donated to support diverse, independent literature @gr8indianpoetry. Please join us http://igg.me/at/gr8indianpoetry

#WeNeedDiverseBooks Support diverse #poetry! Join the @gr8indianpoetry community: http://igg.me/at/gr8indianpoetry #India

Want a poetry app showcasing #IndianPoets? Join me in supporting The (Great) Indian Poetry Collective @gr8indianpoetry: http://igg.me/at/gr8indianpoetry

Our perks make the best #gifts for #poets & those who love #India’s literature! Everyone pls support/RT @gr8indianpoetry: http://igg.me/at/gr8indianpoetry

Did you know @gr8indianpoetry gives workshops by, for, and featuring Indian poets? Sponsor a workshop for aspiring writers in #India: http://igg.me/at/gr8indianpoetry

Can I donate a different amount than those listed for perks? 

Yes! We truly appreciate any donation to our campaign. If you would like to donate an amount that is not listed at one of our perk levels, you can click on "contribute now," which will take you to a page where you can select '"no perk, I just want to contribute" and at that point you can enter your specified amount. Thank you for your support!

What if I don't want a perk?

That's awesome! Thank you for your support — all of your donation will go directly to publishing and nurturing a new Indian poet. 

Can I donate via check?

Yes! Please make your check out to The (Great) Indian Poetry Collective and mail to:

336 Winged Terrace
San Ramon CA 94582

Is this a vanity or self-publishing enterprise? What is your business model?

We are not a vanity press. Poets who join the collective will never be asked to fund the printing of their books or buy a minimum number of books. We believe that writers deserve to be paid, and our budget for each book includes an author payment. We choose manuscripts through a competitive process, and we rigorously edit and mentor each writer to create the best book possible.

In the long term, we know that a press has to be self-sustaining. By establishing our nonprofit status with the help of funds raised through this campaign, we will be eligible to apply for arts grants and foundation support. Subscriptions and individual book sales will also sustain us, along with workshop tuition. Sales from each book will help pay for the next book. 

Can I submit my poetry to you for feedback or publication? 

Yes! There are two ways you can submit poetry to us.

For feedback and critique, check out the perks at the $60 level (3 poems) and the $1000 level (up to 100 pages). All of the founding poets are Pushcart-nominated and have decades of workshop and poetry editing experience. We're excited to share our expertise to help you improve your poems. 

For publication, we'll be choosing new collective members based on book-length manuscripts during our open reading period in February 2015. Please keep up with us on our website www.greatindianpoetrycollective.org, our Facebook page www.facebook.com/indianpoetrycollective, and our Twitter account www.twitter.com/gr8indianpoetry for open calls, workshops, new releases and more.

Are these the only perks you'll have?

We'll be adding perks throughout the campaign! Check back soon.

Are your publications diverse?

Yes! We're committed to publishing a broad spectrum of poets who have a connection to India and the Indian diaspora. We are publishing only first and second books, ensuring that we're discovering the most vital new voices.

One book per year will always be by a poet living in India, and at least one book will always be by a woman. We also have anthologies in the pipeline, including a teaching anthology for teachers to share contemporary Indian poetry with their students, and a groundbreaking collection of living women poets from India and the diaspora. Our app, inPoetry, will include a new Indian poem every week, introducing readers to some of the freshest and most exciting writing in India today.

Are you publishing in other languages?

For the first two years, we're focusing on English. In the future as our press grows, we'll be able to consider expanding into other languages and/or translations.

Thank you!

Our grassroots collective has thrived on community support from the beginning. We couldn't do it without you! Thank you so much for your support.

Want a poetry app showcasing Indian poets? Join me in supporting The (Great) Indian Poetry Collective: http://igg.me/at/gr8indianpoetry
Support independent presses and the unique and vibrant voices they publish! This holiday season, give a BOOK to the lit lover in your life:  http://igg.me/at/gr8indianpoetry
Sample tweets (please share!): 
I’ve just donated to support diverse, independent literature @gr8indianpoetry. Please join us http://igg.me/at/gr8indianpoetry
#WeNeedDiverseBooks Support diverse #poetry! Join the @gr8indianpoetry community: http://igg.me/at/gr8indianpoetry #India
Want a poetry app showcasing #IndianPoets? Join me in supporting The (Great) Indian Poetry Collective @gr8indianpoetry: http://igg.me/at/gr8indianpoetry
Our perks make the best #gifts for #poets & those who love #India’s literature! Everyone pls support/RT @gr8indianpoetry: http://igg.me/at/gr8indianpoetry
Did you know @gr8indianpoetry gives workshops by, for, and featuring Indian poets? Sponsor a workshop for aspiring writers in #India: http://igg.me/at/gr8indianpoetry

Can I donate a different amount than those listed for perks? 
Yes! We truly appreciate any donation to our campaign. If you would like to donate an amount that is not listed at one of our perk levels, you can click on "contribute now," which will take you to a page where you can select '"no perk, I just want to contribute" and at that point you can enter your specified amount. Thank you for your support!

What if I don't want a perk?That's awesome! Thank you for your support — all of your donation will go directly to publishing and nurturing a new Indian poet. 
Can I donate via check?
Yes! Please make your check out to The (Great) Indian Poetry Collective and mail to:

336 Winged TerraceSan Ramon CA 94582

Is this a vanity or self-publishing enterprise? What is your business model?
We are not a vanity press. Poets who join the collective will never be asked to fund the printing of their books or buy a minimum number of books. We believe that writers deserve to be paid, and our budget for each book includes an author payment. We choose manuscripts through a competitive process, and we rigorously edit and mentor each writer to create the best book possible.
In the long term, we know that a press has to be self-sustaining. By establishing our nonprofit status with the help of funds raised through this campaign, we will be eligible to apply for arts grants and foundation support. Subscriptions and individual book sales will also sustain us, along with workshop tuition. Sales from each book will help pay for the next book. 


Can I submit my poetry to you for feedback or publication? 
Yes! There are two ways you can submit poetry to us.
For feedback and critique, check out the perks at the $60 level (3 poems) and the $1000 level (up to 100 pages). All of the founding poets are Pushcart-nominated and have decades of workshop and poetry editing experience. We're excited to share our expertise to help you improve your poems. 
For publication, we'll be choosing new collective members based on book-length manuscripts during our open reading period in February 2015. Please keep up with us on our website www.greatindianpoetrycollective.org, our Facebook page www.facebook.com/indianpoetrycollective, and our Twitter account www.twitter.com/gr8indianpoetry for open calls, workshops, new releases and more.
Are these the only perks you'll have?
We'll be adding perks throughout the campaign! Check back soon.

Are your publications diverse?


Yes! We're committed to publishing a broad spectrum of poets who have a connection to India and the Indian diaspora. We are publishing only first and second books, ensuring that we're discovering the most vital new voices.

One book per year will always be by a poet living in India, and at least one book will always be by a woman. We also have anthologies in the pipeline, including a teaching anthology for teachers to share contemporary Indian poetry with their students, and a groundbreaking collection of living women poets from India and the diaspora. Our app, inPoetry, will include a new Indian poem every week, introducing readers to some of the freshest and most exciting writing in India today.
Are you publishing in other languages?

For the first two years, we're focusing on English. In the future as our press grows, we'll be able to consider expanding into other languages and/or translations.
Thank you!
Our grassroots collective has thrived on community support from the beginning. We couldn't do it without you! Thank you so much for your support.

story:
What is the CHAPTER ONE YOUNG WRITERS CONFERENCE?

The Chapter One Young Writers Conference (Ch1Con) is just what it sounds like: a writing conference for young writers.

Founded in 2012, the first conference took place in Chicago with six teenagers attending in person and countless others attending via an online live stream. It was an experiment limited to members of the Scholastic’s Write It community and their friends: Could a group of teenagers from across North America really get together and run their own conference? Like, with worthwhile and informative presentations, and networking, and all the cool stuff of a writing conference for adults?

The answer soon became apparent: Yes.

And so the Chapter One Young Writers Conference was born.

Why?

Too often young adults who write are criticized, pushed aside, and told that their writing is worthless and meaningless, and that the books they often read (e.g. young adult literature) are nothing more than fluff. 

We, at Ch1Con, refute that. We not only support young writers, but we believe in their ability to succeed. Why? It's simple. We're a writing conference for young adults by young adults. So when we say we've been there, we truly have. 

Help us change what it means to be a young writer.


Attendees and speakers at Ch1Con 2014.

With your donation, Ch1Con will be able to:

  • Bring more speakers: There are so many talented young adults out there. We hope to not only be able to bring more of them to speak at our conference, but to be able to pay them for the time they give.  We are, after all, students too! 
  • Support teen writers: Young writers need a strong and supportive community to grow. We hope to be able to create opportunities for writers to share and communicate year-round online, and to provide guidance for those who need it—a mission that will culminate annually at our conference outside Chicago.
  • Charge less: While we've always striven to make Ch1Con as affordable as possible, we know in the past it's still been too expensive for many young writers to attend. Through this campaign, we hope to cover many of the expenses of the conference, so that we'll be able to charge only the smallest of registration fees while simultaneously setting up scholarships so that even more talented teens and young adults are able to attend.

All funds will go directly to the conference. If we do not reach our intended goal, funds will first go towards paying our amazing speakers and then towards lowering the registration fee for our talented attendees.

The Impact

Writing is incredibly important to many teenagers. They spend math class scribbling plot ideas in the margins of their notebooks and type scenes deep into the night. They dream of seeing their work one day in bookstores.

And not only do they dream: they're ready and willing to do whatever it takes to make that dream a reality.

According to National Novel Writing Month's Young Writers Program, in 2013 nearly 90,000 young writers wrote novels during NaNoWriMo. And the number's only growing.

The PewResearch Internet Project has found:

  • "83% of parents of teens feel there is a greater need to write well today than there was 20 years ago.
  • "86% of teens believe good writing is important to success in life.
  • "Fully 93% of those ages 12-17 say they have done some writing outside of school in the past year and more than a third of them write consistently and regularly."

By supporting Ch1Con, you support the hard work and aspirations of these brilliant young writers. They have the drive and talent. Now it's our job to help them hone their abilities and show them what it takes to go from aspiring author to published. 

Previous attendees say:

"As someone who's been writing since she was very young, I know that it can be difficult to feel accepted in either the writing community or a community of people your age. Ch1Con provides an intersection of both, giving valuable advice about publishing as well as a community that supports you in your passion for writing and is just generally super fun to be around, both online and in real life." -- Ariel Kalati, 18

"Amidst a hard time in my life, Ch1Con gave me the chance to let go and just do something I loved. It renewed my passion for writing and reminded me that there are lots of people out there with interests and experiences like mine, people I can create lifelong friendships with. These people, before and after the conference, have supported me and my writing career through all our difficulties and have literally changed my life. Ch1Con is one of the most exciting and encouraging things I've ever done." -- Kira Budge, 20

"Ch1Con is a totally unmatchable experience because of the community that surrounds it. Making connections with peers is difficult enough for teenagers, so finding a group of people who share our passion can be invaluable to us. This conference was more welcoming and enjoyable than I could have ever hoped for. Chapter One accommodated for writers with all different skill-sets, backgrounds and stories to tell. If you or a young writer you know is searching for somewhere to belong, this is the perfect place." -- Emma Ryan, 16

FAQ

GENERAL

Q: Who can attend Ch1Con?

A: Anyone middle school through undergraduate, so approximately ages twelve through twenty two.

Q: I’m under eighteen. Do I need a chaperone?

A: While you’ll need the permission of your legal guardian to attend if you’re under eighteen, you will NOT need a chaperone actually with you at the conference. Think of it sort of like a day camp. (And running with that concept: be aware that you and your legal guardian are responsible for transportation and lodging throughout the weekend.)

Q: What’s Ch1Con’s connection to Teens Can Write, Too?

A: We’re partners in bringing kickbutt opportunities to the kickbutt young writers of the world! (Also, the Ch1Con team all writes for TCWT when we’re not busy doing Ch1Con stuff.)

Q: Can I donate without choosing a perk?

Of course! You can donate as much or as little as you'd like, and perks are optional. Every little bit counts!

Q: What does the pen (featuring the classic Ch1Con logo) look like?

Like this!


Q: What do tote bag and t-shirt look like?

Kind of like this!

                         

            

              

          
Q: Who exactly are these people who are offering to critique my work?
A: They're awesome is who they are!

Taryn Albright, the Girl with the Green Pen, has previously worked with bestsellers as an author's assistant, literary agency assistant, and editorial assistant. Since becoming a freelance editor, she has seen over fifty clients go on to sign with literary agents and dozens receive book deals. She has a BA in Creative Writing and works as a show writer for Disney. She's represented by Molly Ker Hawn of the Bent Agency.

Patrice Caldwell, Master of Marketing for Ch1Con, is a senior at Wellesley College, majoring in English with a concentration in Creative Writing. She has won the SCBWI (Society of Children's Book Writers & Illustrators) Student Writer Scholarship, write for the Teens Can Write, Too! blog, and is an Associate Publicist at Spencer Hill Contemporary.

Kira Budge, Associate Online Administrator for Ch1Con, is a junior at Brigham Young University - Idaho, majoring in English: Creative Writing. She was a semi-finalist for the 2011 Amazon YA Breakthrough Novel Award, is an admin and writer for the Teens Can Write, Too! blog, and has worked previously as a freelance editor.

Ariel Kalati, Creative Consultant for Ch1Con, is a freshman as Sarah Lawrence College, majoring in Creative Writing. She has spoken at the two previous Ch1Cons and writes for the Teens Can Write, Too! blog. 

Julia Byers, founder of Ch1Con, is a junior at the University of Michigan, majoring in Creative Writing & Literature. She has previously completed a remote internship for a literary agent, critiquing and evaluating full manuscripts, and is an admin and writer for the Teens Can Write, Too! blog. Her writing has won the children's/young adult category of the 82nd Annual Writer's Digest Writing Competition (2013), a Hopwood Underclassmen Fiction Award (2013), and the 2014 Arthur Miller Award.

Q: My perk was a critique or the surprise book bundle. What do I do next?

A: One of our team members will contact you via email. Thank you for your contribution!!

Q: Is shipping included in the perks?

A: Depends on where you live. If you're in the U.S., yes. If not, please add the specified shipping after you choose your perk.

Q: Will my donations be tax deductible?

A: We wish! We're not currently a nonprofit organization (too much paperwork in comparison with too much homework). But know your donation will help make young writers' dreams come true!

Q: Can I donate via check?

A: Yep! Please make your check out to Chapter One Events, LLC. And you can mail checks to:

Chapter One Events, LLC

P.O. Box 1584

Royal Oak, MI   48068

Q: Ch1Con sounds awesome! How can I help out?

A: The quickest and easiest way to immediately help us is to support us with your donation. We'd love your help in other ways as well:

  1. Share this page with friends and family. Include a message on why this campaign is important to you.
  2. Follow us on Twitter, WordPress, Tumblr, Pinterest, and Facebook. Use #Ch1Con to spread the word about our campaign and the conference.
  3. Attend the 2015 conference!! More details below ;)

2015 CONFERENCE

Q: When and where will the 2015 conference occur?

A: Saturday, August 8th, 2015 at the Courtyard Chicago Arlington Heights/South hotel, just outside of Chicago, Illinois.

Q: How much will the conference cost?

A: We’ll let you know as soon as we know! However, one of the perks includes guaranteed admission to the conference.

Q: Why is the conference one day, rather than two, this year?

A: We found we could maximize the opportunities for our participants by putting both our lecture-based sessions and workshops on one day. Yay!

Q: What type of writing will the conference focus on?

A: We put a strong focus on fiction, especially young adult novels. However, we’ll still have lots of cool resources for learning about short stories, poetry, songwriting, memoirs, etc., so check us out if you write any of those, too!

Q: Who will teach the sessions at the 2015 conference?

A: Ch1Con speakers are young writers, just like you. They’re currently at varying stages in their writing careers, and all are experts in the field.

Q: When will registration open for attending Ch1Con?

A: Sometime soon, we promise! But if you want to secure yourself (or your favorite young writer) a spot at the conference, make sure to look to your right. There's a perk for that.

*****

Q: I still have more questions. Can I contact you?

A: Of course! You can contact us through our Facebook page, tweet at us, or email us at chapteroneconference@aol.com. We promise to get back to you faster than Bella Swan falls in love with Edward! (So pretty darn fast.)

Thank you!! 

We appreciate your support. As young writers and students ourselves, we couldn't do any of this without you!

story:
About Me and About My Project

Hello out there--

My name is Matthew Murphy and I am a writer and teacher from Sudbury, Ontario, Canada.  I have been writing since I was seven years old and now have a growing body of work that I firmly believe, with your help, will see the light of day and take its place among the literature of today.  I feel and hope that what I write is worth your time and your investment and that together we can help it make its leap into the hum and buzz of the public sphere.

And so, on with the project....

I have written a psychological-historical war novel tentatively titled  Ready, Aye, Ready!, though, in a sense, the novel could be called Edvard Munch’s “The Scream” Goes to War or A Portrait of the Captain as a Nervous Wreck.  The story is intensively centred round the protagonist, Captain James McFarlane, a Canadian infantry officer in the Second World War in the latter days of the Italian Campaign.

In Jim’s shellshocked, slightly feverish mind, past and present and future, dream and reality all conflate and mesh and at times to both himself and the reader become indistinguishable.  He is exhausted, and the style of the novel reflects his fragmenting identity as he tries to command his combat company under fire, and waits with equally baited breath for letters from his wife and orders to attack a well-defended German strongpoint overlooking a vulnerable valley. 

Overall, I think that the Canadian military experience in the Second World War has, with few exceptions (such as Colin McDougall’s Execution), not been given a direct treatment in literary fiction, unlike the Canadian experience in the First World War.  I feel that the intensity and vividness that I bring to the time and place and the perspective of the protagonist give the novel a tone that is alternately cerebral and visceral, unsettling and gripping, that together propel it strongly with push-pull tension between the larger perspective of the war as a whole and the private perspective of Captain McFarlane. 

I honestly believe that there is nothing quite like it in today's fiction.  Interested?  Need more convincing?  Here, have a sneak peak inside:  http://murphilinear.com/?page_id=5

 

My Campaign--How You Can Help

To bring my project to fruition, I NEED YOUR HELP.  If you can make a cash contribution that helps me to defray the cost of having the manuscript professionally edited (and it has been edited several times already, painstakingly, but it needs that extra level of attention that only a professional editor can bring), published and promoted in both book and e-book form, that would be simply wonderful, and I would be very, very grateful.

If you cannot or do not want to make a cash contribution, you can still help.  You are, in fact, helping me right now by reading these words and being made aware of my project.  You can link this campaign to your blog or your social media account and follow along;  you can tell your friends;  you can let it turn around and around in your brain until one day you may be tempted to look it up and buy the eventual published book......(I can always dream).....

What I Need

In order to publish my book at Amazon (with whom I have already been in personal contact) I need to meet the following costs:

Total Design Freedom Custom Interior $379

Unique Cover $349

Comprehensive Copy Edit (129,000) words $2064

Library of Congress Control Number $49

Promotional Text Creation $199

Kirkus Indie Review $379

Total $3419 CAD

I have set a goal of $3800 to meet other costs, such as Indieogogo's share, wiring of foreign money (if applicable), etc.

What You Can Get

Did I mention that there are perks to helping me?  Anyone who makes a contribution of $30 or over will get a copy of the published novel.  After all, you want to see what I'm going on about, don't you? 

The Impact

Helping me allows me to bring my project to fruition, and gives you the opportunity to help out someone in the arts.  It helps us to network and build an audience together.

If you can't or don't want to contribute financially, you can still shout the project out to others on blogs and websites, through Facebook, through Indiegogo share tools, and most importantly,through that most timeless and most important method of promotion, Word of Mouth. 

Thanks for stopping by, and I hope to hear from you!

And so, on with the project....
I have written a psychological-historical war novel tentatively titled  Ready, Aye, Ready!, though, in a sense, the novel could be called Edvard Munch’s “The Scream” Goes to War or A Portrait of the Captain as a Nervous Wreck.  The story is intensively centred round the protagonist, Captain James McFarlane, a Canadian infantry officer in the Second World War in the latter days of the Italian Campaign.
In Jim’s shellshocked, slightly feverish mind, past and present and future, dream and reality all conflate and mesh and at times to both himself and the reader become indistinguishable.  He is exhausted, and the style of the novel reflects his fragmenting identity as he tries to command his combat company under fire, and waits with equally baited breath for letters from his wife and orders to attack a well-defended German strongpoint overlooking a vulnerable valley. 
Overall, I think that the Canadian military experience in the Second World War has, with few exceptions (such as Colin McDougall’s Execution), not been given a direct treatment in literary fiction, unlike the Canadian experience in the First World War.  I feel that the intensity and vividness that I bring to the time and place and the perspective of the protagonist give the novel a tone that is alternately cerebral and visceral, unsettling and gripping, that together propel it strongly with push-pull tension between the larger perspective of the war as a whole and the private perspective of Captain McFarlane. 
I honestly believe that there is nothing quite like it in today's fiction.  Interested?  Need more convincing?  Here, have a sneak peak inside:  http://murphilinear.com/?page_id=5
 
My Campaign--How You Can Help
To bring my project to fruition, I NEED YOUR HELP.  If you can make a cash contribution that helps me to defray the cost of having the manuscript professionally edited (and it has been edited several times already, painstakingly, but it needs that extra level of attention that only a professional editor can bring), published and promoted in both book and e-book form, that would be simply wonderful, and I would be very, very grateful.
If you cannot or do not want to make a cash contribution, you can still help.  You are, in fact, helping me right now by reading these words and being made aware of my project.  You can link this campaign to your blog or your social media account and follow along;  you can tell your friends;  you can let it turn around and around in your brain until one day you may be tempted to look it up and buy the eventual published book......(I can always dream).....
What I Need
In order to publish my book at Amazon (with whom I have already been in personal contact) I need to meet the following costs:
Total Design Freedom Custom Interior $379
Unique Cover $349
Comprehensive Copy Edit (129,000) words $2064
Library of Congress Control Number $49
Promotional Text Creation $199
Kirkus Indie Review $379
Total $3419 CAD
I have set a goal of $3800 to meet other costs, such as Indieogogo's share, wiring of foreign money (if applicable), etc.
What You Can Get
Did I mention that there are perks to helping me?  Anyone who makes a contribution of $30 or over will get a copy of the published novel.  After all, you want to see what I'm going on about, don't you? 
The Impact


Helping me allows me to bring my project to fruition, and gives you the opportunity to help out someone in the arts.  It helps us to network and build an audience together.
If you can't or don't want to contribute financially, you can still shout the project out to others on blogs and websites, through Facebook, through Indiegogo share tools, and most importantly,through that most timeless and most important method of promotion, Word of Mouth. 
Thanks for stopping by, and I hope to hear from you!

story:
Introducing “Monitoring the Monitors”

For many people, an ankle bracelet is an “accessory” worn by Martha Stewart or Lindsay Lohan. But it’s a little more complicated than that. Every day about 200,000 people wake up on a monitoring device as a result of a criminal justice matter.

 What is life like for people on electronic monitoring? 

Does monitoring give people an opportunity to turn their lives around or is it yet another way for businesses to make money out of “corrections”?

 These monitors can track people’s every move. 

 What happens to that information?

 Who “owns” it?

            These are questions I will tackle in the articles, blog postings, videos and ultimately the book that will grow out of this project.  I will be “monitoring the monitors” by traveling to different parts of the country and telling the stories of the people who have lived with this technological tether.

Why does this matter?

We have far too many people in prisons and jails in this country, far too many people of color in particular. I want that number to decrease rapidly. But I also want to ensure that the “alternatives to incarceration” we develop actually give people an opportunity to get their life on track.

Stories of Monitoring

I have heard many stories from people on monitoring who have been virtually chained to their houses while on an ankle bracelet-unable to work or take part in family activities. How common is this? Do we run the risk of incarcerating people in their homes instead of inside cells? Are some places doing electronic monitoring better than others? If so, what can we learn from them?

 

Follow the Money

There is big money in electronic monitoring. Who will be making that money? Who do they hope to put on monitors and for how long? Is there any way to make sure monitoring is done for justice reasons and not to earn dividends for shareholders?

Net Widening: Who is next?

Already we have some suspicious uses of electronic monitoring- ankle bracelets for school children who are truant in Texas, ankle bracelets for immigrants awaiting court decisions in Massachusetts, ankle bracelets for life for people with certain sex offenses in California. Are these ensuring public safety?  How do we control this “net widening” – the expansion of monitoring to people who don’t really need to be monitored?

My Plan

I will travel to what I call the “hot spots” of electronic monitoring. I will capture the stories of people in California, Texas, Michigan, Colorado, Illinois, Washington DC and compile them into online articles, video interviews, print media articles and posts to my blog at voiceofthemonitored.com.  Ultimately they will become part of a book. I have six publishers interested but I need your support to do the research.

What I hope to achieve

I want to contribute to a national dialog on alternatives to incarceration. (contact me at waazn1@gmail.com )My project will bring to light voices we rarely hear-people who have been incarcerated, people who walk our streets every day with a black plastic box strapped to their ankle. What is life like for them? How can we make sure things get better?  How do we ensure they don’t end up back behind bars?  If we are to construct meaningful alternatives to the present situation, we need to hear the experiences of those who have been on the receiving end.

What I Need

I am requesting $4,000 to cover my expenses to travel to CA, TX, MI, CO, and DC.  Most of this will go for airfares and road transportation.  I will stay with friends in most cities, eat at healthy cheap places, carry a jar of crunchy peanut butter and a pack of apples everywhere I go.  I am not a rock star travelling with an entourage. You won’t find me poolside at the Hilton.

Other than travel, I will buys a few incidentals a researcher needs-some books, some toner for my printer, reams of paper, notepads and phone cards (yes, they do come in handy if cell reception is bad). 


If I exceed my funding goal I will work with a local video producer to compile a video on monitoring, featuring excerpts from the interviews I conduct. 

Why I Will Succeed

I am an experienced writer and researcher. I have written articles on mass incarceration and electronic monitoring. You can check a couple of them here. I have interviewed many people about electronic monitoring (check a sample here).  I have been running a blog on monitoring for over a year. I have also published three novels (check them here and here).  

Plus, I have the added (mis) fortune of having spent a year on electronic monitoring as a condition of parole. I know this subject from the inside and the outside.  I am determined to make it succeed, to flood you with the stories behind the ankle bracelet and eventually hand over a copy of a book on this important topic.

Other ways you can help

I am not only looking for your financial contribution.  I also want to dialog with you about alternatives to incarceration. I would especially like to hear from you if you or a loved one or a friend has been on electronic monitoring. We need  your stories if we want to make meaningful change. 

Rewards

I am a writer. I wish I knew how to design a beautiful poster or weave you a magic carpet for your living room floor.  But I don’t. Words are my tools, so most of my rewards are the unpublished fruit of my various writing projects-poems, essays, short stories, plus paperback copies of my novels.  This is a big research project which will take a year to complete. And another year to get a book into print. I will give you updates and stories along the way but you may not want to wait that long for rewards. This is why I am using my previous writings. However, I will keep you informed of and linked to anything I publish from this research. I hope it will all serve as an inspiration to keep building the movement for genuine alternatives to incarceration.

story:
“Effective immediately: words will be effective immediately.”

   Amana Mission Publishing Ink is the artist-driven independent literary vehicle of Indi Riverflow, operated in partnership with all-in-one media magician Amana Mission. We are a pair of artistically ambitious, laterally mobile unprofessionals devoted to wordworking and image crafting  in service to the music we love.

   We have previously published Gyroscape: a year of the lyrical life, a collection of verse written primarily for jam band musician and songwriter John Kadlecik. Launched from a mythic vision, combining various pantheons in a jammin’ mobius Band, Gyroscape explores the space between meaning from a vantage where motion, not matter, matters.

   Now we are pleased to be poised at the edge of release for Rhapsody in Retrograde: Lyrical Loops In Verse, quirky reflections on perspective, glitches, and paradox spun from a state of perpetual puzzlement over the ineffable strangeness of being.

   Indi’s vision is a heady novel tea, steeped in wry irony and inflected insight. These lyric verses, forged in the electric undercurrents of consciousness, are alchemically distilled formulations guaranteed to expand your mind, exalt your spirit, and periodically misdirect beverages through your nasal cavity.

   Measuring success in units of happiness, this enterprise has been profoundly rewarding; now we come to the cutting edge of crowd-funding to expand that definition to include economic solvency.

Your contribution will allow us to expand print stock, pursue avenues of wider distribution, and fill our spaceship with jet fuel  as we line up to once again launch on our ever-expanding mission: to incite insight, spin gravity into levity, and re-brand reality one phrase at a time.


Below are some featured phrases from Rhapsody in Retrograde along with accompanying artwork by Amana Mission.

story:
Conversations of the Crucifixion

My name is Darrius Jerome Gourdine, author of “Conversations of the Crucifixion”. This book is an exciting and innovative exploratory look at the crucifixion of Jesus from a creative perspective. Imagine if the items used in the crucifixion could speak? What would they say? What would the cross say? What would the nails say? What if you could interview the people that Jesus came into contact with during that week? What would they say? What would Judas say? What would Peter want you to know?

This fictional book illustrates what the answers to these questions could be. “Conversations of the Crucifixion” is based on a stage play I wrote in 2011, examining six instruments (whip, hammer, nails, cross, crown of thorns and spear) and giving them a voice.  This book dives deep into the thoughts of each item and individuals used as part of the crucifixion. The book expands to 30 items/individuals that came into contact with Jesus between His entrance into Jerusalem (Palm Sunday) to His ascension into heaven (as witnessed by His disciples and the two witnesses).

VIDEO CLIP:

The video clip above is a sample of “Conversations of the Crucifixion”, the movie.  The 6 instruments in the movie are from the stage play performed in 2011. Watch and listen as the book is brought to life in the impactful DVD presentation. 

STUDY GUIDE:

The “Conversations of the Crucifixion” Study Guide is a small booklet with useful Bible study techniques that offers a helpful comprehensive outlook of “Conversations of the Crucifixion”. The Study Guide has lessons, questions and an answer key and is uniquely spoken in first person from a few of the items’ perspective taken from the book “Conversations of the Crucifixion”.

Where do the funds go?

The funds that you supportively give will help in the printing of both the “Conversations of the Crucifixion” book and “Conversations of the Crucifixion” Study Guide along with the mass production of the “Conversations of the Crucifixion” DVD all totaling $12,000.

How you can help?

  1. The absolute best thing you can do for this project is to pray for me! Pray that God’s will be done in the lives of people who read this book. If they see the crucifixion of our Lord in a new way, it may help them make a decision to follow Him. If that happens, to God be the glory! Please pray for that.
  2. I’d appreciate those who can purchase the book, study guide and DVD for themselves and to also give out a few as Christmas presents or Easter gifts. These two days are the most important dates on the Christian calendar. Consider giving the book, study guide and DVD to friends, family members, and co-workers as gifts on those days.

story:
Short Summary

Hi! My name is Madde Stager, and I have been involved in healing in one form or another for my entire life.  I recently graduated with my Master's of Science in Acupuncture from Tri-State College of Acupuncutre in New York City and began Dyanmic Living Acupuncture, as well as being a certified level 2 Reiki practitioner.  I have worked with various transformational companies for the past 5 years, coaching people to create dynamic and extraordinary results in their lives.  Healing is what I am passionate about.  I have been thinking about the best way that I can touch the most lives and make the biggest difference in the world, and this book came to me. 

I am offereing people a set of tools and information that is easy to understand, and they can take into their day-to-day lives.  The purpose of this book is to create healing on a deep and profound level as people re-discover their true nature and get in touch with their authenticity.  I believe that when people experience themselves in their perfection, then inner conflict will cease to exist and therefore will lead to peace on a global level.

What We Need & What You Get

So, there is a lot of controversy about how much it costs to self publish.  It can cost nothing to thousands of dollars.

  • Hiring an editor- $500-$2500
  • Hiring a cover designer- $500-$2500
  • Marketing costs- the suggested minumum is $2000

So, ALL money that is raised will go towards this project.

  • For $5 you get good karma 
  • For $10 you get a prayer of love and gratitude for whatever positive thing you're creating in your life
  • For $25 you get a signed first edition copy of "Through the Eyes of God"
  • For $50 you get a 30 minute coaching session with me
  • For $100 you receive a healing reading of the energies moving through your life right now.  You can ask me about up to 3 subjects.
  • For $250 you get a one hour coaching session with me
  • For $500 you receive a voucher to a healing workshop designed to work hand-in-hand with "Through the Eyes of God"
  • For $1000 you receive 2 vouchers to a healing workshop designed to work hand-in-hand with "Through the Eyes of God"
  • For $2500 you receive two vouchers to a healing workshop designed to work hand-in-hand with "Through the Eyes of God", as well as a 1 hour coaching session with me and an intuitive reading of the energies moving through your life about up to 3 subjects

*Everyone who donates over $25 will receive a signed copy of "Through the Eyes of God."

The Impact

In conjunction with this book, I am also creating a workshop that will be presented around the world.  My goal is to empower people to live their life full of love for themselves and others.  The way that I see it, when people are loving there is peace.  It might sound corny, but I believe this will lead to world peace. In my own way, this is the best way I know that I can contribute to that and invite you to contribute to that as well.  As one person heals, we all heal. 

So, even as I impact one life, I never know the ripple effects that will have in countless lives moving forward.  Join me in creating this amazing opportunity for people in the world.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute financially, I am so grateful for any support I get!  These are other ways that you can support:

  • Help me promote this project through any means
  • If you're willing to donate your services such as designing or editing
  • Send positive prayers and energy my way!

With so much love and graitutude for anything and everything!!

Madde Stager

story:
YOUTH SPEAKS is the TRUTH.

The honesty and power of truth is transformative.

Youth Speaks changed us, and the course of our lives.

It is a community where our voices will not be silenced, in a world where we so often are.

It is a space where we can release our hopes, our fears, our ugliest most beautiful demons, without the judgment that surrounds us on a daily basis.

We support each other in becoming the people we need to be. This never ends.

      -    Theo & Henry, Spokes

HELP YOUTH SPEAKS SEATTLE REPRESENT AT BRAVE NEW VOICES!

Five incredible young writers and performers will represent Seattle at the historic Brave New Voices International Slam Festival in San Francisco, where teenage poets from over 60 cities converge to compete and build community as writers. It is four days of transformative dialogue and art, and no person leaves the festival unchanged. 

This year, we ask your support not only to send our slam team to represent Seattle, but also so that a select few youth leaders who hold down the operations of Youth Speaks can experience Brave New Voices and infuse our yearly programming with the energy, insight and practices gained from building with poets from all over the country and the globe. 

OUR ASK

In order to send our slam team, three select youth leaders, and supervising mentors from the Youth Speaks Seattle program to participate fully in the slams, workshops, dialogues and performance opportunities of Brave New Voices, we need to raise $5,000. This money goes towards flights to California, dormitory housing and board through the festival, and the festival participation fees. 

In appreciation of your support, we'd love to share our poetic work with you! About Youth Speaks Seattle

Since 2003, Youth Speaks Seattle has been the city’s premier collective for youth spoken word poetry, creating avenues for youth voices through creative writing instruction and performance opportunities. Over the years, Youth Speaks Seattle has conducted residencies and visited classrooms in nearly all of Seattle’s public high schools, and hosted a monthly open mic series that has thrived for nearly nine years.

Since 2011, Youth Speaks is a program of Arts Corps. Arts Corps unlocks the creative power of youth through arts education and community collaboration so that all young people have the courage to imagine and freedom to create a just and vibrant future. For more info, visit www.artscorps.org.

YOUTH SPEAKS is the TRUTH.
The honesty and power of truth is transformative.
Youth Speaks changed us, and the course of our lives.
It is a community where our voices will not be silenced, in a world where we so often are.
It is a space where we can release our hopes, our fears, our ugliest most beautiful demons, without the judgment that surrounds us on a daily basis.
We support each other in becoming the people we need to be. This never ends.
      -    Theo & Henry, Spokes

story:
Ever wondered how people in the entertainment industry got where they are? Whether you’re interested in being in the spotlight or behind the scenes, my publication called FUZE will educate it’s readers on what it takes by providing informative articles & interviews with industry insiders. It will also promote indie recording artist and models from different genres (i.e. High Fashion/Beauty/Glamour/Commercial).

We are currently re-vamping our website and working on a mobile application that will allow our readers to stream our multimedia content flawlessly on their mobile devices whether it be IPOD/IPAD, Blackberry or Android.

Printed twice per year, our magazine will feature the best of the best of all talent we discover as well as popular articles as requested (or responded to) from our website.

This publication will be FREE and strategically distributed to venues that best benefit those promoted & interested… places such as concert venues, boutique night clubs & hotels nationwide, music & movie retail stores, clothing boutiques, salons, barbershops, HBCU’s, annual industry events such as the various award shows and MAGIC (Vegas). I plan to also ship to all the major entertainment executives/decision makers.

Perks from your contribution can include Full/half or other advertisement in our printed issue & on our website, a photoshoot with some of our models in your company apparel, credits in our launch campaign, and finally promotions at one of our artist showcases/concerts/fashion show!

Please spread the word! I have spent thousands on photoshoots, content providers and hardware. My goal is to raise an additional $10,000 to cover the cost of the magazine layout and printing enough to cover distribution of the magazine in LA/NY/MIA/ATL and a few other key locations. Thank you and GOD bless!

story:
My name is Tony Sekulich and I am a screenwriter living in Toronto. Recently, I found out I was nominated for a Leo Award (Awards for the British Columbia Film/TV industry) for Best Screenwriting in an Animated Series for my episode "A Wander No More" for Animism: The Gods Lake. The Leo Awards are in Vancouver and I am asking for funding help to offset the costs to travel out for the awards. The money will go towards airfare, hotel, formal wear, misc. expenses.

This nomination is very special to me as it marks the first time my writing has been nominated for a major industry award. When it comes time to open the enevelope and announce the winner, it is very important to me that I be there to experience that. In a business that is built on rejection and disappointment, it is important to celebrate the victories, both big and small, whenever they come along.

Any contribution you can make is greatly appreciated.

 

Tony Sekulich
