story:
I'm back home from the San Francisco Writers Conference 2015!    

           
There were hundreds of writers creating a very supportive and inspiring atmosphere at #SFWC2015. Some of the classes included voice, author platform, technology, and developing a writing routine, or how to fit all the above into our daily lives. In going to SFWC, I gained a better understanding of the writing profession. While part of that involved publishing, legalities, what the reader is getting, all of which empowered me. I can do this! But then there was the undeniable look on an author’s face when a reader purchased their book—an expression of childlike excitement that as adults we still have when someone says “I believe in you,” or “good job.” The reader needs the writer, and the writer needs the reader. To sum up the conference, it was about the full circle of events and creating a supportive community, and that’s how it ended, joining the community.
Thank you again to my family, friends, and people believing in my journey. Because of your support in more ways than one, I attended the San Francisco Writers Conference. It was Amazing!

Mom suffered from Alzheimer’s disease. I’m her memory now. Going to the conference was a crucial step.  Now I'm prepared to take my next steps in sharing her story, my story, and in that way helping other people heal.

With deep appreciation,
                              Jennifer  

Life Loop, Alzheimer's made me remember                          
                            


Hi!

I’m Jennifer Trimmings.  I’m a forty-something college graduate—though the last six years has made me feel a bit older. Wiser? Maybe. Empathetic? Compassionate? Yes! For these past six years, I’ve balanced college (where I obtained a Masters degree in History), work (I'm a self-employed seamstress), and family, including a mother diagnosed with early onset Alzheimer's disease. As I watched my once-vigorous mother suffer, I remembered who she was earlier in her life, and wondered what she was going through. I worried what she understood, but could no longer express, whom I might become in ten to fifteen years myself.

During the worst of Mom’s Alzheimer’s, my stepfather died suddenly. Afterward, I found a binder filled with love letters from their courtship. Though I never read the letters, they spurred memories of other loves and losses. These courtship letters also inspired me to write vignettes about my life with Mom, and our experiences with Alzheimer’s.

The result is Life Loop, an emotionally raw memoir presenting my experiences with life and death decisions for Mom, and how my life with her influenced my choices as an adult, as her daughter, ultimately strengthening me.

Why?

Some of you have been where I’ve been, losing a parent to Alzheimer’s. Or you might be one day. I wrote Life Loop to understand and heal after my mother's death. Most of all, I wrote Life Loop to remember Mom: who she was, who I am because of her.

After completing my first draft, I nervously shared it with a few friends. I didn’t anticipate the positive response I would receive: “I thought I only felt like that. I don’t feel so alone now.” “You described what I was feeling. You helped me heal.” “I want to write a memoir to help me heal. Can you help?” “If it helped me, it can help others too. I really hope you publish it.”

Help

That is why I’m here asking for help. Now that I have a completed draft of Life Loop, I'd really like to attend the February 2015 San Francisco Writers Conference, which provides workshops in memoir publishing, as well as introductions to agents and editors. Last fall I applied for a scholarship to attend the conference. I was one of five semi-finalists. While I’m excited I got that far, I did not receive the scholarship. And so I still need funding to attend the conference. This is where you come in: With your help, I’d love to attend the conference with high hopes of getting my memoir Life Loop seen and published.

  Mom suffered from Alzheimer’s disease. I’m her memory now. Please help me take this crucial step in sharing her story, my story, with the world, so I can help other people heal.

With deep appreciation,

Jennifer Trimmings 

If you’re inclined, please share my link. Thank you.

Life Loop :   Chapter Excepts —

Chapter One:

I have lived in four states. Different sights: snow and slush, green and lush, East Coast, West, dry and desolate with a mountain’s view, or an ocean’s vastness going on forever. Different smells: first snow, fragrant tropical moistness in the air, rain on a resistant desert landscape that oozes the smell of Creosote, Pacific Ocean and Eucalyptus scenting from my backyard.  I have lived in four different states, states of mind, states of place. Was I prepared for this, ready for this? Are we ever ready?

Chapter Three:

Sitting in a second floor office, I look over the Alzheimer’s Association pamphlets and listen to the female advocate in the chair across from me. “The disease can take eight to twelve years before it gets to its final stages. How long has your mom had Alzheimer’s?” I open the pamphlet to the symptom progression chart.  Cognitive reasoning, she’s lost her sense of humor. I’ve noticed that she only laughs because she’s covering up the fact that she doesn’t understand something. I know this, because it’s as if her laugh has a big question mark after it like a bubble above her head. Having a conversation? She doesn’t follow, has no sense of boundaries, and isn’t controlling her emotions. She has no sense of what is appropriate, cursing at will or without will, and either extremely sweet or angry, mistrust.  I look back up at the representative. “I think it may be as long as eight years already.”…. Mom is young, sixty-eight, and barely knows me.

Chapter Five:

Billie, who lives in the condo across the garden path sees it all happening, saw what happened on that day. She’s so kind. She must be nearing eighty and has lived here for about thirty years. Her front patio has white lattice on the side facing the road, privacy. An American flag is anchored out from above the lattice on a wooden pole along with a pink and green windsock hanging from an old white cotton string; both catching the mile off ocean breeze. A white wicker patio set, not plastic real wicker, love seat and chairs with thick well-loved cushions fill the space. Ashtrays, one, an abalone shell, the other, made of glass rest on top of wicker coffee table with a large burgundy floral area rug underneath. The kind you get from a street vender or Target; it marks the patio’s center.

She spends all her days in her outdoor living room with her two Chihuahuas. Both of them hooked up to their leash—one pink and one black tethering them and keeping them close at hand. There they sit, stand, and run back and forth guarding the entrance while all the time looking like deer in headlights, all ears and eyes with a little body enticing people to come in with their cuteness. And they do, people stop and visit with Billie all day long bringing their dogs and conversation. “I spend the day outside and do my house cleaning at night when it’s dark and not so nice out.” She once told me. I like this, what a concept, and it seems very wise coming from her with her no nonsense looks and thoughtful have seen a lot golden brown eyes. Her warmth when I need it most exudes from her presence, short brown curly hair with flecks of white, her fit almost eighty frame, faded jeans, red-white-and blue plaid shirt—not tucked in—always over a t-shirt, and basic white leather sneakers supporting her soles while she comforts mine. “What can I do to help?” She asks in her soft humble voice that always has a hint of a twang in it.

We walk across the garden path to Mom and Graham’s rental.

Chapter Ten:

Dear Mom,

 I don’t know if I should be writing this to you, but it’s how I feel. I’m glad you’re comfortable now, or a least you appear to be comfortable, not agitated, not in pain. Though I can’t help wanting to see your fight, see your anger again. Because, then I know you haven’t given up, that there’s a chance you might survive, beat this thing, Alzheimer’s.  But from everything I’ve heard or read, it seems impossible. But then so much in life seems impossible, and yet you taught me that things aren’t, if you believe and try hard. But you can’t try hard anymore. I know this, but I don’t believe this.

Love always,

Jen

story:
LES ÉDITIONS MATOPÉE AU SALON INTERNATIONAL DU LIVRE DE QUÉBEC 2014!

 

Les Éditions Matopée est la première maison d'édition 100% numérique de la ville de Québec. Fondée en janvier 2013, nous nous spécialisons exclusivement dans l'édition d'ouvrages de fiction sur supports électroniques.

La littérature est un art qui, depuis l'invention de l'écriture, fait rêver et permet à des auteurs talentueux de diffuser leurs imaginaires à travers les mots. Le papier a toujours été le compagnon préféré de la plume, et rien ne pourrait nous faire mentir à ce sujet. Cependant, dans un monde nouvellement technologique comme le nôtre, il est primordial de donner à la littérature une nouvelle facette: celle du numérique.

La littérature numérique est pratique, accessible, économique, versatile et inventive. Elle permet d'apporter avec soi, dans le creux d'une main, des milliers de livres et de les consulter sur le pouce. Imaginez: vous êtes dans votre chambre d'hôtel, à des kilomètres de votre maison, et vous auriez tant aimé avoir apporté le dernier Bernard Werber. Mais, horreur, vous l'avez laissé dans votre bibliothèque! Avec les livres numériques, votre bibliothèque est constamment dans votre poche et toujours accessible.

Peur de l'écran? Essayer le livre numérique, c'est l'adopter. Bien sûr, il ne sentira pas comme les pages d'un livre papier. Mais si vous êtes prêt à faire le sacrifice de l'odeur pour avoir accès à des millions d'univers que vous ne retrouveriez jamais ailleurs, vous êtes prêt pur le livre numérique. 

Les Éditions Matopée espère aider la littérature à se propager dans de nouveaux esprits grâce à l'accessibilité du numérique. Nous vendons des oeuvres inédites d'auteurs francophones à des prix dérisoires (tous nos livres coûtent moins de 10$!), tout en redonnant aux auteurs la majorité des profits de ventes. Nos ouvrages sont édités professionnellement et permettent au lecteur de profiter d'un produit littéraire de haute qualité.

La littérature numérique est peu connue. Notre maison d'édition l'est encore moins. Nous devons donc faire un double travail de promotion. Comment attirer un grand nombre de personnes et les intéresser au livre numérique? En profitant d'une grande vitrine comme le Salon international du livre de Québec. Pour l'édition 2014, nous exigeons d'être présents, d'avoir un espace réservé au nom des Éditions Matopée et de permettre à tous et à toutes de tenter l'expérience du numérique. Ce faisant, nous serions la première maison d'édition entièrement numérique à présenter ses produits au Salon international du livre de Québec. Et nous avons besoin de vous pour y arriver!

 

Ce dont nous avons besoin et ce que vous obtenez:

Louer un espace au Salon international du livre de Québec coûte 1325$. C'est un prix très élevé que nous ne pouvons nous permettre. Il existe une autre option: le demi-stand, que nous pouvons partager avec une autre maison d'édition. Ceci coûte 725$, un prix fort plus intéressant.

Étant donné que nous n'avons pas de livres papier à exposer, notre espace n'a pas besoin d'être gigantesque. Il suffit d'être présent, intriguant, amusant. De plus, un demi-stand représente bien notre volonté de démontrer que le livre numérique prend tellement peu de place!

Avec un financement atteint de 1600$, vous permettrez de:

- Payer l'emplacement du demi-stand au Salon (725$)

- Payer la présence constante de l'éditeur comme représentant durant tout l'événement (5 jours d'exposition, totalisant 56 heures de travail à 15$ de l'heure (840$))

Total: 1565$ (que nous arrondissons de bonne foi à 1600$)

Si notre objectif n'est pas atteint au bout de 60 jours, nous serons tristes et Indiegogo vous remettra votre argent. Cependant, si nous dépassons les 1600$, l'argent supplémentaire servira à aider Les Éditions Matopée dans la continuation de ses activités!

Que vous rapportera votre contribution? Consultez la liste à votre droite pour plus d'informations. Sachez que notre catalogue est pour l'instant petit, mais plusieurs nouveaux titres arriveront dans les prochains mois. Avec un don de votre part, vous pouvez obtenir n'importe quel titre qui paraît actuellement, ou paraîtront dans le futur, dans notre catalogue!

 

CONTRIBUEZ À LA LITTÉRATURE DE DEMAIN!

Les livres numériques permettent à une panoplie de gens peu enclin à la lecture d'enfin plonger dans l'univers d'une myriade d'auteurs. Nous voulons faire partie de cette avancée qui permet tant de nouvelles possibilités. Mais pour y arriver, il faut nous faire connaître. Démontrer concrètement au public que nous instaurons, à Québec, et dans la province, un standard en ce qui a trait à l'édition 100% numérique. Alors que toutes les maisons d'édition présentes au Salon international du livre de Québec proposent des livres papier, nous voulons nous démarquer par nos produits entièrement numériques. Nous voulons que les lecteurs ressortent du Salon avec l'impression d'avoir vu, au travers de ces dizaines d'exposants, quelque chose d'unique, de nouveau et d'intriguant: Les Éditions Matopée.

 

PAS LES MOYENS DE CONTRIBUER?

Si votre portefeuille est troué, ne vous en faites pas. Visitez notre site web au www.editionsmatopee.com et apprenez-en plus sur nos oeuvres et notre mission. Parlez également des Éditions Matopée autour de vous, à vos amis lecteurs et auteurs!
story_txt:
LES ÉDITIONS MATOPÉE AU SALON INTERNATIONAL DU LIVRE DE QUÉBEC 2014!
 
Les Éditions Matopée est la première maison d'édition 100% numérique de la ville de Québec. Fondée en janvier 2013, nous nous spécialisons exclusivement dans l'édition d'ouvrages de fiction sur supports électroniques.
La littérature est un art qui, depuis l'invention de l'écriture, fait rêver et permet à des auteurs talentueux de diffuser leurs imaginaires à travers les mots. Le papier a toujours été le compagnon préféré de la plume, et rien ne pourrait nous faire mentir à ce sujet. Cependant, dans un monde nouvellement technologique comme le nôtre, il est primordial de donner à la littérature une nouvelle facette: celle du numérique.
La littérature numérique est pratique, accessible, économique, versatile et inventive. Elle permet d'apporter avec soi, dans le creux d'une main, des milliers de livres et de les consulter sur le pouce. Imaginez: vous êtes dans votre chambre d'hôtel, à des kilomètres de votre maison, et vous auriez tant aimé avoir apporté le dernier Bernard Werber. Mais, horreur, vous l'avez laissé dans votre bibliothèque! Avec les livres numériques, votre bibliothèque est constamment dans votre poche et toujours accessible.
Peur de l'écran? Essayer le livre numérique, c'est l'adopter. Bien sûr, il ne sentira pas comme les pages d'un livre papier. Mais si vous êtes prêt à faire le sacrifice de l'odeur pour avoir accès à des millions d'univers que vous ne retrouveriez jamais ailleurs, vous êtes prêt pur le livre numérique. 
Les Éditions Matopée espère aider la littérature à se propager dans de nouveaux esprits grâce à l'accessibilité du numérique. Nous vendons des oeuvres inédites d'auteurs francophones à des prix dérisoires (tous nos livres coûtent moins de 10$!), tout en redonnant aux auteurs la majorité des profits de ventes. Nos ouvrages sont édités professionnellement et permettent au lecteur de profiter d'un produit littéraire de haute qualité.
La littérature numérique est peu connue. Notre maison d'édition l'est encore moins. Nous devons donc faire un double travail de promotion. Comment attirer un grand nombre de personnes et les intéresser au livre numérique? En profitant d'une grande vitrine comme le Salon international du livre de Québec. Pour l'édition 2014, nous exigeons d'être présents, d'avoir un espace réservé au nom des Éditions Matopée et de permettre à tous et à toutes de tenter l'expérience du numérique. Ce faisant, nous serions la première maison d'édition entièrement numérique à présenter ses produits au Salon international du livre de Québec. Et nous avons besoin de vous pour y arriver!
 
Ce dont nous avons besoin et ce que vous obtenez:
Louer un espace au Salon international du livre de Québec coûte 1325$. C'est un prix très élevé que nous ne pouvons nous permettre. Il existe une autre option: le demi-stand, que nous pouvons partager avec une autre maison d'édition. Ceci coûte 725$, un prix fort plus intéressant.
Étant donné que nous n'avons pas de livres papier à exposer, notre espace n'a pas besoin d'être gigantesque. Il suffit d'être présent, intriguant, amusant. De plus, un demi-stand représente bien notre volonté de démontrer que le livre numérique prend tellement peu de place!
Avec un financement atteint de 1600$, vous permettrez de:
- Payer l'emplacement du demi-stand au Salon (725$)
- Payer la présence constante de l'éditeur comme représentant durant tout l'événement (5 jours d'exposition, totalisant 56 heures de travail à 15$ de l'heure (840$))
Total: 1565$ (que nous arrondissons de bonne foi à 1600$)
Si notre objectif n'est pas atteint au bout de 60 jours, nous serons tristes et Indiegogo vous remettra votre argent. Cependant, si nous dépassons les 1600$, l'argent supplémentaire servira à aider Les Éditions Matopée dans la continuation de ses activités!
Que vous rapportera votre contribution? Consultez la liste à votre droite pour plus d'informations. Sachez que notre catalogue est pour l'instant petit, mais plusieurs nouveaux titres arriveront dans les prochains mois. Avec un don de votre part, vous pouvez obtenir n'importe quel titre qui paraît actuellement, ou paraîtront dans le futur, dans notre catalogue!
 
CONTRIBUEZ À LA LITTÉRATURE DE DEMAIN!

story:
How Danger Kids Universe Began

At 11 years old, De'Quan Foster wasn't the guy the girls chased after. He wasn't the boy who could play football and basketball really well. The guys who could play really well, picked on him; and the young girls chased those guys. De'Quan was picked on because he didn't speak like the kids his age, and was called a geek because he was smart and liked super heroes.

Being somewhat of a social outcast, De'Quan escaped into a world of imagination and began developing his own cast of super heroes like the stories he loved. It was then that Danger Kids was born. His mentor at the Boys & Girls Clubs of Newark, A.S. Washington took interest in him and his story. A.S. Washington gave him advice on life; offered up new characters and plot ideas. 7 characters quickly expanded into a universe of over 100 characters.

As Washington and Foster's relationship progressed, they continued to work on Danger Kids together. In the summer of 2012, more than 6 years from the day that Foster penned the first character; they founded Brickhouse Publishing and launched dangerkidsuniverse.com. On December 12, 2012, Book 1 of the Danger Kids Universe, The Twelve was released. The series is planned to span 12 novels.

The Campaign

With eleven more novels planned for release, production costs can quickly add up. A.S. Washington has been the primary investor of their independent venture, since De'Quan Foster is a recent June-2012 graduate of Science Park High School. They've found out that publishing a book is a massive undertaking. It that takes a team of dedicated hands to produce the highest quality product for fans and readers of the series.

However, Danger Kids Universe doesn't stop at novels. There are t-shirts, posters, pens, and mugs as a part of the Danger Kids brand. Currently, Danger Kids Universe is working on soliciting artists to begin producing content for a mobile game app. Yet, without the stories, nothing else much matters. With your help, Washington and Foster wont have to worry about the cost of book production. The two can simply create and have the resources to put forth a product that Barnes and Noble would be happy to place on their shelves when their proposal is submitted. With your generous contribution, Danger Kids can become the next big thing in pop culture.

Yet, the biggest gift your help would bring is helping a young man realize his dream. It will reinforce the notion that no matter where you begin in life, great things can be accomplished. And as De'Quan Foster always says; "Those who stand up in times of great danger will forever be known as heroes."

What We Need

For the next 11 installments in the Danger Kids Universe, $55,000 will allow all book production costs to be covered. Those essential items items include but are not limited to:


Book Cover Design

Professional Comprehensive Editing (spelling, grammar, style, word choice, tone of voice, etc)

Professional eBook Conversion (Kindle, Nook, iPad/iPhone, Smashwords etc)

Professional Interior Design/Layout

Expanded Distribution (Online retailers like Barnes and Noble)

Online Marketing & Advertising (Facebook, Twitter, GoogleAds, etc)

Shipping (Sending proof copies to beta readers for suggestions and opinions)

Early Content Production for Mobile App (character sketching/full color art, world sketching)

Branding (Trademark registration, memorabilia, new logos, etc)

What You Get

For your generous gift, we want to make sure you feel like you're a part of Team Danger Kids. Get awesome Danger Kids Universe gear like concept art t-shirts, logo pens from our independent publishing company Brickhouse Publishing, eBooks, and even autographed copies for books in the series. Those are just a few of the awesome things we have lined up for you by helping us bring Danger Kids to the world.

If We Miss Our Goal, Where Does Your Money Go?

We at Danger Kids Universe and Brickhouse Publishing are 100% committed to bringing Danger Kids to the world. We know that $55,000 is a huge commitment but it's exactly what we need at this stage. Reaching our goal would ensure that over the next 10-15 years, Danger Kids will be available for order on tablets and mobile devices; and hopefully on shelves at your local bookstore. However, we're realistic and know that goals aren't always reached, but whatever you are able to contribute, we'll put to honest use. All funds raised will be put toward to the cost of production and delivering on the perks we outlined here in our campaign. We want all of our contributors to help us, and we don't ever want to break that trust. Our campaign goal will allows us to bring the highest quality product to the market place for our readers and fans. We'll do that with $20 dollars, or we'll do that with $55,000.

The Impact

It is our hope at Danger Kids Universe to bring a new cast of characters to the world that will have a positive effect on society. We know that in today's technologically advance world, entertainment and information comes blazing at us at warp speeds. But our authors were and still are readers. Before television and computers, reading and writing was humanity's primary means of communication, education, and entertainment. We want kids to read. We want adults to read. We want to make sure that reading is still an important part of entertainment throughout the world.

With the release of The Twelve, we have been able to reached almost two hundred new readers in just a few short months. We've visited elementary and high schools and gave away and sold books to excited readers, both young and adult. We've generated a buzz through social media on Facebook and Twitter. Both De'Quan Foster and A.S. Washington make themselves available to fans through their social media accounts. They're accessible and talk about the books, but also about every day things from movies to music.

Your contribution is important to us and will allow us to continue to bring the world Danger Kids. It will helps us be positive role models and contributors to society through books. Our author's dreams are to be the writers of fiction to a new generation of youth, who can grow up with Danger Kids like so many kids grew up with Luke Skywalker, Superman, Batman and Harry Potter. This is our dream. You can help us to achieve it.

Other Ways You Can Help

$55,000 is a huge number for us. Yet, in this tough economic times $10 bucks can be a huge number for some. We're aware of that and being independent publishers, we're aware of just how daunting the lack of exactly what you need in monetary terms can be a barrier to comfort and success. Fear not, you can still help us, even if you can't contribute dollars :)

On our website dangerkidsuniverse.com, we'll be posting the first 10 chapters of Book 1 of the Danger Kids Series: A Generation's Journey; just as we did for The Twelve. You can check them out for free and let us know what you think about them by visiting our website. Or you can get in touch with the authors directly on twitter @mrdefoster and @aswashington. 

Currently our team is small, comprised of our authors and a few friends. But if you're great at drawing original characters with a super hero-super villain flair; we'd love to have you on our team. We're also planning to present a mobile game app based on many of our readers favorite character from The Twelve, Scicremeon. So, if you can program, we'd love to have you on board as well.


We also invite you to use the share tools here at Indiegogo and through other websites you use, to help spread the word about our campaign. We invite you to like our page on Facebook and follow us on Twitter @dkuniverse. And of course, we invite you to become a fan of Danger Kids Universe by grabbing a copy of our books when you have the opportunity. We've heard the first one's a pretty good read.

FOR YOUR TIME AND WHATEVER YOU CAN CONTRIBUTE, WE THANK YOU!!!!

story:
The Pitch

My name is Joshua Ellis. I'm an award-winning writer, author, and technologist. I need your help to fund my journey to write a book about technology in sub-Saharan Africa.

A few months ago, I delivered a talk here in Las Vegas to a room full of tech industry people where I argued that much of what is described as "innovation" in the ecosystem of Silicon Valley startups and venture capital is merely a series of attempts to solve what are often called "First World problems", by people whose economic status has effectively cloistered them away from the harsh realities of the world outside of their startup incubators and hackathons. I argued that true innovation -- true disruptive change -- is bred from desperation and necessity. I talked about the people who live underneath Las Vegas, in the storm drains, who pilfer building materials from the world above and build small, shantytown-like communities, surviving in horrifying conditions through sheer ingenuity.

And I talked about Africa.

* * *

I have been drawn to Africa, through myths and music and art, since my childhood. My whole life, I've dreamed of visiting the continent -- of losing myself in the sands of the Sahara or the rain forests of the Gold Coast, of visiting the ancient library of Timbuktu and Olduvai Gorge in Tanzania, the place where our species began. You may call it a form of exoticism of the Other if you like, or the echoes of colonialist dreams in the head of a white American dude, but the hold it took upon me was always very real and almost physical. 

A decade ago, I began to hear rumors and stories of a technological revolution beginning there, starting with the rise of inexpensive and widely-available mobile phones in the sub-Saharan region. And not only were Africans able to interface and connect with the global communications grid, they were beginning to build out new ideas using these already-outmoded tools. 

In my talk, I spoke about Susan Oguya, a co-founder of the Nairobi startup MFarm, who developed an SMS-based tool that allowed Kenyan farmers to verify the going global value of their crops before taking them to market. Susan told me -- when we met at South by Southwest in Austin, in March of 2013 -- about other startups in her city building apps that allowed rural Kenyans to do their banking via SMS, or to give and receive microloans. 

These startups weren't burning through billions of dollars of venture capital, and their founders weren't showing up on the cover of Wired or Fast Company or the frontpage of VentureBeat. But their modest efforts, working with technology that most Silicon Valley companies would find as absurd as telegraphy, were changing the way their country's economy worked -- the way that people lived their lives. Not just comfortable middle-class people, but poor people -- who, as we often forget, make up the majority of humanity's ranks. 

As Susan said to me when I met her on that warm day in Austin: the base of the pyramid is always the largest part.

* * *

In the past couple of years, barely a month goes by before you see a headline on some economist magazine like "Africa Rising". Chinese investors and American tech companies have begun to set their sights on sub-Saharan Africa, like popular high school cheerleaders mercilessly eyeing the new girl in school, trying to decide if they want to make friends. They're gauging whether there's enough money in Africa yet to extend their markets there -- smartphones and Facebook and all the baubles of modern consumer capitalism.

But the impression that I get, from the Africans whom I have spoken to and whose blog posts and articles I've read -- is that nobody there is necessarily interested in Facebook or Uber or any of Silicon Valley's other bright and shining stars. In many cases, their cultural values are simply not the same as ours...but they also want to build their own tech startups, their own economy. If they can do this, they'll pull off a trick that has eluded much of Africa for the past four hundred years: keeping money flowing back into their own economies, instead of pouring into the hands of Westerners who seem determined to keep African nations as helpless client states, often run by corrupt regimes who serve as nothing less than pimps for the minerals and other resources they hold ruthless stewardship over.

But as interesting as I find the politics and economics of all of this, I'm far more curious about the actual technology that's coming out of Africa. The smallest startup in the most rural town in America, after all, has access to resources and knowledge and just sheer infrastructure that geeks in great African cities like Nairobi and Lagos can only dream of. But this is precisely why African technology, and the people who build it, are so fascinating to me. If you accept my old friend Jude Milhon's definition of hacking as "the clever circumvention of imposed limits", then African technologists are hackers of the highest water. Everything they do is innovation.

And that is why I'm going to Africa to write this book, and I need your help.


The Plan

I'm raising $10,000 to travel to and around two main hubs in sub-Saharan Africa: Lagos, Nigeria, and Nairobi, Kenya. From these cities I'll branch out to other places as time and finance permit. I'll also be making my way to rural areas outside of the cities, to try to understand how technology could most benefit those who live in villages or the countryside. I'll be spending a month, total, in Africa.

I plan to interview and talk to technologists, startup entrepreneurs, 419 scammers, and everyday people I meet along the way. I'm traveling without guides, drivers, or bodyguards. As I go, I'll take notes and begin writing the book while I'm there, and complete it when I return to Las Vegas. It will be a minimum of 250 pages and include as many photos as I can take that don't suck.

In addition to the standard ebook edition, there will be a limited edition, which will contain more pictures, notes, Tweets, the text of my travel blog, and any video I manage to take, included in a big ol' honking zip file.

If I reach my stretch goal of $25,000, I will take a professional videographer with me, and we'll produce a documentary, which I will make available first to all of my backers.

I'm not an academic or a theorist; I'm a punk rock technologist, and this is not going to be a pop sociology or economy book. As a writer, I'm closer to Hunter Thompson or Lester Bangs than Naomi Klein or Paul Krugman...and this book will be a combination of big thinking about technology, first-person reporting, and gonzo travel writing. It will get weird.

And maybe along the way I can help celebrate the ingenuity and innovation that's happening in Africa now, and help people from my part of the world figure out ways to get involved with people in that part, and help those folks help themselves.


Flex Goals

  • $12,000: I will purchase a DSLR camera for better pictures and video than I can take with my iPhone.
  • $15,000: I will extend my trip to cover larger geographical areas (including possibly Senegal and South Africa, both of which also have exciting stuff happening, technology wise). This will extend the length of the book as well, obviously.
  • $25,000: I will take a professional videographer and film a full-fledged documentary, which I will make available to all backers exclusively before it reaches the rest of the world. In addition to the book, of course.


How You Can Help

I can't do this without your help. I simply can't afford to fund the trip myself. So I need your money, to be blunt about it. My estimated budget is $10,000, which will cover my airfare, food, lodging, and transportation on the ground for a month, as well as roughly $3000 to help cover my rent and utilities at home and any emergencies that might pop up.

But I'd also love your connections in Africa, your expertise, and your advice! I've traveled around the world, but this will be the most far-flung and potentially harrowing trip I've ever done. If you can put me in touch with people I can talk to, I'd love it.

And of course, you can help spread the word! Post this to your Facebook, tweet about it, share it on Google+, tell your friends and family about it. Together we can make this happen.

Special thanks to Brent Holmes for shooting the video and Jesse Carson Smigel for letting me use his backyard as a location!

These startups weren't burning through billions of dollars of venture capital, and their founders weren't showing up on the cover of Wired or Fast Company or the frontpage of VentureBeat. But their modest efforts, working with technology that most Silicon Valley companies would find as absurd as telegraphy, were changing the way their country's economy worked -- the way that people lived their lives. Not just comfortable middle-class people, but poor people -- who, as we often forget, make up the majority of humanity's ranks. 
As Susan said to me when I met her on that warm day in Austin: the base of the pyramid is always the largest part.
* * *
In the past couple of years, barely a month goes by before you see a headline on some economist magazine like "Africa Rising". Chinese investors and American tech companies have begun to set their sights on sub-Saharan Africa, like popular high school cheerleaders mercilessly eyeing the new girl in school, trying to decide if they want to make friends. They're gauging whether there's enough money in Africa yet to extend their markets there -- smartphones and Facebook and all the baubles of modern consumer capitalism.
But the impression that I get, from the Africans whom I have spoken to and whose blog posts and articles I've read -- is that nobody there is necessarily interested in Facebook or Uber or any of Silicon Valley's other bright and shining stars. In many cases, their cultural values are simply not the same as ours...but they also want to build their own tech startups, their own economy. If they can do this, they'll pull off a trick that has eluded much of Africa for the past four hundred years: keeping money flowing back into their own economies, instead of pouring into the hands of Westerners who seem determined to keep African nations as helpless client states, often run by corrupt regimes who serve as nothing less than pimps for the minerals and other resources they hold ruthless stewardship over.
But as interesting as I find the politics and economics of all of this, I'm far more curious about the actual technology that's coming out of Africa. The smallest startup in the most rural town in America, after all, has access to resources and knowledge and just sheer infrastructure that geeks in great African cities like Nairobi and Lagos can only dream of. But this is precisely why African technology, and the people who build it, are so fascinating to me. If you accept my old friend Jude Milhon's definition of hacking as "the clever circumvention of imposed limits", then African technologists are hackers of the highest water. Everything they do is innovation.
And that is why I'm going to Africa to write this book, and I need your help.


The Plan
I'm raising $10,000 to travel to and around two main hubs in sub-Saharan Africa: Lagos, Nigeria, and Nairobi, Kenya. From these cities I'll branch out to other places as time and finance permit. I'll also be making my way to rural areas outside of the cities, to try to understand how technology could most benefit those who live in villages or the countryside. I'll be spending a month, total, in Africa.
I plan to interview and talk to technologists, startup entrepreneurs, 419 scammers, and everyday people I meet along the way. I'm traveling without guides, drivers, or bodyguards. As I go, I'll take notes and begin writing the book while I'm there, and complete it when I return to Las Vegas. It will be a minimum of 250 pages and include as many photos as I can take that don't suck.
In addition to the standard ebook edition, there will be a limited edition, which will contain more pictures, notes, Tweets, the text of my travel blog, and any video I manage to take, included in a big ol' honking zip file.
If I reach my stretch goal of $25,000, I will take a professional videographer with me, and we'll produce a documentary, which I will make available first to all of my backers.
I'm not an academic or a theorist; I'm a punk rock technologist, and this is not going to be a pop sociology or economy book. As a writer, I'm closer to Hunter Thompson or Lester Bangs than Naomi Klein or Paul Krugman...and this book will be a combination of big thinking about technology, first-person reporting, and gonzo travel writing. It will get weird.
And maybe along the way I can help celebrate the ingenuity and innovation that's happening in Africa now, and help people from my part of the world figure out ways to get involved with people in that part, and help those folks help themselves.

Flex Goals


$12,000: I will purchase a DSLR camera for better pictures and video than I can take with my iPhone.
$15,000: I will extend my trip to cover larger geographical areas (including possibly Senegal and South Africa, both of which also have exciting stuff happening, technology wise). This will extend the length of the book as well, obviously.
$25,000: I will take a professional videographer and film a full-fledged documentary, which I will make available to all backers exclusively before it reaches the rest of the world. In addition to the book, of course.



How You Can Help
I can't do this without your help. I simply can't afford to fund the trip myself. So I need your money, to be blunt about it. My estimated budget is $10,000, which will cover my airfare, food, lodging, and transportation on the ground for a month, as well as roughly $3000 to help cover my rent and utilities at home and any emergencies that might pop up.
But I'd also love your connections in Africa, your expertise, and your advice! I've traveled around the world, but this will be the most far-flung and potentially harrowing trip I've ever done. If you can put me in touch with people I can talk to, I'd love it.
And of course, you can help spread the word! Post this to your Facebook, tweet about it, share it on Google+, tell your friends and family about it. Together we can make this happen.
Special thanks to Brent Holmes for shooting the video and Jesse Carson Smigel for letting me use his backyard as a location!

The difference this publication will make:

Other Ways You Can Help

Visit our website Amazzerballs.com

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
The Kingdom and The Beloved

A world of magic and real life stories, written by me, Lady Pol The Beloved, The Beloved Queen.  

Where ?

In a game played in Facebook, and MySpace as well, played by millions of people all around the world. 


The Kingdom of The Beloved Queen is my concept, an imaginary world, where I do place and write my stories about the battles of knights and monsters, about the heroes,  the passion and the love to the game. About how strangers turn to friends, about how we name ourselves Family.

How each one of us, having his own real life, becomes a part of my Kingdom, becomes a hero in my books.

How we love and hate, how we kill our imaginary enemies, how we do learn tolerance, and patience, and what friendship means. How we learn to laugh and smile together, how we do bound our lives as one, and how we meet in our real life.


The Beloved and The Readers


The Kingdom is a concept. 

A place where an ordinary man's story is written and published, and he becomes a hero, showing there are no ordinary people, that we are all unique and one of a kind. 


Heroes exist, it is You, who are my heroes. 

Nobility exists. I see it everyday. 

 

And here I am, kneeling in front of all my friends, fans and supporters, honored by them, honored for being a part of such a great community.


The Kingdom and The Treasure

The Kingdom exists in Facebook as a page, run by the author and player, but as being part of a concept, it is to be placed in it's own website, forum and blog. 

The Queen is writing the first book about the game's battles and it's heroes named "Daylight Stars" and is preparing for author's rights registration.    

The book is almost finished and it shall be published in three, YES, three languages -  English, Russian and Bulgarian (in negotiations are two more languages to be included in the second edition, French and Spanish). 

We need Your help for financing the website creation (including the forum, blog and etc.), the interpretation costs, as well as the design and shooting of the book cover. 

Each one who is involved into the donation's campaign will be awarded with special gifts, some which are hand-made and unique. One of them is the "Flame flower" a mystical symbol of the up-to-be published "Daylight Stars" Book gifted in limited printed copies and signed by the Kingdom's illustrator !!!

The Kingdom's Messengers 

Be a part of our Kingdom's history ! Share a word about us ! Post us and our idea on your social pages !

story:
My name is Joshua D. Perry, and I'm the author of "Gangsters In Granite: A National Graveside Index of Reputed Mobsters"
The reason I've decided to take up the task of writing this book is because I felt there was nothing like it on the market. So I figured with my experience in the grave hunting hobby, and my rather peculiar interest in tracking down the gravesides of "reputed" organized crime figures, I thought I'd give it a shot and write the book I've been wanting to write for a few years.
At the moment I'm at the beginning stages, where I'm doing research, and procuring photos to be used in the book.
The reason I need your support is because I'm strapped for cash, and I need the funds to obtain other books on organized crime,  which will be used for the research of my book. Not only that I need the leftover funds, to go towards paying people to use the gravesite photographs in my book from their personal collection.
The book "Gangsters In Granite: A National Graveside Index of Reputed Mobsters" is a coast to coast overview of the gravesites of reputed mobsters.
Each chapter in the book will chronicle a particular major metropolitan American city, where there was "alleged" organized crime activity.
Each chapter will also include a concise overview of that cities organized crime history. Followed by a complete rundown with concise biographical narratives of the major organized crime figures from that city.
Being that this is a grave hunting style book geared towards anyone who enjoys visiting cemeteries. The primary focus will be the collection of gravesite photos of reputed organized crime figures which will highlight that persons biographical overview.
Some of the vital statistical data you will find in the book will include birth & death dates, place of birth, place of death, interment/burial location, cause of death, among other things.

story:
UPDATE:

The Oyster War: The True Story of a Small Farm, Big Politics and the Future of Wilderness in America was published by Counterpoint Press in August 2015. It was a finalist for the 2016 Northern California Independent Booksellers Award and was shortlisted for the 2016 Orion Book Award along with two others, H is for Hawk and A River Runs Again—company that, if I do say so myself, is none too shabby. Around the time of its release, The Oyster War was favorably featured in National Geographic, The Guardian, Salon, Vox, The Leonard Lopate Show and others, and was named as a Best Book of August 2015 by Men's Journal. Many, many thanks to the backers of this campaign who helped to make all of this possible.

Read more on the book's website here.

Buy The Oyster War.

The Project

My first book, The Oyster War: the true story of a small farm, big politics and the future of wilderness in America (to be published in 2015 by Counterpoint Press) is the tale of nature, food and obsession, and examines our yearning for nourishment and connection in an increasingly toxic world.

The Story

In a dispute that the Los Angeles Times called "a complex web of alleged conspiracies and politicking worthy of a Cold War spy novel," a family-owned oyster farm in Northern California has been locked in a legal battle with the U.S. Government for the past ten years.

The conflict concerns their disputed right to continue oystering in picturesque Point Reyes National Seashore. The fight to either shut down or save the oyster farm has drawn the attention of senators, bestselling authors, libertarian groups, environmentalists and celebrity chefs. Whatever side they chose, all seemed to agree that there is something symbolic and deeply important about this case.

My Research

I started researching this book in the spring of 2012, at first as a newspaper reporter in the region and then on my own dime. My wonderful literary agent sold my proposal to Counterpoint Press earlier this year. I received an advance, which I have been using to conduct research and write the book. However, book advances are not what they used to be, and there is still more important research I want to complete in order to make this the best book it can be.

In a broader sense, this story is about the need to preserve both our sustainable food systems and the natural world. Oysters themselves are threatened by rising ocean acidity, but the restoration of oyster reefs throughout the world can help rebuild shoreline habitat and protect against the effects of climate change.

The bulk of the book is already completed. I want to use this extra funding to strengthen my sections on oysters and climate change, and include the efforts of other oyster farmers and scientists throughout the country. This requires supported time and travel expenses.

In the book, I address the particulars of oysters themselves, the environmental movement, Native Americans, sustainable agriculture, and include a never before published history of West Coast oystering. The book is factual yet lyrical and is exhaustively researched.

Myself and My Publisher

 

 

 

 

 


When not tramping around oyster farms or buried under papers at UC Berkeley's Bancroft Library, I am a freelance writer based in Brooklyn. Since 2008 I have worked with the United Nations Press Office covering issues related to disarmament and international security, the Middle East, human rights and the environment. My work has appeared in The Believer, McSweeneys, The San Francisco Chronicle, The Los Angeles Times, Ryot News and Fitness, among others, and has been featured by The Rumpus. My writing influences include Joan Didion, Susan Orlean and Rebecca Solnit.

Counterpoint is a wonderful publisher, and I know they will make this a beautiful book. They are based in Berkeley and are distributed by the Perseus Books Group. Their past and present authors include Wendell Berry, Gary Snyder, W.S. Merwin, Anne Lamott, James Salter, M.F.K Fisher, Wallace Stegner and many other notables.

I hope you will consider helping with this project. All those who contribute will be thanked in the acknowledgements.

Many thanks,

Summer Brennan

story:
Inspire, Create and, most importantly, Love.

Set in a fictional Long Island town in the 1930s and 1940s, Forget Me Not tells the story of the people we can't help but love no matter how much the world tells us not to.

So what do you want from this campaign?
I would love Forget Me Not to touch the hearts of as many readers as possible.  With that in mind, I want to put the book in print for readers, create a high quality trailer, and shoot a short film based around a key interior scene(s). The short film will not encompass the whole story but it will bring Teddi and Calvin and their story to the visual world. Because I am the co-founder of a very new company, Theophilus Films, this seems like the right thing to do for this project. Theophilus Films is a Los Angeles-based film company founded by three female artists, strives to bring quality film and jobs to talented filmmakers starting out.  My partners, Xiomara Ortiz and Erin Okamoto are the most supportive and creative people I know. With them, I know this brain child of mine can make it off the ground. I think they sort of like the story too. But what about the book? What's the deal with that? Read on to find out:

A Bucket of Happy

Some back story: I posted Forget Me Not for free online this summer, and it's gained a small group of followers. My three favorites are an aspiring sixteen-year-old college student from Bangladesh, a beautiful soul who has lived and breathed the world who currently resides in assisted living, and a woman not so different from me, a hungry passionate thirty-something attempting to live artist's life in Los Angeles.  All seem to soak up the world this book creates in a way I could have never imagined.  When I see their days brightened, any problems I've had disappear.  When I find myself thinking about why I do this or that, why I spend my time the way I do, whether or not my story is any good, I think of the lives a story can touch and none of it matters. My goal is to multiply this effect as many times as possible with Forget Me Not.  


Your Contribution

The funding amount provided will cover:

- a copy editor 

- a proofreader and 

- cover design 

Additional funds will go to promotion,  and the writing contests I plan to have for readers to encourage their own creativity and exploration of topics explored in the book.


Forget Me Not: The Novel

Are you defined by who you were born to or who you choose to become? Theodora Donovan's overprotective grandmother will not let her do anything, especially, when it comes to an orphan tied to their family's shameful past named Calvin Wynne. Set in the fictional town of Brookhurst, New York, this story will span over a decade, beginning in 1934 and ending after World War II. Forget Me Not is a coming-of-age tale about the people we can't help but love no matter how strongly others tell us not to.


What This Project Needs 

This project needs $6000. My co-authors (on other projects) are excited to help out with this one. When I say, we, it refers to Xiomara Ortiz and Erin Okamoto.

$2500 to a professional editor who loves the story (already selected).

$1000 toward design and first 250 print copies to distribute at festivals.

$1000 to a PR professional team to start marketing the book

$500 to fans as prizes and the website.

$1000 to book trailer with professional actors / filmed scene from novel 

Additional funds (if we go over) collected go toward wider distrubution, more print copies, documentary feat. readers and fans, visits to readers (my dream would be to visit the fan in assisted living as well as any other special readers resources allow), and the writer's community inspired by the story.


Note from the Author

I taught high school English for eight years. My students, who came from every walk of life, taught me to go for my dreams.  I would love to show them that life, no matter what comes your way, can still make room for those dreams.  

If you can't make a contribution, I invite you to find my wordpress page under AllisonWhitmore, and get involved with the community.

I taught high school English for eight years. My students, who came from every walk of life, taught me to go for my dreams.  I would love to show them that life, no matter what comes your way, can still make room for those dreams.  
If you can't make a contribution, I invite you to find my wordpress page under AllisonWhitmore, and get involved with the community.

story:
"The Lost Angels" is a new book by Nicoletta Carlone that highlights the unknown investigation of the mysterious murder of Hollywood silent film director William Desmond Taylor by Los Angeles District Attorney Thomas Lee Woolwine.
 

The information in this book is based on the research of D.A. Woolwine and his son unknown for over 90 years. Woolwine, who has often been accused of covering up the crime, actually worked against the corrupt police and the powerful Paramount Studios, both involved heavily involved in a cover-up of the crime.

Woolwine conducted his own secret investigation with the help of witnesses and a private detective hired from his own pocket. His son took up the investigation in 1933, going back to interview numerous people involved in the case including coroner Frank Nance, former D.A. Asa Keyes, former D.A. Buron Fitts, and other investigators and witnesses from the original case.

Both father and son would eventually solve the murder, directly with strong evidence naming the group of people responsible for Taylor's death.

Despite solving the case, the information was never revealed due to death threats, corruption in the studio system, local government pressure and the untimely deaths of both men.

For many years nothing was written or disclosed because the suspects and others involved in the case were still alive. Today that risk no longer exists.

Now is the time this father and son's hard work is brought to light and the
true identity of the killer of William Desmond Taylor is finally revealed!
 

 

 

Will you help me finish my book?  Most of the writing is completed, but there is still a lot left to do before the book can be published.

Your funding goes toward:

  • Hiring an editor.
  • Travel for continued research.
  • Preservation of Thomas Woolwine’s evidence.
  • Acquisition of additional historic photos and documents. 
     

 

In appreciation of your support, please chose one or more of these fabulous perks:
 
  • A special THANK YOU on the official webpage and/or in the book.
     
  • ADMISSION to an exclusive BOOK PARTY at the World Famous Cicada Restaurant and Club located in the historic 1928 Art Deco Oviatt Building in Los Angeles. 

 

This is the location of the Book party!  Want to find out more?
CicadaClub.com
 

Become part of Hollywood history!

  • Thanks to the hard work and dedication of my relative Los Angeles District Attorney Thomas Lee Woolwine, the true story can now be told. With your help, the identity of the killer will be revealed and the death of William Desmond Taylor will no longer remain Hollywood's greatest murder mystery.
     

 

If you are unable to contribute, you can still help me get the true story told.

  • Tell your friends about The Lost Angels on social media sites like Facebook, Pinterest and Twitter.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools located above.

Thank you for your support!

story:
(Puedes colaborar con nosotros y ayudarnos a realizar este proyecto y esta ilusión con una pequeña aportación que puede ser desde 1€ en adelante, porque cada granito de arena cuenta, por pequeño que sea... y poquito a poco, gracias a ti , llegaremos a nuestra meta!) <No es necesario disponer de cuenta en PayPal>

Deporte para TOD@S!

Se trata de una empresa de turismo activo, deporte y aventura. Pero con una particularidad. Estaremos especializados en deporte adaptado, con material específico y gente profesional con muchas ganas e ilusión. Por un lado tendremos material totalmente adaptado para las necesidades de cada participante y por otro queremos "ayudar" a mentalizar a la socidedad de que todos pueden hacer lo que se propongan, siempre y cuando pongamos los medios adecuados.
En resumen:
-Material adaptado    -Profesionales con experiencia    -Monitores titulados

Características básicas

Ofreceremos rutas en kayak por las diferentes zonas del parque natural Cabo de Gata, descubriendo paisajes y calas de increíble valor, las cuales son inaccesibles si no es a través del mar.
También haremos rutas en bici y en handbike disfrutando de los paisajes que nos ofrece el parque natural, realizando una actividad accesible para todos, ya sea solo o en familia…
Todo esto, lógicamente contando con el material totalmente adaptado y especifico para las necesidades de cada usuario.
Aunque todo esté pensado y adaptado para personas con algún tipo de dificultad, no quiero que os olvidéis de que será un servicio general para todo tipo de publico. Y precisamente, porque ese es otro de mis objetivos, el de mostrar a esta sociedad que todos pueden hacer lo que se propongan, solamente es necesario querer hacerlo y buscar los medios.
Dispondremos de kayaks totalmente adaptados, handbikes diferentes en función del tipo de discapacidad, rutas y actividades a medida, accesibilidad para las playas mas complicadas. También realizaremos actividades con asociaciones y colegios.

Motivación y a quién va dirigido el proyecto

Después de muchos años trabajando en diversos entornos y diferentes campos del mundo del deporte, y actualmente de la discapacidad, he llegado a este punto en el que me planteo que quiero hacer algo mas...quiero dar un servicio adaptado dentro de un entorno social con dos objetivos muy claros:
-Que la persona con discapacidad física, psiquica o sensorial pueda realizar una actividad lúdica, deportiva y en la naturaleza con total normalidad dentro de un grupo de participantes.
-Que el publico en general comparta una actividad ludica, deportiva y social con personas que tengan alguna discapacidad y comprueben que esa discapacidad no supone ningún limite ni obstáculo, siempre que se tengan las ganas y pongamos los medios adecuados.

Objetivos de la campaña de crowdfunding

1º Dar a conocer mi proyecto.
2ª Conseguir los medios para llevarlo a cabo.
3ª Comprar todo el material necesario para comenzar la actividad: Furgoneta, remolque, kayaks, handbikes, alquiler de un local para guardar el material, etc.
4º Inicio de actividad estar en funcionamiento lo antes posible.

Experiencia previa y equipo

Soy Tecnico en actividades fisicas en el medio natural y Tecnico deportivo de piragüismo.
Llevo en el mundo del piragüismo desde hace mas de 12 años y trabajando como técnico desde hace 8 años en federaciones, clubes y empresas de ocio y aventura.
Desde hace 4 años trabajo en fundación de deporte adaptado para personas con discapacidad, abarcando diferentes tipos de deporte y discapacidades.
El equipo consta de:
- El impulsor del proyecto (yo), más otra persona, usuaria de silla de ruedas por lesión medular, la cual me ayudará también con su punto de vista sobre las adaptaciones en función de las necesidades que a mi se me puedan escapar.
-Equipo de monitores para actividades que variará entre 2 y 4 (ampliándolo incluso mas, en relación con los participantes.

story:
For my birthday

My name is Jess Spear and I'm a Socialist Alternative candidate challenging the Speaker of the WA State House. Speaker Frank Chopp deserves to lose this election. Chopp presided over the special session of the State Legislature that gave Boeing historic tax breaks, while criminally underfunding education. After 20 years in office and 16 years as the Speaker of the House, Washington has the most regressive tax system in the country and the highest poverty rate in 50 years. 

Unlike Frank Chopp, I take no corporate money.  I'm running to end corporate welfare, tax the rich to fund social services, for rent control and affordable housing, and to build the type of politics that serves people, not corporations.  We need representatives who will unapologetically stand for working people's interests.

Campaigns that take no corporate cash need grassroots support. Please donate today and help us kick out a 20-year big business politician, striking a blow against corporate politics! 

***To ensure these donations comply with public disclosure law, please send an email to VoteSpear@gmail.com with your name and address, and if you donate more than $100, your occupation, employer and employer city/state.  

Why you should donate

We can win if we build a strong enough grassroots campaign. We did it last year. We got Socialist Alternative candidate Kshama Sawant elected to the city council without taking a dime from business. That shows it’s possible. People are angry and they want alternatives to the status quo. 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

    • If you live in or near Seattle, help knock on doors, poster, distribute door hangers and yard signs, or help out in our campaign office.
    • Get out the vote - call voters from home!
    • Host a fundraising party.

    Together, we made history last year.  Let's do it again.  Donate today.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Yasaman Hadjibashi , former and first Group Chief Data Officer for a large International bank. This is a story of the end-to-end data transformation which I led over the course of 2 years, growing from a team of 2 colleagues to over 150+ colleagues, with a diversified business portfolio across 12 African nations - re-defining the traditional perception of how data was seen and used for consumers in financial services across this continent. 

We need your help to make this story a reality by providing the funds for my co-author Matthew Edwards to write it with me. 

Big data together with Technology driving product innovation in financial services is still in its infancy stage across the African continent. This book is focused on the human side of a major organisational and cultural transformation in a legacy corporate environment. It is about the shapers and the movers helping bring the revolutionary big data movement to banking in Africa - and how a group of predominantly millennial 'Data Wunderkinds' managed to build a new culture of execution regimen within a traditional hierarchical environment. Their innovations have not only made a difference to consumers' lives but have also brought positive ROI and global recognition from the likes of Gartner and others. 

This real-life story shows how a diverse group of individuals from a range of countries came together to define and execute a pan-African business transformation powered by data, which resulted in a new internal movement in the Bank. This is their story and the power of their diversity in pioneering organizational change.

story:
A Spiritual Handbook for Children (of All Ages)

Bursting with joy on every page, Noble Beings illumines our innate spiritual nature inspiring a deep and lasting awareness of important foundational topics for a meaningful and happy life, such as:

  • Who we truly are
  • How to live
  • How to pray
  • How to treat others

Designed to help children grasp and memorize 39 life-long gems of guidance from the Baha'i writings, and to rekindle child-like luminescence in grown-ups.

A great gift for children (of all ages) to empower them to be, and grow into the noble beings they are meant to be!

 

 

A Look Inside


39 beautiful original illustrations, in a high quality, hardcover book, celebrating the garden of humanity, and reminding us what love in action can look like.

All quotes directly from the writings of the Baha'i Faith.

 

 

The Mission 

The inspiration for this project was love. Culturally, children are exposed to a lot of images of material goods to aspire for, and examples of questionable behavior to idolize. I wanted to create a book that would be attractive to children and provide tools to help them visualize spiritual qualities. As well as one that would make people of any age light up. 

My deepest hope is that children growing up with this book will never have to lose their innate radiance and instead be supported (by the principles and images in this book) in developing those radiant qualities into mature spiritual strength. 

 

The Baha'i Writings

If you are new to this topic, put very simply, the Baha'i Faith is a beautiful, geographically wide-spread and independent world religion that promotes:

  • the oneness of God (that loving, creative Force we humans call lots of different names in different cultures, languages, and traditions)
  • the oneness of religion (to be kind, loving and honest is at the heart of every Faith)
  • the oneness of mankind

The language of the Baha'i writings is elevated by contemporary standards, but having grown up with them I can attest that it IS possible for youngsters to understand them. It may in fact help develop vocabulary and powers of expression. (It did for me.)

I was mindful to select quotes that are spiritually universal: accessible to any believer in a Higher Power, that do not contain faith-specific symbolism or jargon.

As well as quotes straightforward enough for a child to understand (with a little explanation). 

You can learn more about Baha'i in a video I made here, or the one Rainn Wilson made here. 

If you are a Baha’i, or are a fan of the Faith, there is no question you will LOVE THIS BOOK and want to give it to everyone you know. I created the Baha’i book I always wanted.

 

Where You Come In!

Your orders are a spectacular win-win-win!

Your BOOK orders (win!) help offset my self-publishing production costs (win + thank you!) and together WE positively impact lives by getting this book into as many hands as possible! (Win + high-five!)

As a "thank you" and incentive for your generous contributions I'm offering fun extras like interactive storytimes with me, similar to these videos (virtually or in person, based on location), as well as packages that include excellent deals on my signed fine art prints.

Limited Availability

I hope this book remains in print and widely available for eons, but I am a one-woman-art-operation and much will depend on how this sales campaign goes. Order now, and "stock up" is my encouragement! 

Charitable Giving to Children & Neighborhoods in Need

If you choose to offer some of your books as charitable gifts through me, here are some of the places your contributions may go:

In addition to donating books, I am committed to providing a significant portion of profits from the sale of this book to organizations working to rescue and rehabilitate children from human trafficking. Your orders now (covering costs) will help ensure there are profits from this book to support this worthwhile cause.

Self-Publishing

This may come as a surprise but the publishing market has not yet caught on to the commercial viability of spiritual children's books. We can change that! (The world is hungry for art that reflects and inspires our higher nature, instead of lower.) What this means for now is that I have (single-handedly - hear me roar!) designed, illustrated and promoted this book, as well as fronted ALL costs. For the detail-oriented among you, here is the breakdown:

Made in U.S.A.
Supporting Small Business & Craftsmanship all the way!

 

Risks & Challenges

Seeing you have read down this far I must say you are incredibly good looking and a truly amazing, insightful person! Thank you for your interest. With the constant upheavals this year, as well as Covid-19 related slow-downs there may be delays outside of my control.

You will GET YOUR BOOKS even if I don't reach my Indiegogo financial goal. . . but please help me make the goal so I can continue to offer this book and even . . . turn it in to a series! (Vote with your purchases if you like that idea :)

If you order by Friday, November 13 you have my solemn pledge that I will do absolutely everything within my power to get your books to you in time for the seasonal, gift-giving holidays. 

 

Other Ways You Can Be Involved

Please help spread the word about this book and this 30 day order window. Call, text, email, and facetime all your friends and relatives. Leave notes on your neighbors’ doorsteps ;)

If you know any wealthy elites, be sure to let them in on the opportunity ;)

You can use Indiegogo's social media sharing tools at the top of this page to post on FB & Twitter. This helps a lot!

 


 

 

 

 

Truly,

Leave notes on your neighbors’ doorsteps ;)If you know any wealthy elites, be sure to let them in on the opportunity ;)You can use Indiegogo's social media sharing tools at the top of this page to post on FB & Twitter. This helps a lot! 
    Truly,

story:
Story of My Book

Redefining Music is a book about how music has evolved and the people who create these changes. In it, I draw connections between a wide range of musicians and genres as they influence each other to create the musical landscape we see today.

My name is Jacob Pellegrino and I am the author of Redefining Music. I wrote this book because I have a passion for music and would like to share my enthusiasm and knowledge with others. I noticed that many people do not realize the importance of the artist as music evolves and wanted to emphasize the role of the creator while helping people to hear new music by featuring artists across a wide range of genres, time periods, and backgrounds.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover the distinct role of musical innovators in the evolution of music. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for music. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you to better understand artists who have changed music.

In this book, you'll learn about how music changes over time and the people who drive that evolution. You'll hear stories such as...

  • When Bruce Pavitt, the founder of Sub Pop Records (the label Nirvana started on), met Kurt Cobain, Kurt didn’t even talk about his band (Nirvana). His biggest claim to fame was being a roadie for the Melvins.
  • Tony Iommi lost two of his fingertips when he was 17 and had to relearn how to play guitar with his fingers after creating prosthetic fingertips for them. This change deeply influenced Black Sabbath’s sound with lower tunings and a new style of playing.
  • Kanye West wrote the album 808s & Heartbreak after the death of his mother and his separation from his fiancee. The album addresses West’s heavy emotions and sadness relating to those events and his troubles caused by fame by eschewing rap. Its sound and emotional openness deeply influenced rap as a genre.

You will love this book if you enjoy music, history, attending concerts, and/or play an instrument.
 

Redefining Music is a nonfiction book that speaks to both passionate and casual music listeners who want to look at musical evolution and the interrelation between different genres in a new way.
 

What I Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Spring.


When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

 

About the Author

Jacob Pellegrino is a computer science major at Rice University in Houston, TX. He is an Eagle Scout and an avid collector of vinyl records.

He wrote this book due to a deep curiosity about artists who seem at first glance to be polar opposites influence each other. He hopes the book helps people to see how differing genres influence one another and how changes in music are driven by musical innovators.

His passions include playing guitar and visiting record stores. He also enjoys playing with his dog, Diesel, and listening to new music at the gym or while walking.

For more information, you can connect with Jacob Pellegrino at jdpellegrino99@gmail.com and at @jdpellegrino99.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #RedefiningMusic and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Jacob Pellegrino

story:
About the author and this project!

Hi! My name is Abioseh Cole. I am a nationally recognized poet, teacher, and author, and I am so excited to start this campaign for my children's board book, I Am Not Food! Please help me make this happen!

The book was inspired by a poem that I wrote a few years ago that marked a deeper commitment to the animals for me. It was written from the perspective of animals, declaring, "I am not food!" 

I am partnering with Vegan Publishers to put out this book. There is a huge need for children's books that reinforce simple yet fundamental principles for helping parents teach kids about the ethics of animal use. Surprisingly, there are currently no board books for the youngest of children that counter the idea that some animals are here on Earth merely to be consumed by humans. 

As a parent myself, I wanted to provide a resource for other parents who need support in raising their kids to understand that nonhuman animals are not here for us; they have their own lives, personalities, and abilities. They are definitely not food, which is a concept that kids can easily understand.

With this book and the poem from which it derived, I also wanted to convey that other animals have the strong will to live just like you and me, hence the powerful refrain, “I am not food!” I wanted to create a book that was powerful and life-affirming, and that was positive in spirit so that it would be appropriate for young children. 

I’m thrilled that my book was illustrated by the amazing Kayleigh Castle, illustrator of my favorite children’s book “That’s Not My Mommas’ Milk!” Kayleigh’s style and adorable animal characters were a perfect fit for “I Am Not Food.”

Where does my money go?

Our goal is to raise $6,000 to complete this project. Your contribution will go directly to completing, printing, and distributing this book. The reason there aren't more board books with animal rights themes is because they are expensive to produce and are priced low, so it is difficult for smaller publishers to afford to publish them. For your contribution, you will receive a gift from us ranging from a post card to a personalized illustration of you and your child. You will also receive our deepest thanks and appreciation for making the book happen! Without your support, this book won't make it into the hands of parents who can use it.

Campaign perks

We have a variety of perks that you can purchase in order to support this campaign. You can purchase a signed copy of the book, an eBook, tee shirts, or a limited addition illustration print from the book. Also, you can receive an original personalized print of you and your child created by the illustrator, Kayleigh Castle!

Other ways you can help!

Financial contributions are a key part to making this book a reality, but getting our message out to as many people as possible is also vital. Sharing, posting, and talking about this campaign with your family, friends, and anyone you know will help this project reach its goal and get more support for our message. 

When will I get my book?

Books will be delivered within two months after the campaign ends!
